text:
Pours a hazy, muddled golden-peach colour, initially generating nearly two fingers of soapy, bright white foam at the surface. It steadily dissipates over the course of the next five minutes or so, leaving a creamy-looking collar and thin cap behind in its wake. A quick swirl manages to give the head new life, but only briefly; this is also the only way I seem to be able to get much in the way of lace. It might not win a tripel beauty contest, but the aroma is absolutely to die for. I'm getting a wallop of stone fruit on the nose, especially apricots and juicy peach, with distinct notes of lemon peel, orange zest and white grape. Subtle banana esters, clove phenols and candi sugar sweetness, with grassy hay and some spiciness.

I love the taste of most tripels, and this one is not an exception to the rule. Grainy malts, candi sugar sweetness and banana are apparent right off the starting gun, though the stone fruit and citrus elements noted in the aroma are somewhat subdued here. Hints of apricot, apple skin, white grape and orange peel surface briefly, only to be overcome on the back end by this beer's assertive yeasty qualities - plus a little help from some grassy, spicy hops. Finishes spicy, with suggestions of clove, white pepper, and a light, bready malt sweetness. Not particularly dry, though the aftertaste does have an astringent tendency. Medium in body, with fiercely potent carbonation that prickles the surface of the palate and foams up in the mouth. I like a good, crisp bite from my tripels, but this bottle goes a little overboard. No biggie; it happens sometimes with these bottle-conditioned Belgians - it's still an exquisitely well-crafted beer that completely masks its strong alcohol content.

Final Grade: 4.38, a brown-nosing A grade. I'm far from impartial when it comes to tripels - particularly when it comes to the ones which have been imported directly from Belgium. So it really shouldn't be surprising when I state that I highly recommend Gouden Carolus Tripel, or that I find it to be one of the finest examples of the style that I've had in recent memory. It's certainly not flawless - with the unnecessarily foamy mouthfeel being my main point of contention - but the fact remains that I'm still really enjoying my glass.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
En botella. La espuma ha durado un buen rato, dejando una fina capa. De color ambar poco transparente y con sabor especiado, sin quedar apagado por los grados de alcohol.

Pours minimal head that quickly goes away and just leaves a very thin coating. Has a slightly cloudy golden appearance. Aromas are pretty yeasty, breads, citrus hops and light roasted malts. Flavours are strong citrus hops, yeast, raisins, lemon and orange peel. A little bit of spices too. Has a yeasty tingling mouthfeel. A slight warming sensation. Full bodied. Really smooth and goes down pretty easy for a 9%abv beer.

Colore giallo opalescente, schiuma corposa e persistente, sentori di malto e frutta, al palato agrumi e accenni di spezie, leggermente secca con finale astringente, alcol ben mascherato. Una facile bevuta per una triple ben fatta.

Pours golden with big dense head. Aroma of malt,pineapple, some spices, ginger, yeast, light sweetness. Taste of fruits, some cinnamon, light yeast, pineapple, some caramel, herbs, nutmeg, cream. Decent tripel,but overcarbonatated.
De très belles notes gourmandes pour cette triple avec une fraîcheur et légèreté malgré tout ! Très bonne !

Pours golden with big dense head. Aroma is fresh fruits, citrus, pineapple, some spices, ginger, yeast, light sweetness. Taste is fresh, fruits, some cinnamon, light yeast, pineapple, some caramel, herbs, nutmeg, cream. Very nice beer!
Bue au Berthom à Strasbourg. Très bonne bière belge. Très typée belge. Un délice.

33 cl bottle @ home. Hazy, deep golden colour with an orange shine. Nice white, foamy head. Sweet fruity aroma, bananas, peach, honey. Ditto taste, perfumed, with a dry hoppy, bitter finish. Creamy body. Good tripel.
33 cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bière. Triple assez fruitée et agréable.
Aroma and very banana but nice. Mouthfeel medium thick, fizzy carbonation. A bit of a standard tripel, nice but nothing special to my taste. Maybe Im just not into tripels...

Très belle robe dorée transparente, avec des reflets légèrement cuivrés, surmontée dune très épaisse écume blanche à bulles fines. Le nez est enchanteur et rappelle immanquablement la Tripel Karmeliet. Les arômes sont riches et complexes, donc il va falloir un peu de doigté pour les détailler... Les malts sont suaves avec des notes de miel, de chocolat au lait et de gelée de coin. On distingue un côté floral fort intéressant qui dispute aux notes végétales des houblons. Le fruit nest pas en reste avec des arômes nets dabricot et de pêche, de kiwi, de citron vert, de pamplemousse, de raisin, de pomme, de poire, de reine-claude, de cerise griotte, de melon, de banane... Cest capiteux à souhait et extrêmement gourmand. En bouche, lalcool nous invite au voyage tout en souplesse et surtout, la texture est dune douceur incroyable. On dirait quon déguste un nectar de fruit, cest impressionnant ! La carbonatation est vive et vient redonner un coup de peps à lensemble. Les sucres sont agréables et rappellent vraiment la Tripel Karmeliet qui pour moi est la bière qui se rapproche le plus de cette Carolus Tripel. Lamertume est là, tapie dans lombre, elle fait son office en sous-main, jamais ostentatoire mais toujours à luvre, en particulier sur le bout de la langue après quelques secondes. On relève aussi de belles notes citronnées vivifiantes. On retrouve en bouche toutes les saveurs du nez, la fleur et le fruit en particulier labricot, omniprésent. La longueur est bonne, sur les malts, le fruit, une pointe de poivre agréable et excitante, cette très légère amertume et un alcool dune finesse incroyable. Le final est à limage de cette triple : en douceur, riche, souple, complexe et si simple à la fois. En poursuivant la dégustation après 10 bonnes minutes de sage repos, la bière soxygénant un peu, je retrouve des arômes de fraise surpuissants que je navais pas encore décelé. Incroyable... Du très très grand art comme seul Het Anker et quelques autres brasseries de haute-voltige savent nous offrir... Bouteille 33cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Egrève.
Could probably argue that it taste, smell and look like honey. Nice large bubbles and very (dangerously) drinkable.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2017 Light orange with slightest haziness. Dense and healty white head shows good retention and nice lacing. Aroma shows dough, fresh fruitiness (peach, pear) and a pleasantly lively spiciness. Nice intensity. Taste has a sweet malty base with white bread and slight honey. Fruity notes as the smell suggested and a delicate spiciness. Overall very much on the sweet side but nicely attenuated by a hint of delicate acidity. Perfectly hidden alcohol. Medium to dense body; medium to high carbonation not compromising a pleasantly creamy, soft mouthfeel. A very good tripel.

Blond hazy colured with thick and persistent white hat. Floreal and acid smell with toasted flavour. The taste of caramel, malt and cereals aare predominant. High carbonation. Sweet with medium lasting bitter end. Top for tripel lovers.

Une bière blonde, avec une grosse carbonatation, un peu trouble, et présentant une petite effervescence. Au nez, la levure est bien présente, très poivrée, avec également des relents doranges et dagrumes au final. En bouche, cest assez effervescent, avec un goût plutôt floral, avec une levure belge qui est également présente, sans prendre lascendant. Le tout est vraiment raffiné, avec des notes dagrumes également en finale. Belle bière.
Robe blonde trouble mousse blanche épaisse. Nez fruité, céréales, épices. Bouche épicée, fruitée. Très bonne triple.
Bottle, 330 ml from Beergium, shared with Max and JFK10000. Pours golden, medium white head. Spicy, fruity, caramel, perfumy, yeasty. Sweet. Medium bodied. Nice.

Bottle. Hazy pale gold. Nice, fairly lively carbonation. Malty base (sweet malts, light caramel). Fruity (oranges, apples). Yeasty & spicy. Hoppy (floral hops). Very nice fruit/malt/hop/yeast/spice balance. Very smooth, soft (not harsh), subtle. ABV not noticeable. Sweet fruity malty spicy taste. Very nice Tripel. (2008)
Goldgelb, trüb mit feiner weißen Schaumkrone. Hefig, malzig, würzig, pfeffrig, frisch. Gutes erfrischendes triple

Nice fruity smell. Lovely fine foam. Very fruity. Apricots, peaches, oranges. Bread, hint of vanilla, hint of lemon peel. Truly balanced. Not unlike a Karmeliet but perhaps a little fruitier whereas Karmeliet is creamier.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a hazy yellow to golden with a medium bubbly white head and an aroma of banana, pear, ripe fruits, yeast, mandarin, toffee, coreander, malts and lime. The taste is medium sweet with a nice medium lasting bitter finish. Really nice

Goudgeel, witte schuimkraag die blijft, licht wazig, veel koolzuur zichtbaar. 
Aroma: Kruidig, koriander, peper, iets munt, Belgische gist.
Smaak: Kruidigheid en spicy pepers net als in het aroma, lekker fruitig zoet, iets bloemen, moutig en licht bitter met een mooie Belgische gist smaak van kruidnagel en banaan en peer.....zelf wat bubblegum. 
Mooi subtiel met iets alcohol warmte......erg makkelijk drinkbaar voor zon hoge ABV.
Volle body, afdronk is fruitig en kruidig. 
Keyword is: BALANS!  Top tripel.

Cerveza color ámbar con la característica turbidez, corona de espuma blanca de buena retención, burbujas compactas. Aromas a especias, pimienta, florales. Al paladar de fácil beber, sabores frutales, carbonatacion moderada y al final toques a pimienta. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: FEB 6, 2017 Aus der Flasche in Mechelen getrunken. Trübes Gold mit extremen Schaum. Unauffällige Nase. Ausgewogen und gut eingebundener Alkohol.
330 ml bottle from Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Lemon, basil, coriander. Rather fruity and spicy taste. Also slightly sour. Bitter finish. Very refreshing Tripel. Really nice!

0,75l bottle from Saveur Biere. Clear, light golden beer with big cloudy head. Aroma is strong and wonderful. It has flowers, soap, exotic fruits and cereal + spicy pepper. Taste has also quality. It has exotic fruits, spicy pepper, flowers and malts & toffee. Aftertaste has lots of spicy pepper. Full body, but refreshing and easy to drink. Very high quality beer with spicy and fresh fruits.

Bottle. Hazy straw yellow. Huge white head. Stays for long. Luxury lacing. Spicy aroma with obvious coriander. Perfume. Pale malts. I imagined a strong witbier while smelling it. Medium body. The flavours palette is more interesting. Soft lollipop malts, spicy yeast, perfume, fruit (pear). Light bitterness. Alcohol well hidden. Perfect balance. I admit it is very well made, thats why I am going to give a high rate. Still it is far from my favourites with the style.
cereal, citrus, cheese, golden, clear, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, lively, long finish,

The aroma is floral, pepper, Belgian yeast, fruit, bubble gum. Flavor is. The same. Appearance is a slightly clear yellow, white head. The finish is sweet, peppery. Medium in body. Nice example of the style.

Hazy golden coloured beer with a big, white, good lasting head. Aromas of white pepper, orange, sugar, belgian yeast, bubblegum, spices, overall fruity. Taste is medium sweet and light acidic, wheat, orange, malt in a dry finish. Creamy texture, medium body, average carbonation. A light one, even with 9% abv.

Pours hazy straw colour with a big fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet and citrusy. Taste is sweet with notes of lemon, orange, black pepper, mild grassy hops, and slight maltiness. Full bodied with plenty of carbonation. A bit too sweet but quite flavourful.
Вкусный Бельгий& трипль, красивы& цвет, хороший аромат и вкус, алкогол& почти не чувству& приятно& послевк& (Bottle 0,33/ 9%)
From bottle. With white small cap. Cloudy light amber color.A bit sour taste. Long aftertaste.

0,33 l bottle 
Apperance: Hazy yellow / orange body, with a large white head. Aroma: l malts, sweet and fruits. Taste: Sweet and spicey, malts, apricots and citrus, spice,some belgian yeast and gentle bitterness. Quite average but solidly balanced out to be slightly more as its innitially suggests. medium body,average carbonation.
Bottle from beerhawk. Hazy golden beer with medium head. Aroma of yeast, light malts and lemon. Taste is lemon, yeast, dry, malts and a little funk. Really good carbonation and body. Excellent stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Cette bière est parfaitement opaque, couleur jus de poires, avec une mousse blanche plus que généreuse ; le nez est tout simplement séduisant, avec des fruits (fraises, clémentines) et du pain. La bouche est très fruitée, assez ronde, ramenant les arômes mentionnés en nez, et y ajoutant une belle complexité de houblons, et une signature imparable de levure belge. La finale est doucereuse, avec un peu de crayeux qui rappelle un peu une bière de blé. Extrêmement agréable, ronde et envoûtante, démontrant beaucoup de profondeur, elle est un exemple non-typique mais néanmoins classique du genre.

Look: orange, hazy, not very stable white head.

Aroma: fruity, slighlty sweet and rotten, light spicy notes.
Taste: light sweetness, light astringency, very light spicy bitterness.
Flavour: rotten apricotes, ground black pepper, corieander, light yeasty notes.
Finish is slightly astringent with light candy sweetness.

I prefer other kind of tripel, that is more dry and spicy.
However this is a good belgian strong beer.

Hazy orange with a white head. Immediatly after pouring theres a strong aroma of orange peel and spices floating in the air. Tastes like a standard triple, sweet but not too much, and I can feel a little of alchool in the the troat. A bit boring honestly, better stick to the Classic.

From bottle. Pours a cloudy straw with medium head and good retention. Aroma is sweet and perfumed in a good way. Drinks as the aroma, with nice sweetness and a bit of perfume a hint of bitterness and a little gassy. Very interesting and complex beer
Remains a classical divine beer. Brilliant, but I will not drive half an hour to get such a bottle.
UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 Zeer lekkere tripel, met een volle en hartige smaak. Hop en mout, graan. Pittig bier. Geslaagd.

Bue 1 an et 5 mois avant DLC. Bière blonde, pas de carbo, fin col de mousse à tenue exceptionnelle. Arômes exceptionnels de fruits jaunes : poire, banane, pêche...? Final sur le fruit, le sucre un peu épicée. Très belle rondeur. Enorme bière ! Peut être ma bière préférée ?
Bottle. Pours somewhat cloudy golden with nice thick white head. Aroma is malt, candy, herbs. Taste is sweet and bitter with malt, herbal hops, yeast, alcohol.

Bought from drankdozijn in a 750ml bottle. Appearance: Nice golden, slightly fuzzy beer with a nice white head. Smell: fruity, malty and herbal. Taste: fruity, alcohol and spices with mild hops at the end. Rather complex palate. Almost too complex. Should drink it like wine. Very interesting.

Malt/aroma combination reminds honey notes. Not as complex as I used to expect from tripels, rather decent, not much notes from coriander. One time try. I think the yeast used is ... too simple kind. Almost no fruity esters in aroma.

330ml bottle from LCBO. 9.0% alc./vol. Pours an opaque deep gold colour with two finger of lasting head. Aromas of banana esters from the yeast, light citrus notes of grapefruit and oranges, and moderate spice notes of coriander. Taste of bananas, citrus, apples, with notes of black pepper. Creamy mouthfeel. Reminds me of Tripel Karmeliet. Excellent, I love it.
Bottle. Golden color with thick white head. Aroma has citrus, yeast, some spices. Taste is fruity with long a bit sweet aftertaste. Flavors of fruits, caramel, yeast, malt and some spices.

Bottle. Light hazy golden. Pretty belgian all the way. Honey, meadowy florals, perfumy citrus peely, belgy estery spicy aroma. MEd bodied, fruity belgy yeasty flavour, lotsa citrus, somewhere between lemon and orange, peel, cut with the whites on. Sweet pale honey, boozy coriander, biit sweet woody spicy. Lots happening, easy though, light feeling drink. Overall feels just a bit too boozy.

Hazy orange pour, large white head. Bready, yeasty, lots of lemon zest, tropical fruit, and hints of banana. Very lively mouth feel, and carb. Medium bitterness, refreshing, and crisp. More zesty hops and yeasty esters with tropical fruit. Great tripel.
Bottle from Real Ale Store, Newark. Rich pale golden colour with a big white head. Aroma is big fruity, malts, banana and citrus. Light sweet citrus bitter and deep.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2017 33cl-fles bij Bistro De Waterkant te Moen. U: Troebel blond met mooie witte schuimkraag. G: Kruiden domineren de geur vooral anijs en koriander. Ruikt ook zeer zoet. S: Moutzoet, gist en opnieuw zeer kruidig. Licht bittertje en alcoholwarmte in de afdronk. M: Stevige body met medium carbonatie.

From the 750 ml. bottle dated 13/04/2015. It pours a handsome looking golden tone with a foamy cream colored head on top that lingers and laces. The aroma emits an enchanting floral, rose, or blossom character with some apple or pear a little underneath. No booze for 9%. Medium to full body. Smooth and creamy too. A big floral, flowery taste with a hint of apple and an herbal and pepper-like finish. Just delightful.

the aroma is fruity and malty with hints of sweet wine, raisin, yeast, flowers, toffee and anise... the taste is malty and fruity with notes of apple, candy, plum, sweet wine, yeast and some spices... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...
Pours a hazy golden yellow from the bottle with bubbly white head that dissipates to leave good lace. Aroma of sweet fruity Belgian esters. Taste follows, super fruity and sweet. Might age well.

Bottle (from beergium?). Pours golden with huge whiteish head. The head stays. Aroma is fruity, soapy, esthery, some citrus and apples. Flavor is sweet and bitter, sugar, fruits, citrus, lemon, malt, spicy tingle. Finish is dry bitter with some alcohol burn. Overall: well made, but no wow.

Bottle at De Spot, Middelburg. Watching Gemma Ray! Clear golden with white head. Sweet malts, spices, lemon, banana, orangepeel, cloves, doughy yeast. Medium sweet, light bitter. Medium body, a lot of fizzy carbonation. Some cool milky feel through it. Spiced sweet finish.

Colore arancio pallido.
Schiuma bianca generosa e persistente.
Aroma, dolce floreale e speziato e crosta di pane.
In bocca, il corpo è morbido ed il gusto è sorprendentemente abboccato. Lalcol è presente ma molto discreto. Lattacco è dolce poi arrivano le note floreali e speziate ed un inatteso amaro di luppolo fresco, non invadente ma capace di bilanciare la dolcezza iniziale. Finale secco e piccante.

Bottle from Cork & Fork in Gainesville, VA
Aroma: caramel, floral, honey, tropical fruit
Appearance: clear golden with a white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious
Aroma super agradável, cor dourada e espuma branca. Sabor bem balanceado, com certo adocidado em seu final.
0.33l bottle. Slightly hazy orange body, white head. Aroma and of bread, honey, orange zest, banana, grapes and some medicinal and grassy hops. Sweet and fruity tripel. I like it a lot.

Bière jaune-orangée, bien voilée avec particules visibles, effervescence élevée, et surmontée dun col blanc immaculé, pas tellement large, mais très dense, très mousseux, cotonneux même, collant et résistant. Arômes de pain frais, pâtisserie, sucre brut et miel, avec beaucoup de fruits du verger (pomme, pêche, poire) et quelques esters fruités (banane, mangue et encore poire!). Par moment, les effluves semblent plus rôtis, céréale rôtie à tendance noisette, voire même malt fumé à tendance charcuterie. Aussi, odeur de houblon qui semble principalement herbacé (gazon, feuille verte, un peu herbes aromatiques) mais également floral, et on note quelques nuances de boisé, dépices (clou de girofle et poivre) et de vanille dans les arômes. Nez très agréable, très intéressant, complexité et intensité élevées! En bouche, pétillement plutôt faible sur la langue, onctuosité élevée au palais, le breuvage est rond, moelleux, velouté, soyeux et légèrement éthylique. Au goût, entrée maltée de pain frais, pâtisserie, sucre brut et miel, avec, comme le nez lannonçait, beaucoup de fruité venant conjointement du malt et des esters. Pomme, pêche, banane, mangue mais surtout de la poire! Le houblon demeure plus en retrait et semble davantage floral quau nez, et accompagne le dégustateur jusquà une finale relativement sèche à lamertume plutôt légère mais tout de même bien sentie, alcool perceptible mais fort bien intégré. Tout comme au nez, les saveurs semblent par moment plus grillé et rôti avec bonne tendance noisette et même légèrement fumé, charcuterie, boisé, épices, vanille Ça apporte une impressionnante richesse au breuvage! Excellente intégration des différentes saveurs entre elles, très bon goût, complexité et intensité en bouche bien élevées. Excellente bière!

Nose is banana, spice, breads. Pours golden yellow, a finger of head. Taste is sweet, but bready and some spice. Palate sets it apart. Smooth, with light effervescence. Some booze. Delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

La Gouden Carolus Tripel serait brassée depuis 1491 et pour être précis, à son origine, élaborée pour les chevaliers de la toison dor. En versant le fameux breuvage dans mon calice, je me voyais en effet très bien en chevalier à la recherche de son Graal, et tout dabord par la noblesse certaine que présente la Gouden Carolus Tripel en verre. 
Sa couleur est dun superbe blond doré, et elle est dotée dune très forte effervescence et dune mousse blanche abondante et homogène. 
Au nez, les flaveurs sont largement citronnées, arrondies par des effluves de blé et corsées par une pointe de coriandre.
A la dégustation, cest limpression de puissance qui prédomine. Après une première attaque, fraîche sur le citron et le blé, la seconde attaque, sur lamertume et le houblon, est dune corpulence exceptionnelle. Les arômes, liquoreux, de sauternes et riesling vendanges tardives, sont particulièrement développés. Lalliance malt, houblon et levure joue à merveille. La finale, longue, vous fait alors apprécier toute lamertume de cette bière.
Les 9 % Abv sont largement adoucis par un taux de sucre important. Ceci pourrait expliquer le conseil de dégustation à 7°C, température particulièrement basse et donc surprenante. En dégustant la Gouden Carolus Tripel à température ambiante, comme me la récemment conseillé un sage zythologue, celle-ci vous laissera découvrir toutes ses saveurs et sa complexité. Cependant la présence dun fort taux de sucre résiduel vous laisse une impression sucrée marquée en lèvre et en fin de dégustation une bouche pâteuse. Dommage....je vais me remettre à la recherche de mon Graal.

75 cl bottle. Hazy hayish yellow, huge white head with tons of lacings. Aroma is citrus, medium sweet malty notes, grass, hay, slight yeasty and fruity bananish notes. Very clean nose. Taste is medium sweet with malty sweet notes, fruit and even slight vanilla, citrus in the front, yeasty spicy notes, slight alcohol and a dry finish. Medium to big body, medium carbo. Very clean, punchy and gentle at the same time.
From tap. Yellow-orange with a white head. Mild aroma of citric fruits along with some yeast. Medium to full body with a medium sweetness and a very light bitterness. Taste of sweet grains and prune.
33 cl från Dranken geers i Gent. En trevlig trippel. Lagom söt och stark med liten eftersmak.

Drunk from 33cl bottle bought from brewery in Mechelen. Strong triple blonde ale.
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blond bier met rijkelijk wand klevende witte schuimkraag. Geur: frisse hopgeur, fruitig, bloemig, perzik, licht zoet en een vleugje hars. Smaak: licht bitter, hop, perzik, sinaasappel, licht zoet. Mooi in balans. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Medium volmondig. Afdronk: licht bitter. Lekkere tripel!

Bottle. 
Pours straw yellow with a white head. 
Sweet, smooth with lemon grass.

Bottle from Belgoklubben 
Slight hazy, pale yellow, frothy white head
Aroma of citrus, yeast, mandarin grass
Taste sweet citrus, round, yeast. 
Slight alcoholic. Tart.
Beer tasting @ 4/8-16. Fruity and yeasty with spices, also sweetness. Body is medium, the finish is dry, yeasty and spicy.
Bottle from belgolådan @ fillepolos place. Pours a light golden colour beer with a medium head. Yeasty with herbs and spices some fruity notes. Dry finish

L:
-pours a cloudy golden with a huge,foamy,white head
-medium to high carbonation visible
S:
-biscuity,lemon,doughy,spicy,coriande bread
T:
-spicy,grassy,honey,white bread
-medium bitterniss for the style
F:
-medium to high carbonation
-medium to full body
-alcohol noticeable
O:
A very good Tripel

Apparence : Dorée, reflets jaunes pâles, translucide, gros col blanc crémeux et aéré, bonne rétention, effervescence moyenne et peu rapide, très belle dentelle.

Nez : Agrumes frais, surtout le citron (ça me fait même penser à de la meringue!), notes céréalières, un peu de banane et de poivre. 

Goût : Fraîche, notes céréalières, légèrement fruitée (pas autant quau nez), côté rustique ou encore herbacé, mi sucrée, présence du goût de levure belge. 

Sensation : Effervescence faible, corps moyen, huileuse, belle chaleur de lalcool, finale de longueur moyenne. 

Bref : Le nez ma paru plus envoûtant que ce que jai retrouvé en bouche. La sensation par contre est très à point. Malheureusement, je trouve que le palais déçoit quelque peu, notamment au niveau des esters fruités que lon aurait pu croire pouvoir les déceler davantage alors quau nez ils étaient tout de même bien présents.
Malgré tout, elle remplit très bien son rôle de Triple : elle se boit comme un charme!

33cl from a gifpack. Pours clear fizzy and blond. Thick soapy head. Aroma of citrus fruit and grassy hops. Alcohol is in aroma and taste. Strongly carbonated, below medium bodied, thin and rather watery. Did not meat expectations for a high-rated tripel.

0,33l bottle. Cloudy golden colour with long lasting big foamy white head. Be careful becouse the beer has high carbonation and can easily get an enormus head and flow out from the glass. Aroma: Very inetnse fruity, candy sugar, cheese. Spectacular. Taste: Amazing. Strong sweet start rich in flavours. Well balaced light bitter sour moutfeel too but the sweet caracter doesont disappear. Medium body with fizzy carbonation. Long sweet/sour finish. One of the best tripels.
Nose is really fresh and indulging for a belgian beer. Colour is hazy golden and with firm white head. Taste is yeast and some bitterness with malty notes. Palate is slight bitter but agreeable.

Hazy golden ochre, huge off-white dense creamy head, good lacing. Looks nice. Sweet and fruity aroma, coriander, lightly strawberry, apple, vanilla. Crisp & light palate, sweet, potent carbonation, long finish is fruity, light sour notes balance. Great, refreshing, good balance, great looks and palate, very easy to drink.

Bottle. Pours almost clear golden with white head. Aroma is estery fruity with white pepper, light malt and citrus notes. Taste is is light malty and complex fruity with citrus, white pepper and ends in a semi-sweet fruity aftertaste. Good tripel.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty estery aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty finish with weak hints of caramel.

Amarillo opaco con muy buena espuma y retención. Lúpulo especiado-floral alto, malta maltoso moderado, notas acarameladas, chicle, fenoles especiados (pimienta negra, pimienta blanca, vainilla), ésteres a piña, acetato de isoamilo, umami, concentrado ave, lúpulo de amargor moderado. Final especiado-maltoso semi seco, con cuerpo y buena carbonatación.
Espuma fugaz. Aroma de frutas de frutado. Gosto segue o aroma de frutas com leve apimentado e álcool bem presente. Gostei da carbonatação. Muito bem equilibrada
Golden beer, medium head. Aroma is yeast, some fruit, Taste is the same, good triple

Nice tripel. Malty, caramel, juicy fruitness, fresh. Intense sweetness
Very nice tripel maybe bit too one dimentional sweet
Aroma: abelu ziedi, maza lakrica, smagonka no augliem, smarzo pec svaigiem darba cimdiem. Garsa: salda ziedu un vinogu misa.

Kolor jasno z?oty, klarowny. Bia?a, bardzo wysoka i bardzo trwa?a piana pozostawia na szkle liczne ?lady.
Szkoda bo w aromacie jest bardzo s?abo, troch? jasnych owoców z bia?ymi winogronami i lekkie nuty przyprawowo korzenne.
Smak wytrawny, owocowo kwiatowy, tylko delikatny.
Goryczka niska i krótka, na finiszu. Wysycenie wysokie, pasuje. Niestety odrobin? wychodzi alkohol, nie jest on jednak na tyle intensywny aby wp?ywa? negatywnie na smak.
750ml bottle @ Man in the moon, Stockholm. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Bananas, yeast, spices, sugar. Easy to drink, yet complex. Great brew.
Huge head, hazy gold to amber. Strong aroma, banana, mint, citrus. Spicy sweet and bitter, yeasty, light bitter aftertaste. Full body, long finish.

Deep hazy golden color.pours with a fizzy white head. Tons of bubbling. Aroma is toffee and caramel malt. Flavor is same with a little bit of fruit added. The strength is obvious. Palate is a little thick.
Flaska från Belgoklubben. Ljust gul med massor vitt skum. Övermogen banan och koriander i doften. Söt med liknande smaker som doften.

A very nice tripel. Classic taste, as a tripel should be. Pours light amber with nice foam on the top. Smells a bit of yeast and a little bit to heavy on the alcohol for my taste. But overall a very good tripel.

330 ml bottle purchased at Julios Liquors approximately 12 months ago. Hazy golden in color with thin head in a chalice. Aroma is candy sugar with the yeast giving a banana and spice like nuance. 
Wheat backbone with integrated yeast and lightly noticeable alcohol that lingers for quite a while. The banana and spice is found again after the sip. Very subdued bitterness in here. A touch high on the booze. Honestly, this is one of the most classic examples of the style you will find. If you dont like this, nothing else in the style will excite you. Classic representation of the style.
Pours a hazy yellow color with a large foamy white head. Notes of green apples, yarn, slightly catty hops, and yeast bread. Comes across pretty thin for 9%.
33cl bottle. Hazy orange pour with a white head. Bananas, coriander, Belgian yeast, floral hops, lemon zest, honey, thyme. Medium bodied with medium carbonation and a sticky sweet aftertaste.
On tap clear light golden beer, thin white head. Hints of citrus, yeast and malt. Pretty nice beer.

Óriási, tartós hab. Gyümölcsös, savanykás illat. Az illat az ízben is visszaköszön, gyümölcsös, savanykás, citromosba hajló íz. Jól kiegyensúlyozott itóka. Ahogy melegszik, egy picit keserűbb lesz, és előbújik egy enyhe karamellás vonal.
bouteille 33 cl - couleur blonde or, belle mousse blanche, odeur houblonné, épicé, goût direct sur le houblon, lépice et finale longue sur lamertume, une bonne bière

On tap. Slightly hazy golden with ample head that very slowly dissipates. Sweet corn flakes, powdered sugar, honey, and floral hoppy nose. Really classy tripel goes down extremely smooth. Great balance of sweet and dry hopped finish. Mid bodied beer but not filling. Would gladly drink again.

On tap at De Minnestreel, Mechelen. So good I had another one immediately after the first. It pours very hazy pale golden with abundant soft white head. Aroma is peach, lemon, biscuit and, overall, lots and lots of cardamom. Mouth feels silky, low carb, fresh and balanced. Long finish, medium bitterness. Very nice.
Zesty, earthy and spicy aroma with heavy banana presens. Malty sweet taste, bit tart, background bitterness. Too carbonated and dry.

Tasted on 4/29/16 from a capped 330mL bottle purchased at Frugal. Pours lightly hazy golden orange with a massive, smooth white head that slowly recedes to thick, rocky lace. The nose is sweet bread and caramel, a touch of honey, with a very distinctive lavender note, and some lightly earthy yeast. The flavor is a ton of honey up front, much more spice than on the nose, lavender, and bread. The body is medium with massive carbonation and a long spicy, lavender, and hot finish.
Plein de saveurs pour cette triple Belge. Encore un plaisir gustatif abordable. Merci la bière.
Flesje bij Bart en Hillig gedronken. Lekker bitter geurend. Goudgeel, ruim schuimend bier. De smaak is hoppig en fruitig. Nasmaak is hoppig, fruitig en zoet.
Bottle from bruxelles, leicester. Clear golden. Aromabis lemongrass, coriander and honey. Taste is sweet and crisp and bitter. Mild carbonation and full bodied. Very ace.

APARIENCIA: de color ámbar con algunos destellos naranjas, turbia, se observa moderada actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma blanca, copiosa de buena retención, burbujas compactas con algunas abiertas.

AROMA: notas de miel, notas de frutos amarillos, cítricos, notas de naranja, lúpulo herbal discreto.

SABOR: la maltosidad resalta, aroma a grano y miel, algunas notas de especias, notas de frutos amarillos, cítricos, muy muy agradable, por ahí predominando de entre todos la naranja; al retrogusto amargor ligero, seco, no astringente, se percibe el alcohol y deja una sensación de calor en la garganta agradable.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo moderado ligero, carbonatación media alta.

RESUMEN: excelente representante del estilo, una cerveza muy buena.
33cl bottle. Pours clear golden colour with a huge good lasting white head. Aroma of sweet pale malt, belgian yeast, spices. Taste of sweet malt, typical belgian yeast, spices, corn.

belle couleur ambre golden. Une mousse épaisse et tenace. Du houblon qui vire sur une longue amertume légère épicée herbée.
Très équilibrée. Une triple de haut niveau. Valeur sure dans les bières faciles à trouver partout.

Aromat: intensywne pomarańcze i przyprawy.
Wygląd: piana dość obfita, barwa złota, klarowne.
Smak: na początku trochę słodkie, bardzo owocowe, głównie pomarańcze i może brzoskwinie, potem dużo przypraw, goryczka niska, świetnie zamaskowany alkohol. Tekstura: średnio pełne, wysokie wysycenie. Ogólne wrażenie: świetne piwo i jednocześnie dobry przykład stylu, mocno owocowe i przyprawowe, alkohol świetnie ukryty, zdradziecko pijalne.

Clear. Two finger foam. Subtle Orange peel,Coriander and Camomile. Dry. Super brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tradição de anos, ingredientes selecionados dão a essa Tripel um sabor frutado com leve picância e muito equilíbrio. Uma das excelentes Tripel "de raiz".

Aroma of ripe, juicy apricot and some spices. Pours golden with nice white foamy head. Taste is medium dry with spices, some apricot, peach, mango. Finish is moderate bitter, alcohol is not noticeable. Overall very good stuff.

Bottle from Kris Wines. Pours almost clear golden amber. The moment I nose this I know its special. Has an aroma like aged Tripel Karmeliet. Big floral, fragrant, orange blossom, orange citrous, yuzu, and underneath theres some bready, brioche malt. Stunningly fragrant nose. Taste is little oily like a good white burgundy, soft carbnation, lots of orange blossom, orange citrous, lots of floral perfume, acidic bitterness, slight white vinous, little dried coriander, dry grassiness.
Color ambra. Buona triple, anche se eccessivamente caratterizzata da note citriche che non mi aspettavo da questo stile. Abbastanza rinfrescante nonostante la gradazione.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A dirty yellow-orange hazy beer with a big white head ; good retention. Fruity nose, very spicy (coriander?), citrus, herb, resin, floral, biscuit. Medium sweet, very spicy, round, light to medium dry bitter refreshing ; warming background. Medium good body, average texture, light oily, average to soft carbonation, spicy dry refershing finish. Overall, a pleasant strong sweet dry spicy ale ; what a pity... Unbalanced spiciness.

Mmmmmm... Cloudy golden with a foamy finger of dense head. Nose all big citrus, grapefruit and tangerine. Taste mildly sweet with all that citrus flowing through mostly grapefruit with a bite of peel, which helps take the edge off that sweetness. Bit of an intense beer, a 33cl bottle makes a good sipper, but not an all-nighter. But still damn delicious, and not available at the LCBO.

Copenhagen 13/2 2016. 75 cl bottle from Meny. According to the label this is part of a series that represents the Belgian flag where this one represents the yellow stripe. Pours hazy yellow with white head. Settles as foamy 1 cm thick layer. Lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma is fruity dominated by tart sour notes of citrus, a little sugary sweetness and notes of yeast. Medium carbonation and oily palate. Taste follows the nose. Subdued sweetness, tart fruit and yeast. Medium bitterness in aftertaste. Nicely balanced tripel who manages to hide the high alcohol content quite well.

The beer purs hazy with a beatiful, thick, yellow colour. A two finger high, creamy, white head that refuses to leave the side of the glass! 

Nose: Belgian yeast, orange, citrus, peach, caramel malt, lemon, honey and grass. 
Taste: Oh! This is good! Sweet caramel, banan, honey, lemon, pepper, green apples and some orange zest. 
Mouthfeel: Very soft, creamy with a small and high, but still very soft, carbonation. A light dry bitterness at the end. Beatiful!
Bottle pours golden with a white head. Aroma of grain, yeast and fruit. Taste is fruit, yeast and malts

Bottle at home. Nicely cloudy golden colour, creamy offwhite head that nicely lasts. Really fruity with hoppy citrus, orange and tangerine, yeasty banana, with big creamy, grainy malts as the backbone. Firm body, medium carbonation. Great Gouden-Carolus-balance.

330 ml bottle. Pours hazy orange with large white head. Aroma of citrus, apricot, yeast. Medium body with average carbonation. Medium, well balanced sweet and bitter taste. Nice apricot flavor in aftertaste.

Nez très fortement abricot ! Fond pêche.
Bouche du même acabit, pas mal de caramel, les fruits jaunes se complètent et fond une belle longueur qui séquilibre avec un petit houblonnage qui donne une finale légèrement sèche. Très peu de levure ce qui évite le côté éc?urant.

33 cl. Belle couleur jaune un peu trouble. Mousse blanche et abondante. Nez subtil de senteurs florales, peut-être la violette et la rose. Bonne carbonation et bouche houblonnée amenant une belle amertume. Une triple malinoise bien équilibrée et très agréable.

Bottle from 2013 at home - Color: hazy golden blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: fruity and yeast domination. Well balanced with sweet malt and candied fruits. Really nice nose. Taste: full body with sweet malt and candied fruits. Notes of orange and apricot. Good yeast balance and amazing attenuation. Aftertaste: yeast and malt. Small alcohol finish.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2016 Bière triple qui se boit facilement, lalcool est bien dissimulé. Arôme agréable de houblon, fruit (citron), ... Belle couleur blonde. Goût fruité, saveur florale.
Une bière globalement très agréable.
Homogenous foam top. Fresh yeast aroma. Alcohol is well tamed. Strong beer but still soft in the mouth. Light metallic feel. Medium bitterness.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 Bottle. Straw coloured, lively head that lasts. Spicy, herby & floral aromas. Medium sweetness, average carbonation, no bitterness. Well balanced flavours. The herby and floral aromas and taste are not my favoured style of beer. But disregarding my preferences, this is very good.
This is a great beer from Brewery Het Anker. You must taste this as a beerlover! #belgianbeer #tripel #goudencarolus

330 ml bottle bought at YATA in MOKO, Mongkok.
Looks: Cloudy hazy golden light honey colour with a thin ring of yeast sediments; One and a half finger head and long-lasting crumpety white foam; Excellent sticky lacing with very fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant sweet malt, with banana, vanilla, caramel, strong alcohol, light dark fruits, sugar, bread, strong Bel yeast, light lemon and thin grass.

Taste: Med to strong sweet malt, with banana, caramel, dark fruits, strong alcohol, sugar, spices, strong Bel yeast, strong lemon, quite strong bitter hops and herbal grass.

Body: Mid to full body. Very creamy and slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Very good maltyness in rich background, very smooth and creamy. Booze is strong but not harsh, and strong herbal hops reigns. Banana and dark fruit esters make their presence felt but took a back seat. Sweetness is good and just right with the herbs. Joyful!

Hoppiness: Light lemon and thin grass in nose, and much stronger in taste. Bitterness has strong herbal influence for a lasting, mid-to-high astringent sweet malty finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Creamy, boozy and hoppy to mouth.

Comments: I had high expectation with the Gouden Carolus brand and this Tripel surely lives up - rich smooth body, surgically and tasty booze and hoppiness to the style, with strong herbs and spice mixed with just-right sweetness. Only it wasnt as Bel-yeasty as I hoped. Excellent and Merry Christmas!

Pale to cloudy golden pour with a thin white creamy head and light sticky lacing ..... Aroma of grains, fruity yeast, subtle spices.... Good balance of aromas some spicy/grassy hops  ... Taste is of lemons, dry and spicy/peppery with sweet caramel malts, bitter grassy hop bite and grains .... Dry spicy and strong finish..... Mouthfeel is soft and creamy with a little liveliness ... Well balanced and delicious

330 ml bottle. Pours a clear, nice deep golden with a thick, resilient white head. Aroma is sweetbread, vanilla, spices. Flavor is spices, vanilla, some lemon, sweet syrup. Finish is lemon, vanilla, some peach and pear. Medium to full body, soft mouthfeel and weak to average carbonation.

Pours murky blonde with a big white head. Nose is banana, coriander, and light citrus. After a little hops on the front, this is a smooth, well carbonated ride of various fruits and a little bread and spice. Alcohol is very well hidden. Delicious
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 Wow. En virkelig spændende og lækker øl. Masser af god smag. Flot farve og skum.
Incredibly easy-drinking tripel. Cloudy appearance with a nice, dense head. Smooth with light sweetness.

DAA; Bottle 33 cl., from Vinmonopolet. Pours huge, hazy gold with a forever lasting and lacing frothy creamy white head. Nose is moderate, malt, citric apple, yeast, light perfumed, bread, milk and spice. Taste is moderat sweet and bitter with a light warming and somewhat lasting spice finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

As good as Trappist beers, beautiful hue, head settles quickly, all too drinkable (this is an observation, not a complaint). Nice feel on the toungue, no aftertaste. Overall a wonderful beer to enjoy at leisure.

Flaska från Beernavigator. Stor skum som långsamt sjunker. Stor, söt maltig doft med estriga lätt parfymerade dofter. Smaken drar också lite åt tvål och parfym, syren, lavendel möter bergamott och lite mandelolja, söta äpplen, honung, pomerans, torr sherry, en del alkoholvärme. Perfekt en vinterdag med sol, som värmande solsken på flaska. Mycket gott.

Cor de mel, levemente turva. Espuma abundante e persistente. Aroma floral, um pouco cítrico. Alcoólica, adocicada, com notas herbáceas e cítricas. Laranja, damasco e um pouco de limão. Retrogosto alcoólico.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, wysoka i niebrzydka choc nieco szampanowa piana, zostajaca na szkle, samo piwo nieoc metne, jasne. aromaty estrow owocowych i przyprawowosci dominuja, pojawiaja sie rowniez nuty jakichs slodyczy. w smaku dosc ostre ta triplowa przyprawowoscia, gladkie w piciu, nieco slodkawe, wysoko wysycone (az szczypie w jezyk). bardzo dobrze to wszystko razem ulozone, daje efekt bardzo rzeski i dosc ostry. klasa.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ottima belga tripel, color oro, in bocca si sentono molti sapori fruttati, con sapore alcolico deciso
grass, citrus, hay, bread, golden, clear, white foam, full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

Dorata leggermente pallida, velata dai lieviti in sospensione, schiuma bianca di media finezza e di persistenza medio-bassa.
Aroma di coriandolo e leggero chiodo di garofano, polpa d'arancia, floreale, leggero miele e crosta di pane, nota etilica.
Al palato floreale, polpa d'arancia, citrica, leggera crosta di pane, coda amaricante erbacea accompagnata da una decisa ma mai aggressiva nota etilica.
Retrolfatto che ricorda il succo d'arancia.
Corpo medio, mediamente carbonata.

La robe de cette bière, blonde claire, est obtenue grâce à la base maltée obtenue uniquement à partir de malt pâle. Au nez, on retrouve à la fois le profil fruité et épicé des levures ainsi que de très jolies notes houblonnées qui se traduisent par des notes agrumes. L’attaque en bouche est puissante et prouve que l’on à affaire à une triple de caractère. De belles touches d’abricots confits et d’orange font ensuite leur apparition tandis que la dégustation s’achève sur une fin de bouche sèche et désaltérante.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2015 Delft 6-10-2015

BAM! Dit is een van de bieren waar je meteen vrolijk van wordt. Op zich niet heel onderscheidend maar precies wat je van een triple mag verwachten. Stevige, prikkelende smaak maar tegelijkertijd ook fris. Drinkt makkelijk weg en is door zijn fruitige citrus smaak perfect voor in de zomer bij warme temperaturen.

Tap @ The Raleigh Times: Clear golden with a ring white head. Flowery and citrus aroma. The Belgian yeasts arent to overpowering. I also noticed a little mandarin in there as well. Old school = good.

Golden cloudy, almost peach color in the light. Exploding foamy coating.
Citrus and sour smell, a little alcohol. Hoppy and lemony taste, slightly sweet.
Feels a little zesty but thin, strong alcohol aftertaste, almost vinous.

Overall : Good beer with a taste too sharp, and missing some texture.

330ml bottle. Hazy golden yellow with a foamy white head. Flavors are biscuity malts, orange peel, lemon, bread, alcohol and honey with spicy and floral notes. Medium to full body, good carbonation, smooth texture.

Very clean given body, flimsy head. Too bubbly, too crisp for the style, needs more spice and body for me. The alcohol is fitting but overall theres a lack of character. I suppose that makes it easier to drink, but thats not what I look for in a Tripel. (75cl bottle from Delhaize Heverlee)

An amber, Belgian, unfiltered, foggy trippel with white head. Aroma is very spicy, complex yeasty, prune, malty. Taste is bitter. Pearly. Strong.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Well balanced tripel. 
Not too yeasty, not too spicy or sweet.
Malt, hops, yeast and spices are easily distinguished and well combined

Hazy golden with a thick dense off-white head. Aroma is very citrusy, coriander, peppery, some belgian yeast. Average to very sweet with a somehow drier finish but only light bitter. Full bodied, average carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. A good blond sipper.
Pours a hazy gold. A very wheaty and grain aroma. A strong wheat taste with citrus and grains. A dry grain and malt aftertaste.
From elcervecero. Playing Goodbye Deponia. In Duvel glass. Too much spices in makes it oddly tasting. The gouden carolus ive enjoyed the least

Lorsquon a envie dune belge blonde classique, cest dune Gouden Carolus Tripel dont on a envie! La bière est blonde, voilée et affiche une tête absolument gigantesque et magnifique. Une fois cette mousse retombée, les lacings laissés sur mon verre sont dune complexité infinie et succulents pour les yeux! Au nez, je ressens un bouquet de fleurs digne de la Saint Valentin: de la rose, de la violette et une peu de lavande, du pot pourri. Quelques céréales suries. En bouche, le liquide est rond et aussi complètement floral et granuleux. La construction est très bien réalisée mais un peu trop chargée en fleurs pour mon goût personnel. Une bonne dose de céréales joue cependant un rôle atténuant et len remercie. Jy décèle des saveurs de gruau à lavoine. Douce, ronde, alcool bien dissimulé, cette bière me fait rêver à mon dernier voyage en Belgique...

Poured from 750ml bottle. 

Hazy, golden yellow with a 3-finger off-white head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of Belgian yeast, spice, banana and candi sugar. 

Taste of spices, candi sugar, Belgian yeast, coriander, pear, banana and a little orangey citrus. 

Medium body and high/medium carbonization. 

Excellent tripel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
11/13/2006 6:55:29 AM On Tap at Dopeys Elixir. Strong Tripe with hints of fruit, honey and banana. Prickly mouthful ends in prickly finish. Somewhat tart. Very good.

Clear golden body. Huge white head. Aroma of belgian yeast, spicies, fruits (pear and citrus), honey. For the flavours, first sweet malt, honey and spicy notes then comes fruit, mostly pear. Finish is sweet, fruity, slightly warm with an hint of bitterness. Hides well it´s 9%.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light yellow with a nice white foam. Spice, honey, belgian yeast caracter, a little bread. A little bitter. Medium body, creamy work a little high carbonation.

Bottle from Toft Vin, Copenhagen - fuzzy golden pour with white head. Fruity and light malty aroma and taste, light caramel sweetness,some citric lemon flavour, yeasty, some herbal and floral nuances going on, citric spice towards the dry finish. Nice!

Bottle - 330ml. Superb, slightly hazy, golden body with an average, lasting, white frothy head. Lovely malty/hoppy aroma with honeyish, citrusy, herbal, and yeasty hints. Alcohol is subtle. Its robust malty/hoppy taste carries honeyish, coriander, grainy, and orange notes. Ends with a long, moderately warming, bittersweet finish. A classic!
Great beer for hot daysm I am not a big fan of blonde beers but this one despite the misleading look had a great taste and did the job on a hot parisian day
Really, really nice Tripel. Everything perfect in balance: the fruits, the yeast and the citrus tones that give this beer the perfect freshness.

aroma of fruit and citrus looks amazing trouble but golden with strong foam in the flavor there is fruit candy sugar and bay leaf some hops stick to the palate nice mouthfeel it feels like your having a beer

0.33 l bottle from drankgigant.nl, best before 1/7/2017. Clear, golden yellow with a massive, very fine pored and foamy, stable, white head. Intense, fruity-yeasty aroma of predominantly peach and vanilla, accompanied by banana, citrus, coriander, wheat and orange peel. Sweetish, fruity-yeasty taste again dominated by peach and vanilla with notes of banana, wheat, orange peel, coriander and citrus. Medium long, yeasty and quite bitter finish. Medium to full body, creamy and effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Lovely tripel, very much reminiscent of a witbier although none of its specific ingredients are present, not even wheat. So easily drinkable, abv not detectable and absolutely mouth filling. Awesome stuff!

12 ounces bottle from SAQ. Aroma: typical Belgian yeast giving some apple and pear, barley malt. App: hazy golden, medium white head, nice lacing. Taste and palate: medium to full body, creamy, fizzy, fruity and light bitter finish. Overall: wow! What a great Belgian tripel. So smooth, perfect carbonation, just a tad bitter to make it not boring. Prefect palate imo. Glad I bought 3. One of the greatest beer available at SAQ.
Hazy golden yellow colour with huge white head. Aroma is very yeasty with alcohol. Sweet spicy taste,fruity and yeasty finish. Overall a very good tripel.

F: huge frothy long lasting white 
C: cloudy yellow orange.
A: orange peel, coriander, banana, citrus, malt, yeast. 
T: malt with orange and citrus, coriander, some grass and floral hops, green spicy, yeast, medium body, lively carbonation, a little too short finish, very good tripel one of the best, worth to try.

33cl bottle poured in chalice glass
A: hazy golden yellow
A: yeast, papaya, citrus, hops, 
T: hoppy smooth start with herbs, floral, citrus, middle bitterness that is mild and short lasting, smooth light refreshing yeast/bread finish
P: smooth full body, creamy, avg carbonation, long enjoyable finish
O: wonderful full refreshing finish great summer Tripel

Wygląd: Wysoka i drobnoziarnista piana. Długo się utrzymuje a opadając pozostawia na szkle sporą koronkę. Barwa bursztynowa, zmętnione.
Aromat: Wyczuwalne pomarańcze, drożdże, miód, lekki alkohol i słody.
Smak: Mocno słodowy, drożdżowy, rozgrzewający alkohol, miód, guma do żucia.Treściwe piwo o słodkim finiszu. Wysokie wysycenie.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 
Aroma:

Malts, wheat, banana, honey, Belgian yeast, orange, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Hazy golden/amber beer with a slight/medium white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, banana, honey, Belgian yeast and orange; ends slightly bitter and dry with wheat, hops and citrus.
Hazy pale, creamy head. Tropical yeast aroma, creamy body. Sweet, balanced. A little banana. Solid, traditional tripel.

A pesar de la tecnología de elaboración de la cerveza moderna, esta cerveza se fabrica de acuerdo a antiguas tradiciones. Se une, ahora como en el pasado, los mejores productos: cebada y lúpulo fino. Es de refinado carácter, con un sabor puro y rico, que le cautivará. Es madurado largamente en un sótano y en la botella.

Ganadora en el World Beer Awards 2012 en la categoría Belgian Style Tripel.

Al gusto es una cerveza afrutada, amarga y seca con toques de de cilantro, naranja y manzanas que la hace muy bebible y refrescante enmascarando su contenida alcoholico.

Madura durante 6 meses en las cavas de la cervecería y se mejora con el tiempo (mínimo 5 años).

Embotellada después de una larga maduración, sin haber sido sometida a filtración alguna, es 100% natural y particularmente rica en vitaminas.

- See more at: http://cervezaparatodos.com/producto/gounden-carol
@ Kallithea Beach, Rhodes 150706. Bottle (330 ml) from Carrefour. Yeasty and fruity, malty and spicy, oranges, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, yeasty and spicy.

Dourada,turva,espuma cremosa alta e com boa manutenção;aroma frutado.cítrico(limão),presença de especiarias(cravo),malte , fermento e álcool;sabor refrescante e encorpado,com malte,lúpulos cítricos,álcool e notas picantes se interagindo em equilíbrio,retrogosto picante,final seco e agridoce,ótima drinkability e carbonatação. Tripel de "primeira" seguindo a tradição do rótulo Golden Carolus.
Quite similar to other Gouden Carolus. This one as good quality as the others but is not that delicious.

Very hazy, high carb.
Wheaty estery lemony nose, slight phenolic grape and banana.
Very nice smooth and creamy palete 
Flavour is ok, there is a lean towards farmhouse and pear drops.
Interesting but would only sip one.
UPDATED: OCT 30, 2015 Cloudy yellow coloured with a medium sized white head. Sweet aroma of fruits, caramel and "carolus-yeast". Sweet flavour of caramel, fruits and, spices and "carolus-yeast".
Large format bottle. Slightly Cloudy Gold With Lacing from white head. Some sweet and sour fuitiness and overall very nice.

330ml bottle, poured into La Chouffe tulip. A: Golden, slight haze, looked lively, lots of bubbles, two finger head, candidate for the best laced beer Ive ever drunk. S: Over ripe tangerine, phenol. T: Over ripe tangerine, followed by a strange combination of musty earth, wet towels, grass, perfume, slightly cloying, a bit of a boozy burn. M: Crisp body, went down well. O: Different, interesting.
Bottle, flight. Pours champaign gold with tiny little bubbles. Very nice nose, spicy, hints of sour. Crisp champaign like attack, little bubbles, and sour and clean. very good.

Color ámbar claro, algo amarillenta. Espuma media que pronto se desvanece para dejar una capa de nata. Gran aroma, muy floral y a plátano y bizcocho. Excelente en la boca, con mucho cuerpo y mezcla estupenda de tonos, albaricoque, piña, cítrico, caramelo dulce... para acabar con un regusto muy herbal antes de que salga el calor potente del alcohol. Grande,

750 ml bottle pours a hazy light orange color with a nice white head. Aromas of belgian yeast, banana, clove. Medium bodied, very good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Si presenta nel bicchiere di color arancio pallido, velato; la schiuma bianca è generosa, molto persistente, bianca e cremosa. Il naso apre con una bella speziatura diffusa dai lieviti (pepe, coriandolo, curaçao), scorza darancia. In bocca è caratterizzata da una frizzantezza molto vivace che tuttavia non pregiudica una sensazione di morbidezza in bocca; il corpo è medio, lalcool (9%) è molto ben nascosto; si parte con leggerissime note di crosta di pane che lasciano subito il posto a tanta frutta gialla (pesca, albicocca, ananas). La marcata dolcezza è mitigata da una secchezza quasi encomiabile, con una nota leggermente amaricante (scorza darancia/curaçao) in chiusura.

Opálos méz színű testére egy megzabolázhatatlan, telt és krémes, tejszínhabszerű képződmény telepszik, küllem terén sok típusbeli társa elbújhat mellette. A pikáns fűszeresség, friss koriander és karakteres élesztőnyalábok szövedéke mesteri kompozíciót alkot, a legnemesebb tripelekhez mért aromák megléte kipipálva. Ezek után már talán meg sem lepődhetünk azon, mennyire nagyszabású ízvilággal szembesülünk az első kortyok során, kerek ízjegyei friss komlótól és koriander zöldjétől, citrusos fűszerességtől, mézes maláta desszertszerű jellegétől csattannak ki, az alkohol fokát nehezünkre eshet belőni, a 9 százalék ugyanis nagyszerűen meghúzódik a háttérben. A temérdek kiváló belga jellemvonás a stílus rajongóinak nosztalgikus mosolyt csalhat az arcára, egy efféle palack felnyitása egyenesen egy brüsszeli kocsma asztalához repít majd minket.

330 ml bottle pours a hazy amber with a bubbly, big white head that dissipates rapidly to cap. Sweet fruity nose; bitter orange, light banana some herbally hops and maybe a little ginger. Sweet spicy taste, some initial caramel is soon washed away by bitter lemon. Really good, full mouth feel and quite high carbonation. Great bitterish finish with a lovely warmth and a sourdoughish taste.

from tap in park café mechelen. aroma smells ginger, tangerine, fresh pineapple and orange peel. also fresh citrussy hops.. clear yellow golden colour with off white foam that lasts quite long, low carbo. sweet arrival with banana, coffee in the background. turns to orange peel and some coriander in the development. also some bitternes of range peel. but hey, bitter coffee and orange are a great combo! aftertaste is slight bitter, but always in a controlled way. medium long. this is one of the great tripel beers without a doubt. has it all!

Bottle. A handsome Golden ale with a thick White head. Aroma of spicy yeast, banana and hops. Candy sugar sweetness and light lemon tartness. Dry and boozy finish. Gouden Carolus is an excellent range.
2015-05-01 - A very stylish beer in a stylish bottle that tasted just as good as it looks like.
Interesting aroma, however not so strong. Interesting palete. Strong aftertaste. Refreshing.
Tellement délicieux, ce nectar onctueux sur mes lèvres. Sucré, oui, mais imprégné de citron, citronnelle, fleur dorangé, fameux.
33 cl bottle. Pours a clear yellow with nice lasting white head. Aroma of orange and hops. Taste is slightly sweet.Palate is smooth. Overall very good.

golden, hazy, big white foam; floral, yeasty, fruits, spicy; medium+ sweetness, medium bitterness; rather full body, creamy feel, average carbonation, long bittersweet finish;
Overall: very nice tripel

Uitverkozen tot beste tripel ter wereld 2012 en inderdaad zeker niet mis. Volle, zoetige smaak. Lekker.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear orange with a nice thick white lasting head and a lively, sparkling appearance. Beautiful. Nice malty aroma with clear caramel notes. Some yeast, spices and some citrus fruits. A bit simple, but it never fails me. Truly marvellous nose. Beautiful smell. Nice flavors of caramel, oranges yeast accompanied with a nice spicy kick. Nice warming glow in the end, which builds up all the flavors. The aftertaste is refreshingly bitter, but still the fruitiness remains. The alcohol works out perfectly in this brew. Soft and simple, yet amazingly rich in flavor. Lively palate, sticky mouthfeel, well carbonated with a full body. This brew amazes me all the time. Not the most complex brew, yet it is so appealling and tasty. Possibly the best tripel available.
Testad på Linköping Beer Expo. Grumlig ljusgul färg. Doftar mandelmassa och jäst. Mycket len och lite söt i smaken. Mycket god.

Testad på Linköping beer expo. Fruktiga, "jästiga" toner i doften med inslag av lakrits och mandelmassa. Likadan smak, inte så besk, inte så söt men väldigt välbalanserad och väl integrerade smaker som kompletterar varandra. Mycket god.

27.9.2014. Hazy yellow, velvety head. Refreshing aroma with spices, fruits, yeast. Taste is sweetish with honey, fruits, lemon, hint of spices, banana, some bitterness as well. Nice looking and tasty tripel.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2017 Smell of orange zest and yeast. Traces of sugar.In mouth, its sweet, piny and spiced. Very smooth and tastefull

Vieillie 2 ans. Robe jaune-orangée trouble avec un généreux col de mousse blanc assez dense. Effervescence très active. Arômes de levures, sucre, épices, pâtisseries, oranges confites et malt caramelisé. En bouche, malt et beaucoup depices sucrées. On dirait presque presque un mélange depices de Noël. Léger goût dorange et de sucres residuels rappelant le caramel. On peu de fruits sucrés tels pomme, banane et abricot. Finale soyeuse et fruitée. Texture moyenne onctueuse et corps moyennement rond. 6-4-7-4-14 = 3.5/5

Vieillie 3 ans, bue à quelques jours de la limite suggérée par le brasseur du 21/01/2017. Léger gushing à louverture. La robe na pas changée. Arômes de poire et cantaloup fermentées, miel, levures belges, fromage, épices sucrées et autres effluves de choses oubliées au frigo depuis trop longtemps. En bouche, ce ne sont que des saveurs désagréables de vieux fruits sucrées, miel chaud, levures à la retraite, fromage à la crème, Chartreuse© dilué. Texture épaisse et corps rond qui fait sourciller. Lannée de trop. DP. 4-4-3-3-8=2.2/5

33 cl bottle at home. Pours a brilliant blonde colour with a white head that soon fades. Light aroma of hop, very subtle and almost perfume-like. Taste is sweet with a good balance of bitterness. Good carbonation, more hop and a good underlying grain base make this a satisfying beer. Finish is perhaps a bit too short, but this is nonetheless a very good beer indeed.

Blonde scintillante. Beau collet blanc et dense. Nez: très exotique. fruité et épicé. Gingembre frais. Citronnelle. Muscade. Girofle. Levure. Pain frais. Fruit exotique. Ananas. Mangue. Papaye. Bleuet. Je salive. Bouche: forte effervescence. Ronde. Sucré. Respectueux du nez, on retrouve les même genre de fruit et d'épice qu'au nez. En plus des notes malté et boisé. Pain frais au levain. Tarte aux fruits. Légèrement anisé. Très complexe et bien équilibré avec une finale sèche qui demande une autre gorgé.

Blonde un peu orangéed, grosse carbo, gros collet persistant.
aromes fruites (peche, abricot)
Ronde, juste un peu trop sucrée, toujours les saveurs dabricot en avant.
Lalcool ne sent sent que tardivement.
Tres bonne triple
Couleur jaune doré; mousse blanche épasse; arômes fruités (citron); goût fruité, malté et épicé; finale qui réchauffe (les 9 degrés dalcool), un poil trop sucrée

kolor jasnozolty,lekko metny,piana biala,dosc szybko opadajaca,ale centymetrowa warstwa zostaje do konca degustacji,w zapachu owoce,banany,lekko drozdzowy zapach,smak rowniez owoce,drozdzowy posmak,fajna goryczka w tle,bardzo pijalne i orzezwiajace piwo,co przy tej mocy nie jest latwe do osiagniecia

Bottle. Pours pale hazy golden with large colapsing frothy white head. Smell of sweet spices (yeast), citrus (hops) and and a touch of cereal. Taste is more of the same: sweet, smooth and light bitter finish.
Golden color with huge white head. Aroma is spicy yeasts, cookie dough, citrus and booze. Taste is the same. High fizzy carbonation. A benchmark Tripel. Just good!

Clear blond beer with a lasting white head, high carbonation.
Belgian yeast flavor, tasty bitter spice an citrus.
Tasty slightly bitter aftertaste, tasty triple.

Bottle - Cloudy orange color with a thick bright white head that sticks around. Lots of tiny tiny bubbles on the head. Strong alcohol taste to this tripel. Lots of malt sweetness as well. A thick taste on the palate.

Hazy golden color with huge white foam. Sweet aroma, very sweet, with citrus fruits, coriander and yeast. Taste has citrus, orange and lemon peel and also spices, with a yeasty and caramely background. Alcohol is well integrated. Very nice Tripel.

Pours a hazy dark straw topped by a huge off-white head showing excellent retention and offering beautiful lacing. The nose lets the hops and yeasts deliver nice coriander, orange and melon paired with some caramel from the malts. Well balanced. The taste puts the hops at the front line with a nice citrusy aspect paired with the caramel malts. Medium body, the brew is very enjoyable and offers a dry finish. Excellent tripel, it surely can be aged in a cellar for a couple of years. Cheers!
Amber cloudy with rich off-white head. Malt anfd yeast aroma. Bitter-sour taste, rich, with some sweetness and good citrus notes. Carboation. Citrusy bitterness in the aftertaste deep in the throat.
Oro carico, con tante bolle e qulche velatuea, spezie pane e soprattutto frutta dolce al naso, in bocca è pesante come da stile, parecchio carbonata, non irresistibile ma decente.

330 ml bottle from Greek SM, bottled on 

Pours slightly hazy, medium orange color, with big, beautiful white head with amazing retention and lacing and lasting. Beautiful beer. Aroma of coriander, apricot jam, apple(in a good way), orange, sugar, bread crust, some esters from the yeast. Complex, intense, ballanced... Taste is citusy, apricot, apple, caramel malt, nice hoppiness, similar with aroma. Very dry, medium bodied, medium to high carbonation, cant sense the alcohol at all. Just I remember it and still one of the best tripels I have tasted.

Aromat przypalonego karmelu, z delikatną nutą owocową, kwaskową i alkoholową. Barwa ciemno złota/jasno bursztynowa. Piwo jest opalizujące, piana, dość sztywna średnio i drobno pęcherzykowa, nazbyt obfita - piwo zdecydowanie przegazowane. Odczucie w ustach zepsute przez nasycenie. Prócz tego szczypanie alkoholowe. Jest dość pełne. W smaku goryczka alkoholowa, nuty gorzkiego miodu i mocno przejrzałe żółte owoce. Posmak karmelowy z wyraźną mieszanką słodyczy i goryczki. Ogólnie piwo jest chyba nieco utlenione i mocno dofermentowało w butelce.

ASPETTO: biondo carico e limpido, schiuma bianca, fine e persistente (ne rimane sempre nel bicchiere). AROMA: stupendo aroma floreale (giglio e gelsomino), unito ad un dolce mieloso. GUSTO: tendente al dolce senza mai essere stucchevole, in quanto bilanciati da dellagrumato e da un leggero amarognolo nellultima parte del sorso e nel retrogusto. I sentori predominanti sono comunque il fruttato (frutta gialla) e mieloso. Capolavoro di tripel.
Nuts, hay, cereal, roasty, nuts, leaves, alcohol, cooked vegetables, woody, butterscotch

Amarelo palha-dourado. Boa espuma. Aroma cítrico, laranja, lima, coentro, noz moscada, damasco, limão siciliano, coentro. Corpo médio, boa carbonatação/ Amargor médio-baixo. Final aquecedor, condimentada, picante, adocicado.

Robe blonde, reflets ambrés. Nez puissant sur des notes épicées, houblonnées et maltées, du miel, une pointe de banane et de pomme. Bouche à lattaque moelleuse, bulle crémeuse, belle note épicée et longue finale sur une fine amertume. Une superbe triple, parfaitement équilibrée.

Not my favorite tripel. Very flowery and perfumy aroma which reminds me of summer ales or white beer. The appearance is a honey yellow which is very pretty, althougj head retention is poor. Taste is citrus and perfume with maybe some orange or lemon zest. Palate is ok, a bit spicy for my liking and a lasting afterburn. Overall an ok beer, but not my favorite taste .

Pours a hazy golden color with a very thick white head. Yeast, fruit, spice, wheat and clove aroma. Spice, pear, apple, banana, clove, yeast, wheat and honey flavors. Light body and tons of carbonation. Spice and fruit finish.

*Old rating, best before 22.09.11.  The beer in the glass is nice golden. In the nose there is citrus, the typical tripel-yeast and nice hops. The beer is nice tripel-typical sweetish-malty with nice citrus hops and mild yeast. There is still toffee, which fits in fine nice. A very nice beer.

Rated from the bottom of the bottle. I let this one sit on the counter a while to warm up a little. Poured into a snifter. A murky light orange color. Big frothy white head that settles to a thick lace. Bready and fruity aromas and flavor. Notes of pear and white grape. Good hop balance. Dry finish.

750 ml bottle into chalice, bottled on 6/20/2013. Pours fairly crystal clear bright golden color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky off white head with incredible retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big lemon, orange zest, apricot, pear, apple, white grape, pepper, coriander, candi sugar, cracker, bread, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/earthy yeast, spice, and pale malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big lemon, orange zest, apricot, pear, apple, white grape, pepper, coriander, candi sugar, cracker, bread, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Good amount of earthy yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, orange zest, pear, apple, white grape, pepper, coriander, candi sugar, cracker, bread, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Outstanding complexity of fruity/earthy yeast, spice, and pale malt flavors; with a great crisp malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Quite dry on the finish as well for the gravity. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and lightly prickly mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding tripel style. All around awesome complexity and balance of fruity/earthy yeast, spice, and pale malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

330 ml bottle. Dark golden yellow, quite hazy, with an average, creamy and persistent white head. Extremely floral and perfumy nose, slightly spicy (especially lavander and chamomile), a hint of bitter orange peel. Definitely different from a typical Tripel aroma, it reminds me of some Partizan beers from the grisette series. Way too lively, but the taste follow suite. Bitter, slightly tart, again very floral and aromatic. No alchool taste at all, but the drinkability is rather poor. Fizzy carbonation, light body, slightly oily texture. Probably need to revisit as this is an old bottle, but what Im drinking is far from impressive.

At the 1st tasting of 2015 in Belgrade-Serbia. Pours vivid hazy golden, gassy medium white foam. Nose: Belgian yeast, spices forward, fresh orange juice. Mouth: sweet feel, peppery, dry enough for triple and quite floral-fruity.

Champagne Brut method bubbles attack. One of the best beer carbonation ever. Nice nose, cloudy with white average head. Belgian beer spice. Alcohol is strong but well hidden. Master art.

Bottle 0.75l at home, Nivala. BBE 03/03/2017. Colour is cloudy golden with small thick white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, citrus, yeast, some spices, Belgian yeast and malts. Warm, nice sweet fruitiness but palate is too carbonated.

11.2 FL OZ ($4.49) A great Triple. I enjoyed this beer. had a fantastic taste all its own. doesnt seem out of place or hidden among other triples. 9% too that comes off as less than 6%. will buy again
Pours clear golden with great fluffy head. Malty nose slightly sweet. Medium smooth mouthfeel and good carbonation. Smooth and malty with spicy after taste. Great drinking!!

Bottle at home. Pours a clear golden amber with a large white head. Sweet malty aroma, spicy, yeast, bit fruity. Taste is sweet malty, fruity, spicy, prickling on the tongue, warming alcohol in the aftertaste. Not bad.

Smell is mellow citrus mixed with a peachy sweetness and sour bready yoghurt. Touch of caramel and coriander. Maybe even clove.
Taste is better-sweet and quite sour. Some alcohol, astringent, bit of leather. Fruity like dried peaches.
330ml bottle from Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours hazy golden with a thin white head. Aroma of lemon and Belgian yeast. Sweet finish. Ok but not as good as Classic or Christmas.

Draft 0.15l at Gouden Carolus stand at Horeca Expo Ghent Belgium 2014.Pour it golden color with small white head.Taste and aroma of sweet peach, tropical fruits, Belgian yeast aroma.Nice body and complexed.Good tripel.

Bière blonde âcre de 9 % dalcool. Elle possède un col mousseux au versement. Elle a un goût damertume, style citronné, céréalier, avec un aspect de sarrasin. Elle possède un bon goût de malt et aussi un arrière-goût sucré en bouche. Probablement venant du sarrasin. Très bonne !
