hoped for something more - high carbonation lowered the impression a bit for sure.

Cloudy amber color, huuuuge white head with nice retention. Lots of lacing. Full body, soft carbonation. Aroma of banana, malts, yeast, apricot. Texture is creamy. Medium sweet, light bitter taste. Alcohol is not evident. Nice, very nice.
Bottle 0,33l, bought at Beer Paradise in Palmanova (Italy). Pale yellow cloudy liquid with big head. Medium sweetness, a bit metal in taste. Rich and dense. Well balanced. Very good.

BOTTLE 33 CL from artemb.

Look: cloudy golden, big off-white creamy head with good retention.
Aroma: very perfumey, rat fruit, spicy/coriander, some alcohol.
Taste: light sweetness, light yeast/alcohol spice, no hops. Quite balanced, or rather, neutral and somewhat boring.

75cl bottle. Appearance is light and golden, a big frothy white head which settles down and leaves lacing. Aroma- lots of sweet banana, candy, sugary, spices, orange hints, malty. Taste- malts, banana, tangerine, orange peel, plenty of carbonation, sweet fruits, clinging finish. Very tasty tripel.

Bottle 0.33L.
Hazy golden body with huge, creamy, white head, fully lasting with nice lacing.
Heavy hoppy (orange, flowers) and moderate malty (cereal, light caramel) aroma with notes of fruits (apple, peach) and alcohol related spices.
Moderate-to-heavy sweet flavour with moderate bitter and light acidic character, both of them better detected in the finish.
Medium-to-full body with oily texture; soft carbonation; moderate alcoholic warming in the finish.
Wow. Best beer I ever had. Amazing aromas with multiple stages. Same with flavor. So drinkable and fruity almost like a honey cider. For a 9 percent is very smooth

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2015 The tripel in this series, with an initially rather thick, cream white, dense, stable and moussy head leaving coarse lacing on the edge of the glass; colour a deep golden blonde with a slightly orangey hue, hazy from the start. Aroma richly perfumed, strong and seductive, with impressions of fresh honey, mango, vanilla pudding, lots of sweet banana and banana liqueur, overripe peach, white bread, fresh orange peel, sweet cider, lemon zest, mint, cake, red apple, aniseed, lavender, some caramel, white pepper, cognac. Taste begins with sweet exotic fruits, banana, orange, mango, kiwi; rather strong, minerally carbonation, fluffy and smooth mouthfeel, full and malty, sweet, bready, yeasty, with retronasal aromatic spiciness (spices are clearly effectively used here), a tad sugary but nowhere cloying, very honeyish, finishing with dryish but gentle, herbal hops and brandy-like warming alcohol, clearly present and just a little bit wry but not too obtrusive, while the initial sugary and malty sweetness remains, as well as the drying spiciness. Perhaps too sweet and spicy for some (like most of their other beers, I guess) and in that sense not your average tripel, but I like this a lot, since it distinguishes itself from the vast lake of interchangeable tripels in this country. Elegant yet assertive and a true classic in the style, an honourable lady, as it were.
Flasa. Zlata farba, biela pena. Kvasnicova aroma, jemne citrus a korenie. V chuti sladkost a jemne ako sour pivo.
Bottle. Aroma coriander, flowery. Hazy yellow colour, stable head. Taste coriander, honeyish, spicy. Finishes spicy and lightly sour. A bit sharp, but overall alcohol hidden well. Good trippel.
Bottle from fajry, many thanks. Hazy yellow golden color. Malty aroma with candy. Malty taste with candy, spices, Belgian yeast.
Bottle by Fajry, many thanks. Pours bit hazy golden color, white head. Aroma is yeasty, citrusy, fruity, belgian spice. Taste is medium sweet, lightly sour, yeasty, lemon, spicy.

On nitro tap at the Porter Bar (ATL). Served in a tulip. 
Excellent fruity aroma. 
Good flavor but doesnt quite keep up with the quality of the aroma. Its a bit too sweet until the mildly bitter and tart finish. 
Light body. Little noticeable effect of the nitro.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 330ml bottle poured in a chalice.
Lovely Tripel, no doubt.
A: Pours a pale yellow color. Hazy. Head is white, fluffy and simply HUGE. Remains forever. Disappears leaving many many lacings in the glass. The foam reminded me a Duvel
S: Smell is just perfect. A bomb of honey, pepper, clove, vanilla, fruits (apple and pear) and a bit of citric zest. Sweet. Malts, the traditional Belgium yeasts and flowery hops are also very noticed
T: Follows the nose, however much less sweet than expected which is a very positive point here. Taste is dry. Still can feel the malts, honey, cloves, vanilla and fruits. Delicious hops and Belgium yeasts
M: Heavy and dense body. Medium carbonation
D: Not bad. Carolus beers are usually very intense in the way that I prefer to appreciate them with moderation
[ BA Review @ 10/29/2010 ]

Bottle. Slightly hazy, very much like a Duvel with large foam head (foam is denser though). Duvel returns in the aroma. Nice sourness with relatively high acidity, but a fruity undertone: gentle mix of lychee, pineapple, ementhaler cheese from the yeast. Nice. Taste, no surprise again Duvel-like. In the middle a fruity tone is clearly discernible, which spoils the taste a little for me. Lychee, some bitter lemon (in the aftertaste as well). Nonetheless, a good fresh and fruity summer alternative to the Moortgat classic.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Norway, on order. Hazy golden orange color, good foam. Quite fruity aromas, some citrus, light honey and subtle yeast influence : medium aroma intensity. Medium body & complexity. Ok bitterness, well balanced. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Couleur jaune-orange trouble, forte mousse blanche. Nez fruité, mandarine, notes dépices. Gout fruité, malté, épicé, alcool, note houblon et poivre, bien cremeuse en bouche, et bonne amertume en fin de bouche.

Large foamy head. Nice raisin aroma, orange candy, gingerbread. Flavors of sour plum, brioche, apricot jam, dry pepper, light alcohol burn, sour sweet finish. Very nice tripel with a strong dry fruit character.
Golden and effervescent. Bubbly. Yeasty aroma. Sweet with an earthy backing. A little bit if a fruity flavor. Very good brew

golden ale with a LOT of foamy white head. cool aroma of yeasty fruit and spice with a little vanilla. flavor the same. light but flavorful and complex. the prickliness takes away a little, but its very nice."
UPDATED: DEC 25, 2015 Bouteille de 330ml de blonde. Arôme d?agrume et floral. Au gout on a une petite amertume en début de gorgée qui est bien équilibrée par un gout fruit.
Mooie geeloranje kleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt zoetig, mout, kruiden en iets fruitig. Smaakt fruitig zoet, kruiden en mout. Tikkeltje zoete afdronk.
Botella de 33 cl, en Cerveceria Internacional. Color dorado. Sabor a malta, dulce, levadura, ligeramente amargo.

Bottle; pours pale gold with a white head; sweet, fruity aroma with malt and some spices; taste is sweet with fruits, honey, malt and a hint of bitterness; finish is mostly dry with citrus and light spice; very light and easy to drink; the 9% ABV is not noticeable; very good Tripel
Cerveja premiada, saborosa, encorpada mas um pouco doce. Turva no aspecto.
Poured from a bottle into a Trappist glass. Big frothy white head atop a golden body. Aroma is yeasty with after notes of banana and the taste is the same.

Poured from bottle to glass. Golden hue with fizzy white head. Aroma is caramel, bread, banana, brown sugar. Mouthfeel is nice with a medium body and soft carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a spicy bitterness in the following and an estery finish. Overall this beer is decent but sweet.

earthy, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation, Poured from a 75 cl bottle, had almost no head to speak of. Fairly flat with little carbonation, but sweet and smooth.
Had on a few occasions, very clean and decent triple. Lots of floaties in the bottom. Taste is banana, herb with some bitterness.
Excellent. Des notes de caramel et une amertume très agréable pas trop persistante. Une autre !
Bottle. Hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma and taste are grainy and fruity. Rich mouthfeel and light carb. Nice.
Golden color, big white head. Aroma of banana, bubblegum. Taste is medium sweet with a strong anise aftertaste. A bit too sweet but a classic triple.

Drunk 23/08/14 at home. got it the night before from beergeek. had it while playing wow. yea im on it again. i cant help it it feels so goooddddddd nnngggghhhhh
pours clear golden with a huge fizzy head. aroma of banana, candy sugar, oranges, lemon, spice. taste started sweet, light and zesty, moving to a slightly sour hoppy finish. was expecting dark dried fruits, was surprised by how light and tangy it was. anyway will pound more beers while raping in bgs and review em later

330 bottle @ l'île au malt, Soorts- hossegor.
Riche, ample et fruitée. Couleur dorée et tête de mousse épaisse. Arômes riches fruits malt et levure, complexe, comme l'est son goût. Grande présence en bouche, cette triple a du corps, toutes ses composantes semblent parfaitement équilibrées pour nous offrir une triple de référence !

--- Dirty Google traduction :-)

Rich, full and fruity. Golden color and thick foam head. Rich malt flavors fruit and yeast complex, as is the taste. Great mouthfeel, this triple have bodie, all its components seem perfectly balanced to give us a triple reference!
Hazy, but nice head. Strong aroma with banana and fruits. Medium body, strong carbonation. Taste is sweet and bitter. Nice beer.

Fruity, sparkling and warm Tripel. Very representative of style. A real drinking pleasure. Olfactif: Des arômes très fruités avec notes de fruits sauvages, de mures, de pain frais, de brioche au miel, de bonbon et de jujube. Un olfactif complexe, assez puissant et au maintient assez long. 
Visuel: De couleur jaune / dorée, floue; la mousse est immense, très dense et reste très longtemps. Les traces de mousse se transforment en belle dentelle stable.
Gustatif: Attaque fruitée, effervescente, alcoolisée et chaleureuse. Les levures sont en activité maximum avec beaucoup de sucre et de fruits. On y découvre de la banane, des fruits tropicaux, des baies sauvages, des notes de brioche au miel; le tout enrobé dun alcool chaleureux et dune effervescence piquante. Les houblons sont cependant peu présents, si ce nest que de quelques notes florales. Une excellente Tripel qui ravira certainement plusieurs palais.
Keg at LCBF, honey and beeswax nose, honeyed malty body, really nice example of the style.
Draft - Citrus, hay and spice. Gold with a rich white head. Spicy, grassy and light floral malty notes. Great.

Keg at LCBF. Very pale yellow, totally clear, slightly sparkling, big foamy white head. Aroma is sweet caramel malt with bubblegum ester. Body is medium, mid-carbonation. Taste is light bready malt, a touch of alcohol, tangy fruit, an estery mustiness and a dry finish.
Een tripel die erbovenuitsteek tussen de tripels. Echt een aanrader als je van tripels houdt.

Bottle at Rootz at the Harbour, Scheveningen. Poured a hazy light amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is Belgian yeast, zesty citrus. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a big yeasty, crisp alcoholic light citrus palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. This is a big alcoholic beer and it doesnt let you forget that!

Bottle from Voldby. Pours hazy golden with a good white head. Sweet fruity taste with notes of banana, yeast, hops, alcohol, malts. Medium boby. Lively carbonation. Slight bitter finish that ends up a bit sweet. Great.

Pours a slightly hazy gold with two fingers of fluffy white head diminishing to a thin skim and light spotty lacing. Nose is Belgian yeast bubblegum, cloves and banana, with a little hop bitterness. Taste follows suit, starting sweet and moving to a bitter, peppery finish. Mouth feel is medium to light, with decent sustained carbonation and a bitter, warming finish.

Really, really nice Belgian. And for $2.50 a bottle? Unbeatable. Unbelievable! Id have to say its an even better quality-for-price ratio than Leffe! If it werent for the fact that the best before was last week, Id go back to the store and buy out everything they had on the shelf. Mind you, Im convinced theres nothing at all wrong with it now. Really, highly recommended.
Samean appelsiinin värinen, hyvin tiheä vaahto. Hyvin persikkainen tuoksu, jossa myös hiivaa. Maussa persikkaa, hiivaa, hieman anista ja humalan poltetta jälkimaussa.

Bottled either...March 8th or August 3rd 2013. I suspect it is the latter since Europe uses Day-Month-Year.

A nice popped when the cork came off, it pours, straight from the fridge, a 3/4 foam to 1/4 liquid mix. I can now see a hazy light golden brew that certainly leaves some nice lacing behind.

A big yeasty aroma I get followed by some cloves, some banana, and a nice touch of some hoppy bitterness but, not too much, mind you.

The taste is lovely. I get more banana and clove with some hints of bubblegum in the taste and the hoppy bitterness is in the taste too and I like it! Theres some other spice here that reminds me of cinnamon, or is it nutmeg? How aboot both so Im covered..

Medium and smooth bodied, medium carbonation, smooth as silk this is with pretty much no presence from the hefty abv. 

Yep, this one heck of a good Tripel in my book. Pardon me while I sip the rest of the bottle away.

Bottle, caged and corked. Pours with an unbelievable visual presentation ... golden orange with the most massive, thick foam pile on top. The head takes forever to cede far enough to start drinking. Once you can get to it, you get the classic tripel ... frothy mouthfeel, subtle tropical fruit and a classic yeasty swirl. Yummy. (#5581, 7/21/2014)

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2016 Bottle from York Beer & Wine. A pale hazy golden coloured beer that pours with a large foamy white head.  It has floral orange blossom, pineapple and herbal honey flavours followed by warming toffee and dried fruits on the finish.
Bottle 33cl. Hazy yellow with a heavy white top that lasts. Aroma and taste has some sour elements. Not too special, but probably good with hot weather.

From the bottle shop, Brugge. Nice golden colour with a huge white head. Smell is of citrus, some apple and yeast. Taste is fruity to start, with a dry medium bitter finish. This is very well balanced for the ABV. Nice, hoppy and refreshing.

pours almost cloudy pale grey-ish yellow with a creamy white head, good retention and lacing. booze, lemonade, honey, candi, flowery grass and perfume, peppery tingling and perfumey booze, yeast, white grapes, coriander (loads of it - even though there seems to be none as per ingredients list) and other bitter herbs, herbal tea, sulfur traces, belgian and fruity esters - some soft phenolic molecules too. average to moderate carbonation, light to medium body - oily, relatively dry, boozy, slightly harsh, almost astringent and assertive grassy-spicy finish. unique tripel. just not fond of it.

Elle est blonde et voilée et dune brillance séduisante. Une mousse immaculée qui dure un temps avant de se résorber lentement et en y traçant un motif artistique. Ça sent le vrai, le véritable, avec ses arômes de levures qui ont de lexpérience et tout plein dagrumes et un peu de poivre au travers ça. Un goût très bien charpenté et coordonné. Épicé, fruité et alcoolisé dans un équilibre exemplaire. Il ny a rien de trop prononcé. Très heureux dy avoir goûté. (M.A. 22 janvier 2017) (1119-230614)

Pours medium thick creamy white head with good duration; opaque and hazy dark orange colour. Typical tripel aroma, with good malts/hops balance, smells yeast, honey and bit citrus/fruit. Taste is never too sweet, and with pleasant bitterness, a bit of tartness too in the middle. Quite lively carbonation, medium body, with very balanced bitter/sweet and clean finish. Nice hoppy tripel, quite drinkable
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 Bottle 33cl. Francis. Hazy golden colour with big white head. Aroma of raisins, white grapes, apple, brown sugar and caramel.
75 cl bottle, 9.0% abv. Cloudy yellow golden with foamy head. Fruity taste with medium bitternes and typical belgian yeasty notes. Not bad.

Aroma: light yeast, some bread malts, light sours. Appearance: pale hazy gold, big frothy white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: quickly sweets are coming up, malty, caramel, molasses, light bitters towards the end again. Overall: fantastic Tripel, great subtle palate. Bottle from Beer of Belgium, Ypres.

Poured from a 330ml bottle, hazy straw yellow color. Creamy white head, lots of lacing. Aroma is sweet citrus fruit, taste is honey like malt and a predominant lemon flavor. Medium high carbonation finishes dry.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2014 Un corps parfait et satisfaisant.. On sait immédiatement quon a à faire à une excellente bière! Ce nest pas une bière qui tente de repousser les limites, elle nexplore pas de nouveaux horizons, mais elle représente définitivement bien son style! Une bière ronde, complète, poivrée et qui cache merveilleusement bien son alcool. Pour les personnes demeurant au Québec : procurez-vous sans faute cette bière, maintenant disponible à la SAQ, avant quelle ne disparaisse!

Bottle from local saq A: citrusy, spicy perfumy, tropical, camomile, bready App: hazy pale rocky white head .great lacing. t/p: med to full body with sweet and moderate long finish.fizzy. o: amazing. Nose is superb complex and yet smooth. I definitely need to stack more of this.

Pours an golden body with a thick head. Aroma of belgian yeast and a very nice taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2015 Bottle 33cl. Aroma fruity (apricot, orange), sweet malts, yeast, grass, floral, coriander, hint of ginger; hazy golden color, thick one finger head, white, very slow dissipation, head never disappears, good lacing; smooth creamy mouthfeel, full body; taste is fruity sweet, slightly bitter, bit lemon, hint of ginger; fruity bitter aftertaste with peppery and (very) light lemony sour notes, alcohol in the background. Really excellent tripel. Retasted 150131 @ brewery Het Anker, Mechelen. @ brewery Het Anker, Mechelen. Very fresh after brewery tour, slightly higher rating (was 4.2). One of the best tripels around.

Colour: Pale gold with a adequate white head.
Nose: Fresh, crisp. Hints of wheat (toast), sugar, yellow fruits. Spices and floral notes. Quite complex.
Flavours: Vanilla, citrus, lemon. Touches of cereal and sugar. Herbs and spices (coriander, ginger). A lot of depth but easy to drink. Alcohol is neatly disguised within the complex flavours.
Finish: Long, refreshing but well-rounded.
Verdict: A seriously good Tripel. Can match most Trappists in quality and complexity.

Mooie witte schuimkraag! Geurt complex met fruitige toets
De smaak is complex met citrus en koriander achtergrond. De smaak blijft lang in de mond hangen. Al bij al een fris en aangenaam bier.

Bière blonde pâle, trouble, coiffée dune épaisse mousse poussée par une puissante effervescence. Le nez est fruité (agrumes, banane, épices...). En bouche, le produit est aussi complexe et raffiné que ce que le nez voulait bien nous laisser croire. Les saveurs fruitées sétalent sur une belle trame dacidité avant de laisser place à une finale plus sèche  bien quelle soit finement enrobée dun doux sucre résiduel. Cette Gouden Carolus est une Tripel exemplaire et savoureuse.
330ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours hazy yellow, thick white head. Aromas of bread, yeast, spice, white sugar. Taste is sweet, light herbal bitter. Clean finish, touch of booze-burn. Not bad.

Perfectly clear golden color, mountain of white froth. Citrus peel, coriander, banana, spice, and bread malt. Light sweetness with a smidgen of spiciness. Very fizzy, smooth, and barely medium-bodied. Little alcohol presence in the slightly bitter finish.

33cl bottle served in a Struise glass. Quite light for the style with a huge white head. Too much head which takes an age to dissipate. Flavour is typical Belgian tripel but sweeter than most. Not particularly strong in any one area (unlike St Feuillien tripel) which can have the effect of making it taste a little flat rather than well balanced. Much prefer the van der kaizer rood to this.

Pours a pale golden color into a pint glass. Two inches of head that reduces quickly to 1 cm. Slight lacing on the sides of the glass. Citrusy with hints of spice and cloves in the aftertaste. Deceptively light in alcohol taste for a beer with 9%. Excellent tripel.

Huge chunky white head and fantastic lacing.. Bright yellow with only the slightest haze.. pretty.

Wow factor on the nose ... sweet toasted biscuits ... lemon verbena.. and a very characteristic spiciness... more complex than I can pick out... wow again.

Big Belgian pale malts are closely guarded by the yeasty flavors... fruits like nothing Ive enjoyed in a long time.. underripe pear and lesser apricot ... Perfect mouthfeel with a creaminess that allows the the to carbonation burst with flavors with every sip. White pepper and hints of nutmeg. Perfect sweetness ties every sip together and leaves a lingering flavor until the next.

Best tripel I can think of... certainly of the Continental variety. Murica should step up the game.
Bue en bouteille de 33 cl. Couleur dorée trouble. Mousse très blanche de belle tenue. Houblons prédominants au nez, notes d'épices au palais. Pointe d'agrume en finale.
A korianderes ízvilág miatt vásároltam meg ezt a sört. És abszolút mérte az árát. Nagyon fűszeres és testes sör, aki a különleges ízekre fogékony, mindenképpen kóstolja meg.
Bottle at home. Sugary, sweet, sickly, dry toffee and caramel, fruity, bit too fizzy.
Blond biertje dat redelijk bitter smaakt. Een heel mooie blonde kleur en schuimkraag. Je smaakt de alcohol redelijk goed.

Se ve preciosa, dorada, lijeramente turbia. La cabeza es larga, espuma que se ve y huele a un baño en jacuzzi, jabón fino, de geranio y bergamota. Aroma cítrico y floral, pero como aceites escenciales naturales. Lijera y muy amable en boca, nomás se siente su alta graduación alcohólica. Cuerpo medio, fresca y viva en boca. Deliciosa.

330ml bottle. Pours straw yellow thick white head some lacing. Light aromas of dried fruits, apricot, and herbal. Taste of dried fruits, toffee, a little spice. Quite warming. Decent but Ive had much better tripels...

33cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Nice one! Hazy golden appearance, with a nice large white head. Body is very very smooth with a nice medium finish. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter. Aroma is malty, caramel, spicy, fruity, pinneapple, light brett.
Vol zoet erin met mango, ananas en wat vers hooi. Smaak zet door met een licht scherp randje van kruiden en nasmaak van sinaasappel. Prachtige kop op ongefilterd geel. Drinkt lekker door.
one of the best triples in belgium. simply put: if you like triples, you have to try this at least once!
Clear pale golden, big airy head. Sweet, floral aroma. Fluffy mouthfeel, sweet and malty, grapes, bitter finish, very harmonic. Very nice, very pleasant!
Classic Belgian tripel with beautiful spice notes all the way through. Damn good!

Bottle. Pours clear pale golden with atable white head. Clear aroma of fruit and flowers, with subtle notes of hops. Sweetish, fruity flavour, with acidic, floral notes and bitter, hoppy touches. Well hidden notes of alcohol. Slightly rough and vinous aftertaste. Very well-balanced and perfectly composed. Good. One of the best triples I have had.

75cl bottle at home.
APPEARANCE: clouded blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: caramel, sweet, fruity, oranges, some liquorice.
TASTE: caramel, sweet, liquorice, weird chemical taste though.
In fles van 33cl. Troebel geel van kleur met een goede schuimkop. Citrus achtige smaak met een duidelijk knispertje. lekker biertje voor deze zonnige dag ;-)
33cl fles. Lichtgeel van kleur. Witte volle schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie : fris, citrus ,kruidig, koolzuur. Lekker blond biertje.
Pours a hazy yellow, fluffy head. Lots of spices and flowers in the aroma. Alcohol is also present in the aroma. Yeast, bubblegum, and banana in the taste. Bitter finish.
Bottle sampled at the Buitenlust Oirschot. Hazy golden colour...big white head. Smell and taste malts, spices, some yeast, a light touch of fruits.

Bottle at Pressklubben. Pours light hazy golden with a huge white head. Sweet malty aroma with bubblegum, almonds, spices, yeast, hay and light citrus. Taste is sweet smooth with spices, light bitter finish with some cloves. Medium bodied with an oily texture.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2017 Appears hazy golden with a lasting, frothy, white head that leaves lacing. Inviting smell. The aroma contains lots of fruits, citrus, yeast, spices and alcohol. It tastes medium fruity sweet and medium bitter with a spicy and warmingly alcoholic finish. Full body, fizzy carbonation, oily texture. Great balance, a classic. (Edited 5/6/17)

Others have reviewed the taste better, and I dont particularly get that much out of it because of the alcohol masking the taste a lot. This is one of those beers I would love to love more. Without wanting to diss it, it sometimes feels like this beer is appreciated for the fact that it has momentum instead of having momentum because its so good. Theres just no getting around Gouden Carolus the last 2 years or so.
The tripel seems to get very alcoholy and agressive after a while, that feeling where you get slightly annoyed and confused after the first few sips have settled. Its still a solid beer, but living in Belgium that means it ranks with a lot of other good strong blondes, so it misses punch. 
That does mean its pretty balanced though, instead of being another one of those modern beers with momentum gained by the original or hoppy flavors.
Just to be clear, the brown one is a whole different story and one of the best beers out there.

Pours a nice yellow haze with a lot of foam.
Feels fresh on the first taste but afterwards turns a bit sour/bitter.

สีดำเข้& ฟองน้อย ละเอียด
 ซ่าลิ้น
 ชอบมากๆ
 via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Hazy golden color with a thick foamy white head. Aroma of citrus and wheat. Balanced sour, bitter and sweet taste. Lemony finish. Medium body.
Medium white head, clear golden colour, sweet sourish citron co2 smell, sweet caramel medium to high carbonation citron soft sour, medium bitter
Golden colour, white foam. A lot of carbonation, destroys much of the taste. Very spicy aroma with a lot of anise. Medium body. Light bitter finish.

Hazy orange yellow body with a foamy white head with good retention. Fruity spicy aroma. Banana stands out to me. Light sweetness with medium bitterness. Strong alcohol taste too. Good fruity aftertaste. Nice tripel.

White beer color with a firm, lasting, bright white head. High carbonation. Yeast, citrus and coriander in the aroma, same in the taste with a warming aftertaste due to the alcohol percentage. Reminds me a lot of the Hoegaarden grand Cru. Nice refreshing beer, but a bit treacherous due to the high alcohol in comparison with its very accesible taste (white beer style). Very good and fairly surprising compared to the taste of the classic Gouden Carolus.

Large sample pour of golden canary yellow with fluffed head. Nose is light apple and apricot with coriander and Belgian yeast. Flavor follows, mostly sweet candy sugar and lighter fruits, solid alcohol presence. I still dont love tripels... Lighter medium body, drinkable and smooth, not too effervescent.
Aroma of malts, citrus, ripe fruits, yeast, spices. Flavour is pretty sweet, quite spicy, with a light bitter finish. Very nice Tripel.
Goudkleurig met dikke witte laag schuim. Veel koolzuur. Ruikt naar banaan en citrus. Smaakt super, zacht met een beetje bitter en een beetje zoet.

As of this moment, this is the 10th most rated beer I have not personally rated. 330 mL bottle from Whole Foods Charlottesville. Pours a hazy golden color with a large fizzy white head. Fair head retention. Aroma of banana, stone fruits, caramel, bready malts, yeast, crayons, butterscotch. The taste is bitter hops, yeast, candied banana, banana, bready malts. Medium bodied, low carbonation, prickly booze. Decent.
75 cl. champagne-flaske. 9 % . Virker lidt ufiltreret , lys gylden farve. Alkoholen duftes. En udmærket øl.
bottle bought at a belgian beer store. poured a hazy yellow colour with a white head. some belgian yeast, citrus, oranges, orange peel, high carbonation. nice summer beer
Cerveja intensa, com aromas complexos herbais e de malte. O álcool quase não é percebido. Formação alta de espuma.

Bottle from South Bay Drugs: Created a huge puffy pillow of foam that took several minutes to retreat down the cylinder of my glass while the liquid was a glowing blonde hue. My nose was only able to detect a mild and tamed strain of Belgian yeast, but I did notice some extra elements that smelled like sweet sugar cane and brown sugar though. The same can be said about the flavor except that the sugars can be physically tasted as the Belgian yeast hides in the distant background. This does come across exceptionally smooth and having a gentle palate, but also there is a after note of cologne or a mouth wash with only the tiniest mint added in it.
Heerlijk biertje. Goudgeel bier met mooie schuimkraag. Volle romige smaak. Doet zijn naam eer aan als beste triple 2012. Doet denken aan een Karmeliet. Absolute aanrader.
Pours a hazy golden color. Strong aroma of citrus and some floral. Medium sweet taste followed by light bitterness.

Aroma :
Notes of resin, flowers, and most of all fruits, like clementine and citrics. Some yeast (i would say it reminds me of simple bread yeast). Maybe a bit of ginger?
Appearance : 
Pale golden body, yellow with some orangish notes. Hazy, with a minimal white head that had first big air bubble. Brussels laces on the glass.
Taste :
Really powerful triple taste, with some medium sweetness and some hops bitterness at the end, the yeast fade away to give more room to the hops.
Palate :
Creamy medium body, lively carbonatation, a really long finish that give another sweet malt taste at the end.
Overall :
I liked the palate and taste the most, a really nice discover, would compare to the Afliegem Triple for example. Now I have to try more from Het Anker !
Drank in teku glass, poured from a 25cl bottle from fridge.

One of the best, possibly THE best tripels around. Round, smooth, deep. A classic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2014 Goudgeel bier met een rijke schuimkraag die langzaamaan wegebt. Geuren van citrus, honing, abrikoos, perzik en banaan. Zeer romig en vol in de mond. Drinkt lekker weg, alcohol (nochtans 9,5 %) proef je niet. Het rare aan dit bier is dat, midden in een slok, de smaak verandert, de smaak omdraait. Deze twist zal niet iedereen kunnen appreciëren, bij mij gaf het ook een raar en wrang gevoel de eerste keer. Maar heb dit bier intussen al paar gedronken en moet zeggen dat het bier steeds beter wordt naarmate je hem meer drinkt. Hoe meer je dit bier drinkt, hoe beter je het leert kennen en je ook beter het op waarde kunt schatten. Niet mijn favoriete tripel, dat niet, maar desalniettemin toch een lekker bier.

A little bit soapy, hazy blond, fizzy and bitter. Surprisingly not shocking after yesterday party.
