Havde store tanker om Belgisk klasse-øl.
Og er egentlig ikke blevet skuffet. 
Fin let duft....
Fin lettere uigennemsigtig gylden farve.
Fin pondus takket været den høje alkoholvolumen.
MEN jeg tænker at Belgisk øl på højt niveau bør være en anelse mere powerfull.
Undskyldningen er at den er brygget på gamle traditioner, og at moderne ølbrygning har bragt mange gode ting med sig.
Ciao.

Mehrere Flaschen, gekauft bei der Brauerei in Mechelen. - Orangegelb, trüb, enorm viel grobporiger Schaum. Sehr appetliches, hefig-kandissüßes Bukett mit Noten von Orangenlikör. Im Antrunk bittere Orangenschale, Bitterorangenlikör, Kandis, Kräuter (Koriander, evtl. Melisse?). Sehr stark rezent, viel zu schaumig im Mund, fast wie Brause. Auf die schwere Süße folgt ein leicht holzig-bitterer, überraschend trockener Abgang. - Hocharomatisches, eigenwilliges bittersüßes Tripel. Das Bukett verspricht ein Fest, das der Geschmack nicht ganz einlöst. Viel zu rezent, zu hochprozentig und auch zu süß.

This 11.2 oz bottle was $2.49 and what a bargain. I want expecting such a great beer. Solid aroma of yeast and light sweet malts. Taste is super balanced and smooth. It has just the right blend of hops, malts and a slight hint of Belgian yeast. The aftertaste I think is the best part. Very impressed!

33cl bittle at home. Pale slightly hazy orange with a medium white head which didnt last too long. Medium sweetness with some bitter notes and a dry hoppy finish. Citrus, flowers, grass, herbs and some warming alcohol. A quality tripel.

75 cl bottle, bb 16.02.2014, 9%. Hazy light orange color, explosive offwhite head, massiv, bubbly. Pungent nose. Aroma of raisins, white grapes, apple, brown sugar, an hint of caramel, spices, fuity esters, cider, pear. Nice smooth malts with a moderately sharp hops counterpart. Taste is sweet, sticky, moderate bitterness in the finish. Carbonated, medium to full body. Dry, sugary finish. Some alcohol in the finish, but overal cant sense the 9% immediately, but warming.
bottle. Light gold colour. Aroma of fruit, banana, lemon, green tea. Soft, sweet, boozy taste. Very good.

Hazy golden with big, slightly fluffy white head. Looks great! Yeast, nutmeg, herbal, some unripe fruits, nice lightly sweet malts, grassy, lemon peel. Light sweet with yeasty bitterness. Medium bodied, medium and creamy carbonation with slightly thin texture. OK tripel.
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 Stevige smaak, ietwat zoetig maar toch sterk, smaakt naar dennen. Afdronk is goed. Bier schuimt in eerste instantie maar valt snel terug. Troubele kleur

Golden color with huge thick head. Aroma is loads of complex fruit like Passion fruit, peach, citrus and white grapes. This is mixed together with some very nice spicy belgian yeast and some alcohol. Round and full mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Aftertaste is dry and floral with a lot of spicy alcohol. Overall: excellent brew! Aroma is great.
On tap at Biercab. Golden colour with white head. Fruity, malty aroma. Sweet, fruity, malty taste, slightly bitter. Medium to full body.

Reginetta della tripel belghe, è sempre un piacere renderle omaggio. Corpo molto morbido e sapientemente maltato, nasconde dietro la sua grazia un alto grado alcolico che scende pulito, inebriando e seducendo. Da non sottovalutare il ruolo dei luppoli, che ne elevano il gusto oltre lorizzonte tradizionale questo stile, dolce e spigoloso. Tanto di cappello.

A somewhat yellow, little bit cloudy beer with a nice fluffy layer of foam. A sweet, fruity aroma with a touch of apricot. It tastes quite bitter, with a touch of licorice and alcohol. The aftertaste doesnt last long.

Een lichtgeel, iets troebel bier met een mooie schuimige kraag. Zoet fruitig aroma, met de hint van abrikoos. De smaak is vrij bitter, met de hint van alcohol en drop. De nasmaak blijft niet lang hangen.

Big bottle poured into Belgian tulip glass. Very pleasant aroma with a spice undertone. Golden colored tripel with glass-clinging lacing and a light head. Initially tastes very good like a true tripel with the undercurrent of sweetness. It did, however, fall into a slight metallic finish. Additional sips seem to eliminate the metallic taste but something slightly off in general. I would consider this a second tier Belgian tripel but willing to give it another try.

Big corked bottle from haskells. Hazy golden with white head. Smells great. Some citrus. Has typical tripel flavors throughout but I got some metallic flavor. Mouthfeel is ok but effected by the metallic tastes. My first one from this brewery, can see potential.

Bottle 330ml. Clear amber beer with a strong sweet aroma and a sticky white head. In my opinion it has a medium sour taste, but I found it very pleasant. The taste stayed in my mouth long after I drank it.
Bottle at home. clear yellow amber colour with a tall white head; aromas of champagne, then a bit of fruit; balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish. Overall Ok

wazig geel/oranje ondoorzichtig met schuimige witte kraag
aroma is floraal, snoepjes zoetig, biscuitjes
smaken zijn redelijk zoet, matig bitter, sterk, stevig fruitig, citrus, graan, biscuitjes, lichte banaan, witte peper, gist, redelijk kruidig, 
medium body, glad en iets zepig in de mond, hoog van co2, mooi fruitig.

golden, sligthly clouded, a lot of sparkles, huge white head, lasting. Nose: initially overdose on citrus which is dominating, but gradually gains on complexity with sugars, fruity, spices. Taste is citrus, banana, alcoholic. MF: sweet, creamy smooth finish, some alcohol. Overall a complex brew, again "Het Anker" prooves that they are one of the better Belgian breweries still to be discovered by the main public imo. Only negative part is that I have too much citrus in the nose in this one, but can appreciate this fine beer.

This beer gave me the twitch when I first sipped, swirled, breathed in and then swallowed. You know that twitch your body does when it tastes something delicious? Yea, that Listening to Roo Panes - Open Roads is just a plus

33 cL bottle from the LCBO, served in a stem glass. Pours hazy golden with a moderate white, fluffy head that remains and laces well. The nose has notes of pale malts, grassy hops, honey, citrus, fruit and delicate spice. The flavour is moderately sweet with grainy, honeyish malts, a touch of fruit and a nice delicate spiciness. Subtle grassy hops pick up towards the end, as it becomes slightly bitter as well. Distinct banana notes emerge towards the end as well. The finish is long, balanced, grainy, grassy and spicy. On the palate, it is medium in body with a smooth, creamy texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is an excellent tripel, the flavours are elegant, complex and harmonious. It would be interesting to see how this holds up to some aging. 2013-06-22

330ml into a De Struise tulip. Nice cloudy golden color with large persistent head. Smells are caramel, citrus, light funk, bread. Taste is light honey, bread, caramel, cardboard, lemon, orange, bitterness in the finish. Alcohol fairly well hidden. Mouthfeel is fairly thin which amplifies that this tastes somewhat watered-down, which is strange for a 9% ABV beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Belgian triple is one of my favourite styles, the carolus is a good example of why I like them, great appearance with long lasting foam, complex taste with lots of malt and a fruity ending
A new classic guest to my cellar.

Ótima Tripel belga. Cor amarelo-palha com ótima formação de espuma e aroma remetendo frutas amarelas e especiarias, na boca corpo médio, com notas de fermento belga, pêssegos e damasco, com álcool bem inserido. Final longo e aquecedor. Ótima breja!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bu en pression de 33cl, une couleur blonde troublée et une mousse qui tient peu, dû je pense à une mauvaise gazeification de la tirreuse. Une bière fort intéressante au demeurant mais dans la continuité des triples belges, houblonnées juste comme il faut elle manque un peu de corps et de maltage pour la rendre très intéressante.
A porrada no final adormece completamente as notas frutadas tão marcantes no aroma. Melhorou consideravelmente após uma harmonização com linguiça de pernil defumada assada no alcool.
Pale yellow, pours lively. A full bodied triple with a well balanced taste. Hops play nicely with bread, citrus, grass, douch. Long finish.

Cor dourada turva, com espuma de boa formação e persistência. Aroma frutado de frutas amarelas, caramelo e malte. Boa carbonatação. Sabor com o amargor na ponta da língua, frutado, com dulçor médio no meio e final seco e prolongado. Excelente. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Blonde puissante, proche de la Van der Kaizer, mais un peu en-dessous, moins fruitée, plus simple et moins longue. Une triple assez classique au final.
(bottle) clear yellow amber colour with a tall white head; aromas of champagne, then a bit of fruit; balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish

Lemon/alcohol aroma; cloudy golden colour, and constantly quietly sparkling in my Rochefort glass. Delicate mouthfeel thanks to the light fizziness; sweet becoming gradually more bitter, well-balanced; pleasant but not complex.
Bottle from shop. Lovely aroma of grapefruit, citrus and slight alcohol. Looks lovely in glass, with decent head. Fruity, grapefruit and lemon, very little alcohol. Smooth with soft carbonation.

Excellente bière dabbaye, très agréable une fois en bouche.
A réessayer un petit peu plus froide la prochaine fois.

33cl into tulip. Lille.

Appearance: golden orange, cloudy, puffy white head wih good retention. Leaves behind a lot of lacing. 

Aroma: caramel, bananas, wheat, yeast. 

Taste: fairly sweet, subtle bittnerness in the finish. 

Palate: medium body, thin texture short finish. 

A decent triple but it lacks depth. Still enjoyable to drink.
Not the best Triple beer, but nice. Have an unique flavor at the end, like caramel.

330ml bottle from Vanuxeem. An ok triple but lacking a little something. Darker caramel flavours lurk underneath with less fragrant aspects rising through. Generally not as well-balanced as the bigger players but still a lively enjoyable beer.

Blonde trouble au très large col persistant ; bonne pétillance. Arôme marqué par les houblons, malt, fruits et agrumes. Le goût confirme le nez en passant du doux à lamer avec une légère touche métallique sur la fin. Très bonne Triple.

Cerveja de espuma branca e cor de mel. Sabor doce e alcoólico. Corpo médio.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle: aromas of honey, melon, citrus, hops and alcohol. big cream coloured head. the color is golden honey, cloudy. palate is silky smooth, oily. medium+ carbonation. tastes of liquorice, wheat, coriander, hints of cloves nutmeg, hay, slightly sour slightly sweet bitter in the finish. covers its alcohol content well. not impressive, good standard beer.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2013 Bottle 330ml @ home bought @ polet. Pours hazy yellow, medium head that detracts after a while. Aroma is nice, though I can?t really pinpoint what I?m smelling to be honest. Taste is nice as well, with high carbonation! Sweet, citrus. Nice bitter lingering when I swallow. Fine beer, but I expected a little more.

Drinken from a glass
I love belgium trippel.

One of the best i have tasted

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rated from beer log during 2009 Belgium trip... Light golden color, slightly cloudy... Aroma is crisp and citrusy... Sweet flavor, slightly yeasty, but it's the sweetness that gets me, very pleasant gentle bitter finish on the palate... Kind of dry ad sweet too, nice beer, right up there

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml Bottle. Very pretty clear gold pour with abundant frothy white head. Biscuity malt aroma, light lemon zest, peppery yeast notes, they are mild however, the aroma is quite refined. Taste is sweet, light citrusy flavor, surprisingly hoppy I found, grainy, maybe a ever-so-light bit of banana. Palate is aggressively carbed, medium-full body. Somewhere between a very drinkable beer and a filling sipper, light and crisp for its ABV, yet filling and satisfying.

Formou pouca espuma ao ser despejada no copo. Aroma e sabor de pêssego, não muito evidente. Preenche a boca ao beber. Bem encorpada. Álcool sentido no olfato e um pouco menos no paladar. Cerveja para beber aos poucos, degustando, drinkability moderada.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Uma tripel bem interessante. Densa, mas bem agradável de beber.
Kiko Martinez, 29/09/2013.

beetje mistige donker gele met stevige schuimkraag.
geur van citrus en kruidig als in peper.
smaakt zoet fruitig met een kleine metaalachtige nasmaak.

fles 33cl
kleur: lichtgeel bijna wit
geur: fris zurig, hop
smaak: zurig, alcohol hop
Veel koolzuur

Average sized, creamy, white head. Yellow, pale orange body; carbonation slightly present. Intense sugar, cinnamon, caramel, vanilla, cookies in the aroma. Stong body, creamy mouthfeel, bitter finish. Alcohol is very well masked. Fruity (orange) taste, spicy, nice balance.
AR: Malt, Spice, Anis, Caramel AP: Golden T: Sweet P: Long finish. O: Excellent beer !!!
Ez is egy igazán nekem való belga klasszis, ami illatában és ízében is hozza a jelllegzetesen belga gyümölcsös, fűszeres jegyeket. Koriander mindenek felett !

11.2 oz bottle into a Duvel tulip.

A: Pours a golden orange color with vibrant carbonation. Even with a gentle pour, this forms an aggressive, billowy head about four fingers high. Its off-white in shade with a wonderful consistency and impressive/frustrating retention. The lacing it leaves behind is plentiful, as well. This looks just about perfect in the proper glassware (cough).

S: Theres a vibe of both peppers - both black pepper and less-pleasing green bell pepper - and citrus, namely orange. Honey, too. I dont seem to get much of the apple/pear/bread notes typical of Belgian yeast at first, but they pop up once the beer opens up. Nicely complex, even if not every note is perfect.

T: This one is pretty sweet. Honey is the first (and most assertive) flavor I notice, which lasts all the way to the moderately long finish. More typical yeast notes slowly enter past the midpoint, drying out the sweetness (somewhat). The back end also has notes of vanilla and mineral water. Dare I suggest its even metallic? Other than that foible, its decent.

M: What seems like a sweet brew at first becomes pretty dry. Only as it warms up does (mild) alcohol become noticeable - still nothing to detract from the experience. To me, it loses its carbonation a bit too soon, though thankfully it doesnt make this one too syrupy. Good drinkability for a tripel...which means it has great drinkability by regular standards.

O: Pretty good tripel. Not an amazing one, because it doesnt hit all my preferred style buttons the right way (Im not a huge fan of the slight metallic finish, and the booze doesnt quite have that just concealed enough quality of the top-flight tripels). Doubt Id buy it again, but Id never refuse a sample.
Poured bright gold, with a big, bubbly head. Aroma is banana and tropical fruit. Taste is banana and tropical fruits. Great tripel.
lots of carbonation, similar to triple karmeliet. slightly darker color, sharp taste that fades quickly. Good, but not as sweet as a typical triple.

Helloranges Tripel unter Bergen voll massivem Schaum, geil. Unter der ganzen Hefe geht es recht fruchtig zur Sache: Aprikose, Pfirsich, aber auch Koriander und Orangenschale. Gehaltvoller, vollmundiger Antrunk. Im Geschmack eher würzig als fruchtig, aber mit gutem Malzkörper. Relativ abrupter Abgang, nur leicht spritig. Insgesamt ein guter Belgier, der gefährlich süffig ist.
Golden beer with nice white head. Aroma of fruit of malts, just like the taste. Bit bitter aftertast but too much malt.
Pours a golden beer with a good white head. Smells fruity and malts. Tastes pretty good. Little sweet and bitter. Fruity. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.

Shared a 33cl bottle from Delhaize (Luxembourg). It pours a hazy yellow colour with a massive head that after a while turns into a nice and lasting lacing. Aroma is hoppy, wheat, fruity, citrus and light alcohol. Medium carbonation. A complex flavour that goes from sweet to bitter and back so quickly. Good! The only drawback was the metallic finish.

Bottle from Podges Belgian Beer Bar at Ipswich Beer Festival. Pours a hazy pale orange colour, with a large white head. Spiced, fruit and wheat aroma with hint of caramel. Rich, creamy texture, fairly sweet, soft carbonation.

bottle from, not sure. good aroma, sweet. honey, floral. yeasty. clean brownish orange color, good head that faded to a ring, spotty lace. sweet flavor. thick body, creamy heavy mouthfeel, sweet finish. real sweet. has some buttery notes, minor little spiced notes.clove. overall aroma and flavor are good, but not personnally appealing to me. Just not a beer Id drink a bunch of...
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Golden yellow with a huge white fluffy head. Aromas are spicy with hints of citrus and yeast. Buttery flavors, with floral and spicy notes.
Indeed one of the best trippels. Its malty, yeasty, sweet, subtly bitter and has some nice notes of fruit.
Bottle from a shop in Belgium, stored in my cellar for 2 years. Fruity smell with hints of honey and flowers. Similar taste, sweet but light body. Well hidden alcohol.
Draft at brasserie het anker. Pours clear dark yellow with a small white head. Aroma and taste of star anice and cloves. Nice body but spices are a tad overwhelming... naaah

Pours out in a light cloudy orange-golden colour with steady head and medium body. Nose of ripe hops and toffee. Taste of Belgian yeast, light malripe hops, grass, toffee, torf and caramel. Hints of vanilla. Smooth and easy finish. Enjoyed it but not as much as its score might tell you. It is just another Belgian beer, most of them (not all!) are replaceable with any other BSA.

Der Schaum ist schon rekordverdächtig, das Bierchen jedoch nicht. Fluffig ist es schon, aber recht simpel aufgebaut. Der Alkohol beherrscht den Hitergrund und vorne raus gibt es nur Hefe, etwas Hopfen und ein klein wenig Vanille. Die Optik besiegt hier den Geschmack. - Trinkbar, aber recht eintönig - zumindest nicht sehr getreidig und somit recht süffig.

Bottle @ il cortiletto. Appena aperta rivela la sua natura. è una bomba alla frutta. Dolce e intenso allinverosimile, ma non stucchevole, è invitante, alcolica, calda.
I frutti più riconoscibili sono languria matura, la banana e lalbicocca. Sui secondari cè anche il cocco essiccato ed un lievito classico belga. Non è una tripel ortodossa. é quasi più una strong ale. Colore ambra carico con evidente carbonatazione. Schiuma bianca fine e compatta. Media persistenza.Il gusto è molto più sottile. perde la potenza che ha al naso. Ritorna il dolce fruttato, ha quasi un sapore vinoso, di passito, ma è anche luppolata in maniera morbida e subdola, perché non è mai amara ma al contempo non impasta la bocca e invita alla beva. Corpo pieno. Ottima ma troppo discordante naso/bocca

Golden hazy colour, and thick silky yellowish head. Spicy smell, also candy sugar. Taste is quite sweet, raisins, but maybe also some metallic notes in the end. After all, a dry finish. Medium body and medium carbonation.
A good tripel, sure, but I had better ones.

Bottle @ home, picked up @ Wilburs Fort Collins. Pours a cloudy yellow orange appearance with a khaki head. Very big bubblegum, spicy yeasty, light banana, lemon cream pie aroma. Slightly tart, lemon, really big bubblegum, herbal spicy yeasty flavor. A bit tangy but pretty tasty.

330ml bottle. Pours a clear pale yellow with a one finger white head of fine bubbles. A beautiful complex aroma of lemon peel, ginger, alcohol, light honey, dried sultanas, dried apricots, light banana notes, and floral notes. Excellent carbonation with sweet dried fruits up front, light burnt sugar notes, a faint tang throughout, alcohol, with some alcohol burn, and clove in the finish. This is good. Ill definitely pick up more!

Orange amber body with great white head. Smell of peach, citrus, yiest. Taste is fruity and little alcoholic. Awesome beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

pours very light , yellowish . white foam (smaller than expected ) , fades very quick . smell has hints of hay, and honey , grains. 

taste is very full . very grainy ! somewhat sweetened as well, i believe . nice grainy finish. very good one ! if this had a funny name / special glass / label, it would be extremely popular in belgium .

Bottle. Pours a very hazy orange-amber color with a reasonably thick off-white head on it. Nose is a little sweet, but with some orange citrus undertones to it that make it seem a little fruity. Taste is definitely a bit sweet, but with a slight sour fruity bite to it. A little heavy, but very drinkable.

750 ml corked and caged bottle. Bright yellow gold color with huge bubbles topped by a massive rocky white head. Sweet yeasty citrus malt aroma has notes of lemon peel and coriander. Upfront flavor has notes of sweet malt, yeast and apricots. Some spicy hops in mid taste. Finish is dry with noticeable alcohol. Overall, very nice with well rounded smooth malt/hop balance.
Bottle. Pours a dark gold colour with a thin white head, light malty and fruity aroma, taste is light with a touch of sweetness with a dry finish.
UPDATED: SEP 28, 2013 750 ml bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy gold with full head. Aromas of lemons, banana, and slight floral notes. Flavors of lemons, honey, white pepper, copper and yeast.

330ml Bottle - Hazy golden with a foamy head. Yeast, lemon, grain and bubblegum in the aroma. Full-bodied taste with spicy lemon, yeast, peach and some soapy hints detected. Really tasty and one of the best tripels Ive ever had.
Van de tap @ charlies. Goudblonde trippel, zurige triple, trekkend mondgevoel. Bitterzure afdronk. Redelijk trippel

Pours a pale straw colour with nearly no head. Alcohol legs around the top.
Smell is slightly of banana, peaches, citrus, and yeast. 
Taste is of ripe fruits, especially banana and peach. Also has hints of spices, and alcohol. Very nice!
Medium to high carbonation. Medium body with a nice fruity finish!
A very nice beer, enjoyed by myself and my girl. Will keep a bottle or two around!
lovely tripel beer thats different from most other tripels. It has a fresh citrussy aroma and its a little bit cloudy in appearance.
Nice golden appearance. Very full bodied feeling palate. Perfectly balanced bitterness. This is the best tripel I am yet to have!
Slightly hazy appearance with very little sedimentation. Very heavy foam. Strong taste, not to bitter, slightly sweet and refreshing. One of the better triple style beers.
Bottle->Trappist. Hazy gold with frothy white head. Aroma: caramel, citrus hops, apples, yeast. Taste is sweet fruit, yeast and grains. Decent.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2013 Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of hops, malts and spices. White pepper. Malty flavour, quite bitter. Spicy warming white pepper finish.
Nice tripel! The white pepper gives an interesting touch.
(Draught @ the brewery cafe)

Bought a bottle at Berts Bierhuis. Has a light golden color, nearly the color of a pilsner and a large white head and is perfectly carbonated. Aroma of hops, malts, yeast and citrus fruits. Has a bitter and light sweet taste with an intense taste of hops and spices. The afterdrunk is a little dry and has a medium bitter. Afterall, this is one of the best triples Ive drunk so far.

750ml bottle, 20/06/13. Pours golden orange with a large, white head. Aroma is orange and mandarin in the beginning. Turns fermented apple, sweet lemon, pale malt after a short while. Taste is semisweet with lemon, fermented fruit, apricot, ethanol is quite strong on the finish. Quite full and carbonated. Great aroma but flavor leaves a bit to be desired.

A perfect looking tripel! Slightly hazy, medium golden body with a large, creamy, white head that leaves big patches of foam on my trappist chalice. The aroma is strong and sweet, but with some crisp acidity as well. Everything is louder than everything else: its more spicy, more fruity and its got more citrus than the average tripel, also pleasant yeasty notes. The taste is moderate sweet with a moderate to light bitter finish. The quite strong flavours have all the right components: spices, Belgian yeast, fruits and a pleasant alcoholic sting, but unfortunately there are some disturbing chalky dry notes of bakers yeast. The chalkiness creeps in mid-palate and ruins the aftertaste. The chalk makes the mouthfeel very dry and not that pleasant. The body is medium and the carbonation is prickling lively. An ok tripel. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 3 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Blonde plutôt dorée trouble, belle pétillance, mousse abondante et persistante. Bel équilibre entre malt et houblon, entre épices et fruits, entre douceur et amertume, petite sécheresse métallique sur la fin. Une triple supérieure!

Bouteille de 33 cl. Belle couleur dorée,mousse très abondante de belle tenue. Belle palette aromatique, complexe, des arômes fruités, du fruit exotique au fruits secs, de la céréale et une belle amertume houblonneuse en finale. La bière jouit dun bel équilibre et dune carbonnation très vivante. Trouvée à lEntrepôt - Courcelles les Lens.

Kaatuu lasiin vaaleankullankeltaisena ja kirkkaana, vaahto on noin 2 sormen paksuinen ja tasaisesti katoava jättäen hyvin niukkaa pitsiä. Haju ilmaisee, että ollaan hedelmäisemmän tripelin puolella, vaikka mausteisuuttakin löytyy sitruksen tueksi. Belgihiivaakin on ja kaiken kaikkiaan tuntuu hieman Karmelietin ja Chimayn valkoisen yhdistelmältä. Maku ei huutoon ihan niin hyvin pysty vastaamaan, siinä on marjaista mausteisuutta ja belgihiivaa, alkoholikin tuntuu hieman. Loppuliuku on sitruunaisen puolelle kääntyvä. Suutuntuma on hiilihappoinen ja hieman lämmittävä, vaikka periaatteessa onkin raikas. Haju on upea GC:n tripelissä, tosiaan kuin Karmelietin ja Chimayn hybridi, mutta maku jää hieman perään. Raikas tapaus ja lämpimään päivään sopiva.

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 05.03.2016. Pours hazy orange in color with a creamy whote head. Garden ripe fruity 
aroma, some spicyness and notes of lavender in aroma. Quite spicy in taste, a bit of pepper, some softer notes, ripe fruityness and light notes of grassyness in taste. Smooth and easy to drink. Dried apricot and peachy notes in aftertaste. Nice drink for hot summer days.

From a 33 cl bottle shared at home.  Pours a cloudy gold with a thick white head that slowly recedes.  Light nose with some lemon and ginger.  Refreshing with some floral notes and whtie toast.  A really nice tripel.

Is it a tripel or a blond? It says both on the bottle. Tasted like a blond to me but more complex. Lots of malt, some fruit and hops in the finish. Golden in color and plenty of fizz made it refreshing.

Aroma: Strong Malt: Smooth, Sweet, Toasty. Hops: Light, floral, resin.
Appearance: Head: Huge, frothy, long lasting, lacing, white. Body: Hazy, pale gold.
Taste: Medium high dryness, medium sweetness. Spicy. Fruity (orange).
Palate: Thin body. Very effervescent.
Overall: Not something that I really enjoyed. The aroma was great, but the taste was less bold than I hoped. It is a good beer, but it will not be on my list of favorite beers.
330ml Bottle, Poured.
Very nice! One of the best tripell ive had so far. nice hop taste with a subtle lemon taste!

one finger head and veary carbinated for a brief little while. smells of like citrus and mmabye champagine like n spicy/hoppy. Smells lie something good for a summers night and or to celebrate with. Taste is an orange citrus taste,with a grassy hoppy taste and some champagine like taste. Heavy bodied and leavs a warming throw out the bodi throat and head. Taste some mabye even honey like notes. Its not fantastic to me bt it is nice and I do like it. Cheers!
750 ml. bottle. Golden yellow with a huge white fluffy head. Aromas are spicy with hints of citrus and yeast. Buttery flavors, with floral and spicy notes. Hops on the finish.
Bottle from LCBO.  Hazy gold with a huge foamy white head.  Aroma of lemon, yeast, and spice.  Light sweet malt, spice, and alcohol dominate the taste.

2013/05/12 - Pours a hazy orange straw color with a large, rocky, white head. Aroma is yeast, biscuit and lots of citrus. Taste is yeast, citrus (mainly orange) and spices. Mouthfeel is medium and smooth with lots of sharp carbonation and a warming, boozy finish. Smooth and well balanced. A great triple. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle, poured into a tulip glass, at home. ABV 9%, a bit too high to begin the day but oh,well.
Bright golden yellow colour on the body, with a big, no, huge, snow white head on top, with very good retention, thick and soapy, leaving lots of dried lacing around the glass.
Fruity aromas, a bit of yeast, citrus and floral hops. Very nice.
Very nice taste as well, begins slighty sweet but soon turns to a nice bitterness, with lots of citrus fruits, a bit of fruity bubblegum at the very end, quite hoppy too. No sigh of the alcohol on the taste.
Medium thin body, good soft carbonation, with an airy feeling, very dry on the palate.
World class tripel.

This was quite good. The tripel essentially denotes the alcohol content, that being 9%. Historically the XXX was a tripel, so the X is 3% and the XX is 6%.  I found that it didnt hide the alcohol quite as well as some other beers in this style. Still, it was enjoyable.

Hazy amber color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, caramel, fruit, & clove; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, fruit, caramel, some hops, and spice; Warm finish; Nicely balanced; Very good - classic tripel.

one finger head and veary carbinated for a brief little while. smells of like citrus and mmabye champagine like n spicy/hoppy. Smells lie something good for a summers night and or to celebrate with. Taste is an orange citrus taste,with a grassy hoppy taste and some champagine like taste. Heavy bodied and leavs a warming throw out the bodi throat and head. Taste some mabye even honey like notes. Its not fantastic to me bt it is nice and I do like it. Cheers!

caramel, bubblegum, clove, alcohol, citrus, banana, golden, cloudy, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter/sour finish
Pour is a hazy golden, even with leaving 1/2 inch of beer at the bottom of the bottle. White foam of tight bubbles leave some lacing. Belgian yeast with bubblegum, clove, banana (almost like a weizen) with some sweetness and spice. A bit of fresh citrus and some alcohol as the the head falls.  Taste has subtle sweetness and bitterness combining with a more forward sourness.  Very slick mouthfeel with a surge of carbonation for an otherwise light carbonated glass.  A bit of alcohol warmth and a bitter/sour aftertaste that turns once again sweet/sour in the finish. A fun beer. Reminds me a lot of Duvel, but a thicker body, and much darker golden.  Very nice.

330ml bottle. Slightly hazy golden body, huge white head with excellent retention. Aroma of yeast, spices, apricot, herbal hops, honey. Taste is light and refreshing: herbal hops, plenty of spices, pear, sweet malt, cloves. Very enjoyable.

Hazy apricot colour with stiff and lathery head. Honey, apricot jam, and mandarin orange on the nose. Only a light yeastiness on the nose, as the overall impression is of lively citrus and honey. In the palate, a little thin and heavily effervescent, with sourness and bitterness in equal quantities. Considerable (and not entirely pleasant) mineral-steeliness. Very short finish. Almost aborted finish. Alcoholic. I expect a creamier texture and more spiciness.

330 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a hazy golden yellow with large, puffy white head.  Aroma is banana, wheat, bubble gum and citrus.  Flavour is full of sweet fruit - banana, lemon and pear - with wheat and clove notes.  Alcohol is quite subtle.  Rather nice.
Its like a strong white beer. Has the usual wheaty and grainy texture, the haziness in the beer. Fruity flavours, not too sweet, balanced by some bittering spices. Lovely smooth beer!
Golden pour, delicate white head.  Aroma of straw, yeast, alcohol. Mildly sweet, boozy and bready, pleasant dry finish. Very nice example of the style.
Golden, sweet and sour with a long finish and a beautiful frothy head. One of the best tripel I ever tried.

330 mL bottle.  Pours a slightly cloudy golden with a thick mousse.  Aromas of banana, clove, coriander, chewing gum and a touch of ginger.  A touch of sweetness, and a yeasty mid palate, leading into a zesty hop finish. Herb and floral notes on the lingering finish.  Creamy on the palate with high carbonation. A solid tripel, well made.

Pours lovely light orange golden (hazy), with a massive frothy white head that continues to lace all the way down the glass.  Fruit aromas feature prominently, along with spicy peppery notes.  Medium body, moderately high carbonation, fruit flavours abound, I get pear, citrus and even some blackberry.  Finishes nice and bitter, whether due to hops or the belgian yeast I am not sure.  Lingering alcohol warmth.  Stonking.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2016 33cl, Het Anker 6x33cl sampler from brewer @Brugs Bierfestival 2013. - Was very impressed and surprised with the extreme fruitiness of its aroma and taste: a whole basket of ripe fruits (pear, banana, mango, lychee) is contained in its yeast profile and offset nicely by earthy herbal hops - then, the syrup set in and with the next sips, this refreshing bouquet turned into a fruit coulis, getting stickier with every gulp. Low carbo for a Belgian tripel. Truly a dessert tripel - any chance of ever brewing this without the added liquid sugars? Surely malts, yeast and hops this fine can do without the cloying palates of yesteryears preference? // Rerate after many BH tasting 33cl bottles: fresh, natural lemon and flowery aroma makes this tripel worth while digging in and offsets the banana and peach compote fruit sugars, adding balancing dryness. Has the recipe become hoppied or drier in the last years?

(330mL bottle from LCBO) Pours a slightly hazy orange-gold with a huge meringue of white head that faded slowly and left huge lacing. Aroma of pear, green apple, bubblegum, lemon, pale sweet malt, light Belgian yeast. Flavour apple, orange/lemon, candy sugar, pale malt, sweet at first. As it starts to dry, mild yeast spices, bubblegum, some hop bitterness in the middle. Returns to a bit of sweetness on the finish, lingering apple and sugar. Mouthfeel medium-full, carb soft and effervescent though most seemed to end up in the top half of my Duvel tulip in the head. Alcohol light on the finish. Good tripel, well-balanced, no complaints but not quite in the top echelon.

Gold coloured beer with nice foam head that has nice small bells. Great fruity aroma and smooth drinking beer. The start is fruity and the level of the alcohol is tempering the bitterness of this beer. The aftertaste is middle long and the hop bitterness is not overwhelming but more balanced. 

---Rated By the Belleketels

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy golden orange with a good amount of foamy white head and a bit of visible carbonation. Smell is sweet caramel and grassy citrus fruity hops, a nice balance. Palate is medium bodied with very strong and active carbonation. Taste is sweet at first though its hard to tell with all the carbonation, and then gets bitter for a short bit before leaving a short sweet aftertaste. Pretty good, though the carbonation is a bit overwhelming and the taste isnt quite there.

More Carolus at the LCBO... awesome !  Pours a slight hazy golden-yellow colour with a frothy white cap, good retention and soapy lacing. Nice aromas of green apples and pears with citrus notes and mild Belgian Ale yeast. Cannot feel the alcohol much, wet mouthfeel. Mild fruit taste with more of the apples, some light spices and soothing yeast. One of the easier drinking Tripel.
Good aroma that is sweet with slight caramel taste as you drink but lingers and stregthens afterwards....very unique...approaching barleywine territory

Bottle. Pours  opaque golden  with a fine lacing and fully lasting off-white huge head, Aroma is wheat, honey, bubblegum, pear, apple, citrus, straw, herbs, some tart fruit, faint phenols and fusel. Taste is medium sweet and light tart. Body is medium, texture is sticky/creamy, carbonation is moderate. Finishes fruity and honey-sweet.

Mostly clear golden yellow, soft pour leaves the yeast deposit in the bottle and a lasting creamy white cap. Fruity malty yeasty spicy aroma. Sweet fruity malt taste, lightly spiced, yeasty with a mild hop bite. First sip was quite strong, but mellows and lightens quickly, ABV well hidden. Lively carbonation, medium bodied, moderately hopped. Long lasting fruity dry finish. Very nice. NFL (Not For Lagerboys)

It pours a very murky hay colour with brownish tints (a bit repulsive). The aroma has notes of: orange marmalade, a mineral quality, lemon-zest, candy-sugar, pepper, and alcohol. The taste is medium sweet that finishes dryer; there are notes of: orange-marmalade, lemon-zest, pepper, alcohol, and a unpleasant skunk note on the finish (like a Heineken). The palate is medium bodied, boisterous (big mouth-feel), heavy carbonation (very tiny bubbles), and a medium long finish. Overall, theres a very unpleasant finish to this beer that leaves a cheap malty skunk taste in your mouth.

330 mL bottle.  Hazy orange-yellow (not particularly appealing) with a small, sticky white head.  The aroma is malty for the style, with fruity yeast, and some spice.  Everything comes together nicely in the flavour, along with some gentle hopping.  Booze well hidden.  Fairly high carbonation.  Dry finish.  Nice tripel.

Pale, gold, thick head which died down but remained.
 Aromas of apricot, floral, very fresh.
A little sweet on the palate, dried apricots, 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours foggy yellow with medium white head
Aromas of skumbanan, belgian yeast, bread
It has the characteristics of an abbey tripel but lacks all the extras. Overall good. Not more

Bottle. Pale gold with fluffy head, fine lacing. Heady aromas of fruit and hops, grainy sweetness as well. Fizzed like champagne in the glass, but was smooth and rounded. Juicy. Nice depth of flavour, but nothing on the Classic.

Appearance: Hazy yellow-orange with floaters and a tall white head.
Aroma: Candy sugar and vitamins.
Flavor: Malt, candy sugar and citrus - orange. Soft dry finish.

Pours a slightly cloudy pale yellow brew with a big white head to regular retention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to low bitter with notes of spices, fruty esters and citrics, médium bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to low bitter with notes of spices, caramel, citrics and fruity esters.
Cerveza con toques a flores muy rica en paladar con toques alcohólicos en el aroma, muy buena elección.

75cl. Bottle. 
Pours hazy dark yellow with white head. 
Aroma citrus, yeast, orange, sugar. 
Taste bitter, sweet, hint of sour. 
Mouthfeel creamy. 
Nice tripel, well balanced.

11.2oz bottle. from The Party Source. Best by 21/04/14. Mostly clear golden yellow / orangeish color. Outrageously big foamy white head (typical belgians..). Good foamy lace. Orange-citrus in the nose, some acidity. Candy-fruit, and some floral hop in the nose. Soft,  more pronounced strong carbonation. Bit of a bite in the finish. Bigger body. Hop profile here is stronger than in most tripels Ive had... But to me, its kind of a distinctly unfresh type of hop flavor, with a soapy malty sweetness. Some apricot, candy sweet fruit flavors. Light bit of sour. Sugary sweet finish. Probably way better fresh.
Cloudy gold pour with a thick fluffy head. Sour, spicy, fruity nose. Taste is sweet, bready, spicy mix with a little alcohol warmth.

Bottle 75cl. Hazy orange yellow. Aroma has sour mix, apricot, apples and roses.  Flavour is wine-ish, sweet apricot. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0,75l at Haandverkstuene, Oslo. Aroma: Inhaling apricot, exhaling rose. Taste: Apricot, some lemon, candy sugar. Dryish finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

hazy murky brownish orange 2 finger fluffy head

nose is banana runts, grapefruit and bready yeast

taste is sweet with loads of brown sugar, caramel and candied apples. hint of cloves and spicy yeast.

3.7/5 but still a it too sweet.

Poured a slightly hazy golden liquid. Dense and persistent white foam, with a nice lacing. Citrus aroma. Flavor is orangy, with hints of honey. Medium bodied beer. Alcohol is present but very well balanced into flavors. Dry aftertaste. Very nice tripel !

Pours a cloudy golden yellow color with a very large head that is thick and fluffy. Very highly carbonated bottle. The scent is rich with yeast and bready hints. Hops and other earthy tones are evident as well. Taste is mild and creamy. Every ingredient mixes quite well for a bready, earthy grain taste. A really great brew from Belgium. This may have been a 9% beer but it certainly didnt taste like it.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours hazy golden with a huge frothy white head. Aroma is yeasty with light malt and citrus. Taste is light sweet initially, good balanced, fresh citrus and yeast, well hidden alcohol. Medium bodied.
A better tripel in my world.
UPDATED: FEB 19, 2013 Nothing of special, one citrus and soft hop charachter tripel beer, pale golden-orange colour,  overestimated

cloudy, pale golden body, huge white head which, however collapses within few minutes; aroma of yeast and candy sugar; taste of candy sugar, yeast, alcoholic sweetness, some sourish background and mnimial hoppy bitterness; excellent belgian ale; strongly recommended for belgial beer fans

Definitely a well done tripel, clear amber color (maybe too much clear), and a tall white head. Aroma is yeasty, a lot of banana, yellow fruits, red fruits, some malty too. Taste is sweet but not syrupy, the lively carbonation and oily texture are very pleasant.
Aroma is sweet and zesty. It is a great looking golden beer. The flavour is sweet, peppery with a touch of fruity esters. Touch of honey also present. Overall great belgian beer!
For a triple, this is somewhat light. Nice honey aroma, great gold color. Flavor is light and mild and conceals the alcohol well.
UPDATED: MAR 26, 2013 33cl bottle at BXL East.  Pours a clear, golden color. Medium-bodied and very drinkable. Spice and fruit notes.

Pours light amber with big white head.  Floral and citrus smell with sweet overture.  Taste is slightly soapy but not in a bad way.  Lemon and yeast taste.  Okay.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Rootz, Den Haag.  Pours hazy golden with a big white head.  Aroma of yeast, citrus, apricot, orange and light caramel.  Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Classy beer from the always reliable Het Anker. Big stewed apricot nose and bubblegum nose. Really nice. Big carbonation - possibly too carbed for me. Lots of stewed apricot, some lemon, candi sugar. Dryish finish. Really well made and unique - its difficult to describe its true flavour. Wonderful.
UPDATED: APR 16, 2013 Licht troebel goudblond bier. Aroma licht pittig, brood, vanille, hop. Smaak is bitterzoet. Licht waterig, maar zacht palet.
330 ml bottle, nice appearance and aroma with medium taste. Good but not that good as other tripels.
Bottle @ Belgian Brew Fest.  Good Tripel with serious sweetness and depth.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Pours dingy golden with small white head.  Little lacing, low/medium carbonation, and pale candy sugar aroma.  Taste is pale candy sugar, pear, some yeast, and hops to balance the finish.  Expected more based on the ratings.
(From notes 16.11.12) Tap. Smells similar to La Chouffe. Smooth mouthfeel, hardly any carbonation. A bit sweet, nutty, butter. Good beer. Served perhaps a bit too cold (I would have prefered warmer).

33 cl bottle. The aroma is spicy and fruity, especially citrus. Pale yellow color and fast fading white head. Body is medium, texture slick and slightly creamy, carbonation lively. Carbonated mouthfeel with a bitter citrus dry. The finish is abrupt and dry. Very good triple, but not great, in my opinion.

2012.12.09 - 11.2oz bottle in tulip glass.  Pours an opaque light caramel.  Massive foamy 3 finger head sticks around, literally, subsiding to "just" one finger after a bit.  Aroma is mild breadiness and spices.  Reminded me of Weyerbacher Seventeen so maybe some of the same citrus peel or peppercorn.  Taste is sweet maltiness typical of many Belgians with, again, a spice offset reminiscent of Weyerbacher Seventeen (to me).  Mouthfeel is medium, a bit of creaminess.  Just a bit of alcohol on the back end.   I wouldn't drink a ton of this, but this one is going down pretty quick.  Classic is one of my favorite beers, and I'm not yet a big Tripel fan so this turned out about how I expected.
This brewery is capable of hitting them out of the park this one Ill call a triple. Pun intended. A solid brew but not one of my favorite for the style

0.75 bottle. The beer is slightly hazy, color hangs between yellow and coppery, and swings either way depending on light intensity. Head is white and big of quite good retention. Nice aroma, typical Belgian mixture of hops, citrus and spices with particularly strong hints of lemon, sugar and an uncanny addition of yeasts. Taste is sweet in a fruity manner somewhat more than a typical tripel although not to a fault, also the lemon and banana are much more featured. A little bit of bitterness on the side does not allow it to lose refreshing qualities. Body is medium, texture creamy and slightly slick as well, carbonation lively or even fizzy. Finish is medium in length, follows the taste and aroma but the characteristic lemon taste is toned down, it is also bitterer and thus not so balanced. With small reservations this beer is splendid. What is surprising is that the brew is not perfumed but the high alcohol content is perfectly covered anyway.

75 cl bottle @ home, BBE 17.07.2015
Aroma has soapy citrus and fruity notes. Also some Belgian yeast. Flavour has soapy citrus, fruity notes and hints of floral notes. Also urinal cake on some sips. Yeasty, somewhat tart and Saison-like finish. Palate is foamy and too high on CO2. Good tripel!

Golden brew topped by a nice and dense white head. Quite good looking. Aromas of coton candy, tea and some alcohol... not much of the characteristic tripel aromas. Flavor is some spice with a nice malt sweetness. Alcohol shows up once more in a warming way but it is never too much/annoying. Good brew.

P.S. I picked up some heavy black licorice after writing down this rating. Nice!

Aromas frutales, principalmente manzanay ligeramente citrico, a cascara de naranja.

De apariencia excelente. Color dorado con destellos claros a la luz, ligeramente turbia. Carbonatación alta, cuerpo medio, Corona de espumas amplia, abundante y de larga retención.

En boca las 3 principales sensaciones a destacar son picor por el grado alchólico y la alta carbonatación; ligero amargor y calor en la garganta.

Al paladar, cerveza compleja pero exquisita. Cerveza densa en donde destacan los sabores frutales frescos, principalmente manzana, pera, durazno. El alcohól se percibe aun que no abruptamente dejando esa sensación cálida en garganta. Final de media duración, agradable!

En resumen hablamos de una más de las sensacionales cervezas de Het Anker, la cual es totalmente disfrutable para terminar el día (Como en esta ocasión). Cerveza compleja y en todo momento frutal. Exquisita!!
Hazy gold,fast fading white head.Sweet yeasty nose.Yeasty citrus orange peel palate. Great bodied and complex
---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours cloudy amber with decent fluffy white head. Nice aroma, lots of citrus and bread. Taste is usual sweet bready malts, lemon and some mint(!?!).

Hazy light amber with huge white head. Smells of sweet citrus lemony chemical cleaning product type smell, but the sweet smell makes it overall pleasant. Carbonated mouthfeel with a bitter citrus dry. Not bad but probably wouldn't get again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 mL bottle from Total Wine in Virginia Beach, VA.  Yellowish-orange pour with a frothy white head.  Aroma is perfumy and clean with light citrus, talcum powder, and faint ground pepper.  The taste is what I have come to expect from a tripel but it the citrus is a bit heavier than some (although certainly not too much).  This is another excellent example of a tripel.

Flaske fra Belgisk Bryg: fantastisk skum som varer en stund. Deilig tripel-aroma med maltsødme og diskrete humlenoter. Smaken og munnfylden er upåklagelig, ettersmaken likeså - en super tripel som jeg må ha flere av.
Une bonne triple, puissante avec un peu de gout, mais cette carolus triple est moins convaincante que dautre.

Pours hazy yellow with an abundant white foam.
Nose: banana, coriander, cereals, yeast.
First mouth: smoothy, sweet and crispy balanced with mid-bitterness.
Finishes on orange blossom and citrus notes.
Very nice tripel, a bit like Karmeliet.

on tap @ Het Anker.
Warm sweet aroma of fruits and herbs.
Lacing head on the nice golden beer.
Taste as well is fruity and full. Sweet but some sour citrus as well.
Warm mouthfeel, some alcohol in the finish.
Vynikajici trippel, na ochutnavxe nejlepsi. Lahvac dovezeny z belgie, koupeny v delvite.
Daurada , color fantastic molt refrescant, considerant que es una triple , afruitada, amb aromes lleugers.

Into a Duvel tulip.  A cloudy gold colour that reminds me of a a Belgian white rather than a Tripel.  Mild white head, slow to dissipate.  Aroma is very nice; banana and Belgian yeast, sweet.  Taste echoes the bananas and yeast, carbonation rather strong.  Sweetness, fruit, mild citrus, closes on a hoppy note, the 9.0% ABV is quite obvious.  Mouthfeel is the familiar richness of a  Belgian Tripel but ruined a bit by that carbonation.  I think it would improve with some age; give it time to mellow out that effervescence and alcohol and let the other flavours mature.  Overall quite good.
Une des meilleures triple !

Very sweet, coriander aroma, thin head. Golden yellow. Had almost a menthol taste. Zesty finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sweet and banana dominate the aroma. The color is a great golden with a good size lasting head. Taste has an interesting zest, perhaps the ABV. Ends with a zest and lightness on the palate. Fun and tasty.

Bottle served in a tulip. Pours cloudy orange with a monster white head. Excellent retention and foamy lace. Lively aroma of fruity esters, yeast, and herbal hops. Medium sweet, yeast-forward flavor. Lively carbonation on the attack. Medium body, creamy-yeasty texture, and a doughy, dry finish. Really good. No date stamp on the bottle, but this one is coming off quite fresh and has little funk. The 9% abv is so well disguised I could session this and happily pay the price.

This is a great tripel, boarders on quad territory.  The nose is dominated by zesty lemon citrus and musty belgian yeasts and malts - alcohol is definitely perceived.  Tastes and feels great - very spicey, malt and yeasty.  Difficult to describe in detail, just excellent.

Bottle shared at Colonel Mustard summer 2011
Yellow hazy, thick white head. Aroma of malts, spice, pepper and grass. Taste is medium sweet, quite malty. FInish is medium to heavy bitter, nice hops

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Mitra. A bright hazy golden with a dense white head. One of the fruitiest flowery aromas Ive ever experienced in a tripel. Taste is likewise but with a fair amount of hoppy bitterness. Well concealed alcohol which makes it dangerously well drinkable with its 9% ABV. Great long aftertaste which leaves you wanting for another sip or rather gulp. An outstanding tripel

FLES 33 CL
Mooie bijna witte schuimkraag, mooie consistentie. Kleur goudgeel. Aroma heeft frisse fruitige maar ook kruidige geuren waaronder koriander.
Smaak fris tintelend met een beetje zoethout (lakritz) afdronk. In de vrij lange afdronk komen de mooie mouttonen opzetten met een licht bittertje.

Highly carbed, fluffy, bright white head over cloudy golden beer. Bright, wheaty aroma. Flavor a surprise darker, richer, phenolic, fairly dry for 9%. Finish is a tiny bit cloying/tongue coating, could be drier or hoppier. Upon warming it becomes completely clear: the strongest chill haze ive seen. This beer i would not get again, but Ill try the brewery again.

Bottiglia 75 cl.
Ottima Tripel, dorata con schiuma bianca fine e persistente, naso intenso e complesso con note fruttate e speziate dei lieviti in primo piano, poi sentori di miele e scorza darancia.
Entra in bocca calda, morbida e persistente.....chiude ancora con note dolci...
buona buona.......

Bottle (330 ml). Clear golden with a small white head and good lacing. Aroma of fruits, malt, floral notes and light spices. Taste of malt, spices, citrus and floral notes. Slightly acidic mouthfeel. Very good belgian tripel. Alcohol is well hidden.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours pale blond with medium white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of citrus, fruits, flowers, spices. Taste is of citrus, spices, malt, sweet, sligth acidic. Overall: Alcohol well-hidden. Nice spices. Drinkable. Very good.

Outstanding beer. One to stock up on a give special friends. This is a gourmet beer that can be had with any meal or alone. The flavor is not overpowering but of a sweet, wheaty bread, with a hint of citrus and strawberry flavor. There is little to no after taste and the aroma is slightly sweet and citrus smelling. Mine first was in a bottle and I loved it. Definitely alot of head from this beer, more than any ive had before, but after a few minutes after pouring, its one of the best ive ever tasted. You will laugh how much head this beer has, but so worth the wait .

The last of a gift pack from LVF. Its been in the cellar for 1 1/2 years. I usually dont like tripels but this is unreal. Dark orange/yellow pour. Big white head in a Gouden Carolus goblet. Not much on the nose. Some citrus. Crazy good complexity. Citrus and honey come to play. Slight tartness pokes in at the end. All the flavor blends together, though. Great balance. Smooth delivery. Amazing beer. They make a lot of good beers, but this one is right near the top. 062512
