Head: creamy white colored foam. Color: golden. Aroma: ripened fruit. Taste: mild, some bitter. Palate: mild, lasting. Overall: very nice.

Orange pour with a light off white head. Sweet yeasty apple aroma. Smooth fruity apple plum and gig flavors, medium bodied

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A very nice tripel! Wheat, yeast, coriander and a bit citrusy, also very refreshing.

Voilà un véritable chef doeuvre...
Une « gouden carolus », cest-à-dire bien sûr une « golden carolus »,
une vraie bière dor. Une triple à 9 % abv... Un très beau programme.
En plus mon exemplaire était exactement au jour près à sa date limite !
Une véritable fête, un récital, une bière qui force ladmiration et le respect.
Couleur comme jai dit dun doré brillant profond...
Bulles moyennes à fines partout dans le verre.
Mousse blanc/beige qui nappe juste le liquide, et fait son travail de texture.
Odeur superbe de prunes blanches, figues, abricot, blé et une pointe de
genièvre...
Le volume est soyeux comme il convient...
La première bouche est dun grand dégagement sur la céréale et le houblon
(cest-à-dire la définition même de la bière) ; avec du fruit blanc et du fût d
armagnac... (on peut faire pire...)
La 2ème bouche est un équilibre parfait levure/céréale/houblon. Que dire ?
La 3ème montre une pointe dalcool et de vin blanc en vendanges tardives,
avec du cognac fins bois et du malt du speyside (on peut faire pire...)
La longueur est très complexe entre fruit, bois et fleur de houblon.
La levure est douce, fine, complexe, structurée. Très belle.
Lalcool est progressif, surperbe, et tout à fait adéquat à une triple.
La finale, cest extrêmement simple : tout y est.
Donc, une bière stylée, complète, de grand savoir-faire.
Un trophée mérité.
Draft @ Vlaamsche ReusHazy blond, nice white head. Interesting tripel. Banana, citrus fruits, yeast, coriander. Nice body, soapy mouthfeel.

very strong on taste.....looks like a regular tripel but it has its own strong taste.
blond, aromatic, super carbonation and foam...

Golden blonde, unclear even before the yeast sediment is poured; decent white head and plenty of visible carbonation.
The nose consists mainly of hops, not aggressive but a little bit soapy. I also find some sugars and something much softer, maybe malts?
The taste is that of a tripel, not the strongest nor the most bitter one; the hops bitterness is tempered by malts, its quite alcoholic but doesnt bring a full-blown glow. The sugars are subtly present, rather providing balance than really sweetening the brew. The aftertaste is mostly grainy.
In the end its a well balanced, rather smooth tripel - good and pleasant but nothing spectacular either.

Style et résumé: Triple classique fortement houblonné. 
Comment: Bouteille de 33cl meilleure avant 2014, merci Patrick. 
Description: Bière de la même couleur que le blé avec une mousse blanche à grosse bulle, la bière est bue chambrée. Le nez est agréable  avec un sucre, du miel et des petites fleurs blanches. La bouche est ferme et agréable. Les saveurs sont en parfaites harmonies. Il y a beaucoup de houblon en bouche, ce qui offre une amertume rafraichissante. Touche de levure fruitée en fin de bouche.  
Note:   7/10

11.2oz bottle - pours cloudy orange with foamy off-white head and decent lacing.  Nose is wheat, yeast, cloves and banana.  Flavor adds alcohol and grass.  Taste is sweet at first but ends on a bitter note.  Sticky mouthfeel.  Did not live to expectations.

Une robe dorée et son voile.  Une tête bien épaisse et assez persistante.  Une dentelle spectaculaire.  Un nez vraiment fruité avec des agrumes et de la banane.  Une touche mielleuse, un murmure épicé et des petites fleurs.  Des saveurs très agréables.  Des fruits tropicaux qui se sortent de la douce tourmente des céréales pâles.  Des houblons qui viennent en force : un secours brillant.  Un corps à la Het Anker.  De belles bulles qui sinfiltrent dans un corps travaillé.  Une texture montée en crème.  Une finale amère qui propulse aussi des notes fruitées légèrement surettes.  Des papilles qui sont ravies.  Merci à Tommy pour la bouteille.
Una tripla come poche altre! Classica tripla nel sapore e nellaroma ma più buona allennesima potenza, in più amara da subito e come retrogusto finale! Davvero speciale!
La cerveza mas famosa de Mechelen o Malinas en español, elaboracion propia un sabor fuerte y agradable.Alta graduacion
Bottle. Color gold with big white head. Aroma malt, yeast, sweet, honey. Taste sweet, alcohol, yeast, malt, spicy.

750 ml bottle.  Pours a hazy light gold with a nice white head.  Aroma of malt, citrus, and spices.  Complex taste of malt, yeast, citrus, spices, florals, and hops.  Maybe a bit spicey, but otherwise excellent.

Started pouring and the foam was overwhelming.. Like a bad keg pour in high school... Took about 10 minutes to settle... Pours very cloudy with some sediment on the bottom. Has a nose of yeast, and dirty socks. The taste is full body with some malty characteristics of caramel, slightly sour, some green apple, and even some chocolate flavor believe it or not. After getting past the pour and the nose, this is not all that bad! The flavors are great, but the aroma is horrific!
Aroma of bubblegum, canteloupe, and slight malt.  Pours light blonde and hazy with a great blanket of head.  Tastes sweet of bubblegum and slight sour yeast.  Sweet and perfumey.
hazy orange color with fine head. Highly carbonated (bath foam) Fresh coriander flavor. Easy drinkable and delicious despite the 9%.

Really like this one. Nose is a big explosion of candy, floral and some sweet fruit (apricot?). Up front in the mouth is a good hint of candy, with some floral hops. Backing is sweet malt, maybe some caramel. Pours medium orange with almost no head retention or lacing. Medium creamy in the mouth with lively carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2012 Dorata con un abbondante cappello di schiuma che si abbraccia alle pareti interne del bicchiere e non le lascia più andare. Aroma classico di Tripel belga (aroma che mi fa impazzire): dolce mieloso delicatamente speziato (speziatura che si rafforza mentre si riscalda ). Al palato corposa, piena con punte di dolcezza e spezie (pepe soprattutto) e un tocco di peperone. Il tutto sorretto da una discreta e quasi inespettata luppolatura (fin dallinizio). Non cè che dire splendido esempio di Tripel.

Brown 33cl bottle, best before May 2009, drank in April 2007. 

Poured into a Corsendonk glass. 

Looked fine, dull, dirty copper colour, slight haze. Good white head sat on top. 

Aroma of apple pie and sugar, strange but true! 

Sour and fizzy, dry and yeasty. Complexed flavours attack your tastebuds, difficult to split them from each other, I liked it. 

For a 9% beer there is not a great mouthfeel, but there isnt in many triples, again strange. 

A very drinkable beer, would like to see it on tap on day.
Pours a hazy sunny yellow. Lots of fluffy marshmallow head. Sweet and yeasty nose with sweet malt flavors. Very palatable.
A nice tripel. Reddish golden colour. Malty sweet flavour and aroma. Very nice.

33 cl bottle.
Rated on 20110712.
Pours murky golden color with a huge foamy and lasting head, also leaves some lacing. Aroma of fruits, mostly peach, grass, light spices and distant honey. Some soap and begian yeast can be found. Flavor of wheat, peach, spices and some honey. High CO2, bitter and refreshing palate.
3426

It is a good beer. Easy to drink and light with a lot of flavor. Has a light sparkle with a citrus flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great triple. Nice pale color. Nice malty aroma with a taste of honey, nicely hopped. Love the yeast multi flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

poured into a chalice from bottle. Pours a hazy gold color with a nice and frothy head.

Very good balance with nice depth and aromas of creams, lemons, pears, and white florals.

full bodied with a real smooth feel and flavors of lemons, pears, and creams.

A quality tripel. Balanced with real good flavors and aromas. A bit more depth wouldve been nice, but this was a real good drink.
I good take on the style.  Differentiates itself somewhat from the pack by avoiding the banana taste in favor of a more citrusy, pineapple flavor.  Pours golden with a thick white head.

Pours a hazy orange. Nice bubbly off white head. Aromas of Belgian yeast, light Brett, lemon zest, citrusy, touch of alcohol and a little bit of pineapple and mango. Initial taste is sharp, highly carbonated. Nice Belgian flavor with a subtle spicy and bitterness towards the finish. Funky, with a pineapple sweetness. Touch of hop bitterness, also has a nice floral flavor going on as well. Mouthfeel is kind of dull, slightly oily. Overall a solid beer. Worth a try
You can feel that thoughts have been put into this beer - maybe too many. Its a beautiful tripel, but its simply too spiced up for me. They should keep it a bit more simple.
Unclear golden of color with a foamy white head. An aroma of dried apricot, sweets, spice, yeast and hops. A flavor of apricot, spice, hops, dry mouthfeel, bitter and honey.
750ml bottle from Bierzwerg. Hazy golden colour. Aroma is  fruity, yeasty. Flavour is citrus. Good beer from the great brewery.
Great triple. Nice pale color. Nice malty aroma with a bit of raisin. Lovely easy drinking flavor.
Classic tripel, hides abv really well... I was pretty smashed by the time I had this though...

Bottle. Poured a hazy pale with a fizzy off-white head. Aroma of Belgium yeast, fruits, light spice, and honey. The flavor was much the same with hints of light citrus. Medium body and lively carbonation.

pours cloudy orange marmalade, very nice thick foamy head, great foamy retention, sticky lacing, lots of fast moving CO2 streams. A mix of apricot, malt, and traces of cinnamon on the nose. 6/10-level sweetness up front, tastes of mango, light malts, apricot, coriander, with an dryish light alcoholic bitter finish. Medium complexity, medium depth, medium length, good transitions, good carry, very good drinkability (especially when in a chilled glass). I like it more than the ambrio.

33cl bottle. Golden colour with a good formation os an off-white head with a decent persistence. Aroma is yeasty, moderate sweet and alcoholic. Flavour has citrus notes, orange peel, bready, yeasty and malty with a moderate bitterness in the final. Carbonation is medium. Body is medium to high. Texture is slightly oily.
Fine taste of barley and hops. It has a nice golden color and pure white foam, Nice bitter, nice aftertaste. Rich top-fermented well-balanced taste.
Bottle - big thick head, very carbonated hazy dark orange color, great Belgian yeast and citrus aromas and flavors - excellent beer

(bottle which Im pretty sure is at least 2 or 3 years old)  In continuance of my recent tripel craving, Im imbibing on this particular beer.  This beer pours a very clear light gold color with a thin white head, decent lacing, and vigorous carbonation.  Aroma is interesting, with plenty of dusty yeast, earthiness, pear, baked apple, and banana chips.  A good amount of floralness as well, and it gets bready as it warms.  Flavor has a good amount of pale malt sweetness, with accompanying flavors of vanilla, dried banana chips, and bread.  Finishes a bit tea-like in some respects with a subtle bitterness and a faint orange note.  Nothing really stands out and everything is dialed back.  Mouthfeel is nice and not too chewy, and the effervescent carbonation provides a nice effect.  No sign whatsoever of the 9% abv.  Overall this is a solid tripel, but it really didnt meet my expectations.

AROMA: citrus, herbs
APPEARANCE: golden, clear, frothy
TASTE: light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour
PALATE: medium body, slick feel, lively, astringent, abrupt finish
OVERALL: a triple with nice white beer properties, good for the summer.

From the bottle poured a strange colored brew, kind of a cloudy, yellow-brownish.It smelled of  malt and citrus fruit. The flavor was malty, with notes of zesty lemon, light on the hops that finished quickly leaving a slight malty flavor in the mouth. Medium bodied. I like it, a lot.

Pent lag skum på toppen. Lyse gul farge, litt mørkere enn pils. Ufiltrert. Kan ikke se igjennom glasset.  Balansert og ikke kraftig lukt. Smaker friskt, kullsyre. Kraftig munnfølelse, fyldig. Vinner av beer cup i 2002. I mine øyne oppskrytt. @ håndverkerstuene
Sweet in flavor, but also nice bitterness and spicy flavor. Amber in color with a creamy head.

Hazy yellow/orange pour with huge fluffy head. Aroma of banana, yeast and honey. Taste of yeast, banana, citrus and slightly sweet. Alcohol is noticable in the aftertaste. Nice carbonation. Very good beer.

smoke, rotten eggs, basement aromas, cheese, floral, bread, amber, hazy, white foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, umami, full body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish,
This beer smells and tastes like Pinesol, or some house cleaning product. Golden carousel isnt that good at all.
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. Ill update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.
330ml bottle. Pours clear golden body with a full white lasting head. Sweet taste and aroma of honey. Mild lasting honey bitterness...
Hazy blond colour. Unusual aroma, almost perfumey. Flavour is quite sweet with some banana coming through. Has a metallic edge and a dry finish.

Flaske 0,75l fra Vinmonopolet, bestillingsutvalget.  Delt med Janeriks, MrSoul og Rune 15 Feb 12. Gylden på farge. Veldig høyt luftig skum. Uklar. Søt fruktig aroma. Appelsin & mango. Godt integrert alkoholsødme. Etterlater et vel søtt helhetsinntrykk.

750ml bottle, thanks to Finn for sharing. Big white head to a cloudy, golden body. Fresh floral-fruits and herbal hops to the nose, semi-sweet. Mild spiced fruits in flavour, including oranges, added by wheat, integrated yeast and noticeable alcohol to the ending that lingers for quite a while. Well bodied. Has, indeed, got its moments of joyful drinking (big bottle session among friends in Tromsø, 15.02.2012).

Eccellente birra di casa belga! Esteticamente perfetta! Schiuma da 10 e lode! Nellaroma si percepiscono i lieviti. Il gusto al primo sorso lo definirei "PARADISIACO", eccellente! il retrogusto è leggermente "vinato". 
davvero un ottima birra! una delle migliori!

330 ml bottle. BBE 16.05.2014.
Pours a golden colour with a thick white head. Lovely aroma of fresh sweet fruits, some hops and spices. Flavour of pale malts, strong sweet fruits, yeast, some hops, spices. Medium bodied, foamy mouthfeel and a long, warming, fruity finish. One fruity Tripel, I must say.

330ml bottle from Cracked Kettle

Pours light orange with a medium smooth head. Aroma of fruity hops, grass, malts and some spices. Taste is quite fruity with some grassy hops and malts and hints of spices. Finish is quite bready with some fruitiness. Quite well balanced and tasty tripel.
Shiny golden color with tall frothy white head. Aroma is floreal, citrus, pineapple, belgian yeast. Well balanced beer, not too hoppy. Pleasant dry finish
Bottle. Very good abbey tripel. Hoppy, fruity, spicy and sweet. Warming alcohol.

33 CL bottle.  Pours hazy dark straw with 1-finger off-white head.  Nose is perfumy florals, tropical fruity hops, with pineapple, mild funk, and rock sugary malt.  Tastes dry, floral, hoppy, mild funky, citric, and I even got a mild waft of white chocolate as this warmed.  Good stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2015 330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with huge, stable, frothy, white head. Intense fruit aroma, banana, peach, raspberry, yeast, supplemented by a pepper note. Taste starts yeasty, spicy, frizzy; the carbonation gives more and more way, so that a sweet fruity taste, mainly with notes of banana, takes place, all accompanied by a dry note. Fruityness lasts with a sweetness that could stem from cherries. A beer to wander off in flavour.

Currently drinking while typing. Upon pouring you are awoken by big aromas of Banana, apricot, honey, malts and faint booze. A beautiful looking brew to look at, a vibrant bubbly white head which is sitting over a slightly misty golden body which catches the light well. Stunning flavours too, big malts and fruitiness, banana and apricot fruits with gentle sugary booze notes too. A lovely dry finish in the long run, great carbonation, maybe a very tiny bit too thin but nothing to ruin the beer. Definately will be buying again, kind of reminds me somehow of a Hoegaarden! Not sure why but it has a familiar aroma to it. Great Tripel!

draft @ redlight redlight.  Floral banana notes on the nose with hints of coriander.  Pours slightly hazy gold with a thick white head.  Floral fruity notes upfront with bready malts with sweet citrus flavors with hints of bubblegum and grassy hops.
UPDATED: APR 21, 2012 è una tripla abbastanza classica,ma dal sapore estremamente intenso. Scende giù una meraviglia,davvero ottima!
Fruit, yeast and a good hop punch in the aroma and flavor.  A very good tripel, the overt hoppiness helps make it stand out.
Excellent tripel! Floral and yeasty aroma and a very nice taste with lost of fruity elements (peach, apple) balanced with a pleasent bitterness.

Bottle at home. Straw-coloured beer, slightly hazy, with a small white head. Floral aromas of citrus fruit. Citrus also present in the flavours along with soap and pine. Lasting medium bitterness and medium carbonation. Slick mouthfeel. Overall a fresh, sweet and good beer with a taste that lasts in the mouth.

Pours a hazy golden color with a huge, tight white head that leaves good lacing on the glass. 

Aroma is orangepeel, spice, some honey and bright maltiness are pretty dominant. 

The flavor is floral, lightly bitter, and very spicy. The crisp maltiness cuts perfectly through all of this though and nothing is out of place. There is a nice fruity sweet punch out front but this is primarily hoppier than it is sweet. The finish is dry and kind of quick with some almost lavender like bitterness that does linger.
Bottle. Pours golden with a big off-white head. Aroma of malt, perfume, coriander, fruitiness and fruitiness.Flavor is sweet and spicy with some fruitiness, Meiudm body, average carbonation.
Une très bonne surprise. Une bière qui rappelle la karmeliet. Très belle couleur. Un régal.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BBE 24.03.07, 20120104) The beer poured amber and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had honey, raisins, sweetness and malts. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were honey, raisins, sweetness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet and dry. The excessive sweetness was a bit off-putting but the beer had aged well.

0.75L corked bottle from Vinmonopolet.  Pours a bright, slightly hazed honey golden body, under a tall platina blond cream head.  Doughy yeast aroma. Some banana esters, and a whiff of mild spices and stale grassy hops. Medium full. Soft, lightly sweet malt flavor. Yellow fruits, yeast and spices, too. Silky mouthfeel. Softly carbonated. Sweet malty/fruity and yeasty endnotes. Lacks some crispness, but overall a pretty good one.

Rating #672, flaske fra Lagersalget  

En uklar gul øl med gærrester og stort luftigt skum - herligt. Duften leder tankerne hen på en ekstrem witbier. Der er masser af lavendel i aromaen, men også blomster, syrligsød malt, lidt alkohol og lidt karamel. Den er mere kompleks end som så. Der er masser af kant i lavendelduften, som jeg ikke rigtig kan finde ord for, men lækker er den, duften. Smagen er sød og gæret, samt med en anelse alkohol, hele øllen igennem. Den er mindre kompleks end forventet. Eftersmagen byder på en smule lavendel, alkohol og en solid bitterhed allerbagerst på tungen. Jeg havde forventet mere blidhed og blomster.  Den kunne godt være både tykkere og blødere. Alt i alt en ganske drikkelig øl, men ikke oppe i toppen af toppen, som den samlede score ellers kunne antyde. Alkoholen er lidt for tydelig til at gøre denne tripel helt og aldeles fornøjelig, og intet andet. Den indeholder dog samtidig mange velkomne elementer.

33cl bottle. Yellow/green hazy with a big white head. Nose : Intensive overall bubblegum smell. Vanilla with amazing fruit notes : apple, peach.... Caramel and cereal malts. Sip : Creamy with lively carbonation that can still foam in your throat but ...once poured strongly into the Trappist glass it will be more easy to drink. Sweet start with aromas of fruit esters and alcohol. Leaving a delicate alcohol and sour licorice feeling. Bitterness procure nice balance to this mostly sweet alcohol tripple. Intensive smell and a balanced taste makes it a great brew. Strong so you must be moderate with it.

Appearance: Golden orange, slightly hazy. Huge amount of white head.
Aroma: Nice fruit, lemon. Spices.
Taste: More fruit and spices. Pear or peach. Slight alcohol and bitterness.
Info: 330ml bottle, 5/12-2011
light sweet malty aroma,golden, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, light sweet finish.
Bottle. Golden with a medium head. Slightly acidic with some sourness. Bitter finish. This one is probably an acquired taste..
Flinke kraag, perzikgeur, redelijk zoet en fruitig , ik mis het bittere een beetje. Wel ok.
Orange coloured and hazy to unclear. Has a white head, fully lasting. Aroma is fruity, sweet, yeasty. Peach and coriander. Moderate bitter flavor finish.
UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 Good touch of bitterness I like in some triples.  Floral hops and a crisp leave after it ends. Clove and good balance. A hint of wild bretta. Tap.

Bottle brought back to Bonn from Het Anker.  Pours a hazy golden body with noticeable yeast cloudiness.  Massive, rocky, clingy white head.  Lemongrass in the nose with bready notes, tangerine and coriander.  Light, summery grain underneath.  Nice!  Spicier flavor than aroma.  Coriander, pepper, and some nutmeg.  Sweat, almost candyish pils malt along with sweet, warming alcohol.  Medium body with high carbonation.  Sweet and spicy finish.  Alcohol continues to warm, but avoids burning.  A little chalky, but not distracting.  Overall a really nice triple with interesting nose and flavor contrasts.

Aroma/Malty-Ligth, Appearance Head/size-small, Head/Color-light brown, Head/Longevity-fully diminishing, Body/Hue-light, Initial Flavor/bitter moderate, Finish Flavor/bitter ligth, Palate Body/light, OK beer

Slightly orange yellow beer with a quite big and blond head. Aroma is strongly fruitfull, even parfume, oranges, coriander and spicyness; complex, pleasant, sophisticated and aromatic aroma. Taste is fruitfull with strong parfume, some spicyness, alcohol is totally hiddeen, great. Lots of carbonation, but that fitts nicely in this beer. Gouden Carolus Triple is parfume and aromatic beer, quite similar than St. Feuillien Triple. Great beer.

750 ml corked and wired bottle, from Vinmonopolet. ABV is 9.0%. Very pale yellow colour, huge white head. Strong fruity, yeasty and spicy (cloves a.o.) aroma. The flavour is spicy with some fruit and white kandij sugar, but the sweetness is nearly too much. Still a good beer, but if it is worth the high price in Norway is debatable.

Bottle from Csak a jó sör. Poured hazy, with a dark orange color and a thick off-white head that stays. Coriander, clove, cinnamon, honey, yeast, caramel in the nose. Almost vinous in the finish. Fruity aroma of grapes, apple and watermelon. Medium bodied and carbonated. Sweet taste with well balanced bitterness. Lively bitter finish with caramel notes. Good one!

330 ml bottle. Rotterdam, the Netherlands.
Hazy golden colour with small to average size white head.
Citrus, Belgian yeast and hops in delicious aroma.
Malt, citrusy hops, mild yeast, mild farmyard and pinch of toffee in dry flavour. Fizzy. Very balanced and enjoyable.
Hazy yellow body, white head. Aroma of noble hops, wheat spices, citrus and yest. This is very good floury tripel.
Pours a dark cloudy orange with a tall frothy white head. Aroma is sweet malt and flowery notes. Taste is also sweet malt, yeast, fruit and some spices. Nice balanced. Really nice Tripel

0.75l bottle. This one pours a light clouded golden yellow body with a gigantic and massive fluffy just off-white head thats lacing nicely down the glass. The aroma almost fills the room with apple-sweets, Belgian yeast, malts, candy, plums and some caramel. Really nice. Average to lively carbonation, full-bodied and it has a somewhat fizzing-oily mouthfeel. Flavors are sharp and precise with Belgian yeast, apples, malts,  notes of flour(?), lemon and it ends mild dry with a light bitter and spicy finish and a nice warming alcohol aftertaste. A good tripel, but I quite honestly had expected something more.

9/12/11. 750mL bottle. Hazy orange pour with a big, thick white head that lasts forever and laces plenty. Spicy Belgian aroma with plenty of yeast, orange peel, and grapefruit. Sweet, almost slightly tart, orange flavor at first that lingers dry with a touch of metal. Not bad!
Bottle pours a hazy gold with a large foamy white head. Scent is yeast and light fruit. Taste is spices, yeast and a hint of grass.

Bottle. Golden colour, with a nice big head with excellent duration.Hazy orange with big off-white head. Aroma is fruity: prunes and grapefruit. Flavor has raisins, malt, prune. Full-bodied, but quite gassy beer and hides ABV well.

Bottle at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Hazy yellow / orange color, large white head. Smell malts, sweet and fruits. Taste malts, a little fruit, some yeast and bitter. Pretty average on all criteria, but very decent. Nice, plain and simple, decent tripel.

Ar: Lush stone fruit, sweet orange, a touch of white pepper.
Ap: Light gold, hazy - big white head with good retention and full curtains of lacing.
T: Sweet peaches and pear, with a bit of lemon and orange - light cracker malt with peppery spice and earthy hops - finish is bitter, fruity, and spicy, with a touch of pale tannin - touch of clean alcohol warmth throughout.
P: High, prickly carbonation - very lively mouthfeel - finish is bone dry.
O: Wonderful beer - looks, smells, and tastes great - fruity, spicy, and dry like a great tripel should be.

Bottle. Golden, hazy, average and mostly lasting head.  Moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, fruity with citrus, some spiciness. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, fruity with some citrus, faint spiciness. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, fruitiness and citrus, some alcohol and spiciness. OK tripel  due to alcohol and citrus this one is not so sweet in the finish.

Bottle:
Big fluffy and very slow disappearing white head on top of a hazy orange colored beer.
Smell fruit, orange, peach, tangerine, soap, yeast, some hints of wood and malts.
Taste fruit, yeast, orange, abricot, hops, bitter, herbs, grass, spices, yeast, some hints of sticky malts and sweets.
Bitter malty spiced and fruity aftertaste.
Medium carbo, sharp mouthfeel, medium body and a light creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle to snifter. Pours pale golden yellow with a foamy white head that fades to a sticky film and lacing. Aroma has a strong floral herbal scent with some honey and yeast. Taste is more of the above with a hop bitterness and lemon honey spice thoughout (very nice). Palate is full and fizzy with a chaulky dry finish. Very enjoyable.
Pours clear the colour of yellow straw. Strong spicy flavour. Perhaps caraway seeds.

Poured from 330mL uncorked bottle a hazy orangeish color with massive white head with good retention and nice lacing.  Taste is well balanced with a bit of yeast and fruit on the nose.  A pretty nice Belgian triple.

75 cl. bottle - always something special when a beer bottle is corked- cloudy yellow colour, big white head, that slowly becomes fluffy and finally settles. Very nice aroma balanced between citrus, spices and the sweetness of exotic fruits. Taste is medium to heavy sweet - thanks to the exotic fruits. Full bodied with a slick texture and a lively carbonation that really forces the taste impressions forward. Long lasting finish. This is why Belgian beers is so impressive: Lots of complex flavors.

11.2 oz. bottle, pours a hazy dark golden orange with a voluminous white head. Very yeasty aroma, with apple, pear, mild Belgian spices and some candied sugar. Flavour is exceedingly yeasty, with very dry apple / pear, a very smooth palate, with high carbonation, and a dry finish. Most excellent tripel - one of the best ones Ive had.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2012 Golden with yeast sediments floating and a very frothy, white head with a very long duration. Fruity, spicy sweet aroma with notes of bready, slightly toasted malts, honey and bubblegum. Taste is medium sweet, spicey and  light bitter, leading to an astringent finish.
Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity, yeasty and spicy. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish with a little warming alcohol. 270908
Bottle. Clear golden with medium off-white head. Flavour is malt, yeast, hops, fruit, little bitter, spices and notes of alcohol.

330ml bottle from 16th St.Liquor in West Vancouver. Pours a slightly hazy medium orange/golden with thick and pillowy off white head. Aroma is sweet and fruity. Some candy-like sugar. A dark almost vinous quality along with yeast as well. Flavour is dark and rich. Some yeast and a hint of grain. Some fig and/or raisin. A touch of alcohol in the finish. Good tripel but not mind blowing.

On tap at the Het Anker Brasserie.  A stroke of luck the barman poured two by accident and we got to share them between us for free.  Golden and a little cloudy with good head on it.  Weak malty/yeasty aroma.  Smooth and slightly malty, a little bitter.  The aroma is spiced.  Hard to define but very nice.

Hazy dull yellow with white head. Pleasant sweet and tart, musty aroma with hard candy, yeast, banana, some spiciness. Sharp in flavor with a balancing alcohol note. Very interesting flavors. Slightly floral, a bit earthy, somewhat herbal, with citrus highlights. Spritzy mouthfeel. Fast, spicy finish.

750ml corked bottle. Slightly hazy bright golden pour with average snow white head that dissipates slowly. Big peaches on the nose with a spicy, bready note and a hint of alcohol. Very candied on the palate with some fruit and spice, the breadiness plays a bigger part. Long finish thats got a good warming quality. A little heavier than most tripels Ive tried.

Pours cloudy golden with a thick cloudy white head. Aroma is floral and honey. Flavor is honey and fruity with plenty of sweetness. Unfortunately, there is more than a little alcohol apparent in the flavor which is always something of a turn off for me. The alcohol is not a deal breaker, but it isnt something you can ignore.

Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, sweet fruit. vanilla, yeast. Taste is malt, sweet dark fruit, white pepper , spices. Full body, lively carbonation. Good drinkability after the carbonation had setled abit. Nice beer. 021010

Serving: 750 ml. bottle form Wegmans Leesburg.  It pours a hazy orange gold with a large white head thats very active and full of large bubbles.  The nose is a bit of cotton candy, a light dusty Belgian yeast, and a touch of must.  The flavor is toned down with some earthy malt, some tinny metallic notes, lots of yeast and dense fruit flavor that is there then gone.  Good depth and a dry finish.  What a Belgian should be.  You get the hops up front and a good bit of sweetness from the malt in the back.  Quite good and definitely recommended.

Appearance: hazy golden with a HUGE cotton candy off-white head, tons of lacing.   Aroma: pink lady apples, pear, yeast, champagne, some zingy hops.   Taste: fruity, sweetish, with notes of honey, champagne, pear and apples, then some yeasty spices and floral/citrus hops.   Finish: smooth, dry, bittersweet.   Notes: Goes down nicely, with a lively palate and well-hidden alcohol.  A great version of the style.

Geruch fruchtig-holzig. Im Mundraum sehr alkoholig und fruchtig zugleich. Abrupter Abgang. 
Bemerkenswertes Tripel mit vollendetem Körper, das es in sich hat.Test vom 20.2.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

~Fruity pear like aroma with a healthy dose of sweet honey. Light spices with floral hop character.
~Pours a murky golden orange color with small lasting white head.
~Same honey and pear in flavor as with the aroma, but with more peppery spice qualities and floral hop. A bit sweet.
~Medium light bodied with high Co2, sweet lingering finish with a touch of spice.
~Tasty stuff. A bit on the sweet side in flavor, but not cloyingly so. I enjoyed the honey like character.
1/5 i mörkhet. Luktar fruktigt och syrligt. Fruktig och besk i smaken. Besk och lite bitter eftersmak. Lite för spritig.

Whole Foods Market, DC 330ml from sampler ($16): Pours a darker for a tripel color, something a little orange colored with a nice white head that leaves a thin layer around there. Aroma is of lemon, banana, and spicy hops. Taste is a little sweet, with a slight hop bitterness. Leaves both in the aftertaste. Alcohol is well hidden. Taste is crisp and refreshing. Also a little earthy aftertaste. Pretty good beer, even for a tripel; definitely on the heavier side.

Had this at the Brewbub of het Anker in Mechelen. Really nice tripel, soft and easy going. Nice clear golden colour with a nice white head on top. Really hides the alcohol quite nice, with a lemon spiceness going along with it all.
Heavy malty and god spicy aroma with notes of fruit. Huge frothy, white head. Good lacing. Mostly lasting longevity. Clear yellow body.  Heavy sweet and fruthy flavor. Medium palate. Oily texture.

At the moment this is my favorite triple. Might drink this one again soon, since the high score kind of surprised me. This is one of the first beers ive rated, so that may have a positive effect on the score.

Bottle 750ml @ home
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain, yeast, caramel, alcohol and some fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a dry fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Very smooth belgian triple, i like this one a lot better than the allagash tripel i sampled 40ish beers ago....

pours hazy yellow with a lumpy white head and some splochy lacing. aroma is lite but fresh with notes of lemon peel and wax.  mouthfeel is prickly with a lot of yeast texture hitting the throat.  taste is lemons and pale malt.  hop character is well balanced.  finish is dusty and citric.

15/05/2011 33cl bottle @ De Hanekeef (Mechelen) - BB: 3/3/14 (2011-211) 
Cloudy dark yellow to orange beer under a very creamy off-white head, stable and adhesive. Aroma: lots of yeast, bit fruity. MF: good carbon, medium to full body. Taste: fruity, lots of yeast, grapefruit, some rapsberries, bit of dairy, pineapple. Aftertaste: some citrus, fruity, yeast. (The yeast smells and tastes very similar to the one from the Maneblusser beer, so probably the same?)

Purchased at Golden Leaf in Chicago, IL; enjoyed on a murky mid-May Sunday afternoon.  Appearance is a very cloudy blonde with a very rich, prominent white frothy head.  I could only pour half the bottle because of the carbonation, waited at least 5 min for the head to subside.  Aroma is very bready, also has a strong yeast presence, slightly sweet, and maybe its just me but it has somewhat of a lager-like aroma.  After pouring the entire bottle it has a cider-like sweetness in the nose.  Taste is very smooth and complex, some of the yeasty blonde ale attributes are there but theres also a fruity backing with a small hint of spice.  To me theres an apple-like sweetness in the back, cider like but without a ton of carbonation.  Very enjoyable.
Well this is a very smooth beer. Pours a light blonde color. Aroma is full of floral, herbs, caramel. Not a very complex beer, but very drinkable!

Viime vuonna maistoin Gouden Carolus Classicin. Se täytyy kokea joskus uudestaan. Gouden Carolus Tripel on lasissa melko nätti. Se on tuoksultaan hunajainen, mausteinen ja hedelmäinen. Mausteista valitettavan tukkoinen nenäni erottaa inkivääriä ja neilikkaa. Erinomainen tuoksu. Maussa on hedelmäisyyttä ja mausteita. Pehmeä olut, joka ilahduttaa itseäni etenkin tuoksullaan. Belgiaan on joskus pakko päästä käymään.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2011 Pours with a MASSIVE head that retains well and provides ample lacing: exemplary appearance.   Fruity honey dew and cantelope aromas... creamy/porous mouth feel; the instructions on the bottle should not be ignored re servign temperature... I had to go back and rerate after it warmed up.  When served its a completely different beer... excellent.

11.2oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours opaque golden with a thick, lacy, white head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, light malts, and some pretty strong hops for this style of beer.  The alcohol and hops are strong, but blend well with the light malts and yeast flavors.  Smooth texture.  A really good tripel

Picked up a single bottle of this at the Total Wine in Alexandria. Served in a Jackie Os snifter.

The pour brings a brew with a light apricot body as well as a three-finger head with quite a bit of retention. Rocky, moon-like surface with quite a few bubbles on top. The nose immediately brings some light bubblegum character along with a healthy dose of clove. Theres a slight toffee character underlying what is coming from the yeast.

The taste immediately comes forward with a strong grain presence and a bit of light sweetness. Along with a bit of white pepper spice and clove, there is some light pear character as well as some slight stone fruits. There isnt the sort of underlying complexity that I would expect here. Additionally, there is also a bit of light apple character. The toffee notes that come from the nose are here as well, and this seems to be a bit heavy on the malt and does not bring nearly enough yeast character.

The feel is medium with a bit of sweetness in the finish. I really would like a lot more coming out of the yeast here, as this is seems to really be lacking in complexity when compared with better examples of the style, and certainly when compared to quite a few other Het Anker brews.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-08-2010

First of all this is as tripel, but the bottle says its blonde ale. Anyway,

The beer pours a murky yeasty gold with a light white.

The aroma is super light hops with a tad bit of flowers.

The taste is a super smooth blonde ale, easy to drink, but not a ton of flavor.

Overall, a total session despite being 9%.

Draught at Akkurat. Slight hazy golden with a decent off-white head.
Aroma is sweet, yeasty and fruity. Fermented apples, citrus, pear, cookies.
Taste is sweet and thick with apples and yeast, lemon and a lingering cookie dough note in the aftertaste. 
Body is full and carbonation is gushing.

on tap at the Doerak, Delft.
Hazy blond colour.  Decent white head.  A good triple

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2012 Golden cloudy body with a  big white head. Yeasty and sweet aroma with notes of lemon. Sweet, smooth flavour with caramel. Great. (8/5/8/5/18)
Clear golden colour with a big white head. Yeasty bittwesweet aroma with honey and lemon. Great, moderately sweet flavour with honey, lemon, caramel and peach.

Hazy golden color with a foamy head. Very refreshing with some koriander in the aftertaste. Awesome beer from my new hometown!

the head on this one is unbelievable.... thick, foamy, soapy, white as hell... if the beer itself would have been a little bit murkier i would have given it my first 5 points for appearance.... 
aroma has some intense malts... some hop... orange... citrus... some herbs that i cant identify.. and yeast offocourse! its very yeasty...
taste is als quite complex, its bitter with some fruity sourness,very yeasty again, furthermore there are hints of bread, apple and some herbs again...finish is long and brutally bitter and  yeasty...
this is a classic triple and an awesome one...

Brilliant gold color with big foamy head.  Very fragrant rich fruity bouquet.  Taste is sweet, rich malt.  Notes of caramel, apple and over-ripe berry.  All the sweetness is balanced out on top of a yeasty, wheaty base and some bitter hops.  Creamy palate.  One of the best tripels Ive had.

On tap for growler fills at Half Time.  Pours a hazy gold with a large white head.  Big Belgian candy sugar, light hops.  Medium bodied, fuzzy phenols and yeasty esters.  Big wheat. Light alcohol creeps in. long earthy phenolic yeast finish.
Very decent tripel, certainly a must-try for anyone passing through Mechelen.

11.2 oz. bottle. The pour is hazy orange with a large beige head. The aroma is citrus hops, pine, vanilla and spices. The flavor is tart and sweet. The palate is heavy and acidic, and yet remarkably smooth. Overall, a well put together beer.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2011 Heavy drinking beer, big fruity (banana) nose. bit of vanilla.
Nice white head, after x minutes rocky

 In 2002 this beer won the Gold Award in the World Beer Cup, San Diego, USA in the Triple category And in 2010 gold european beerstar.

Opálos arany, szépen tömött, tejszínhabot idéző koronával a tetején.
Száraz illata csak hosszú levegőztetés után nyílik ki igazán, amely gyümölcsös, alkoholos.
Kóstolása csípősen indul, száraz, összetett aromája gyümölcs, méz, kenyér és komlós jellegeket hordoz magával, melyet enyhe alkohol fest alá.
Íze barackot, kis grépfrútot és mézet idéző.
Gyantás-gyümölcsös és melengető befejezését citrusok és fűszerek kísérik, amely után alaposan kiszárad a szájpadlás, és végül egy édes-fűszeres utóízben marad meg.
Az alkohol viszonylag jól el van rejtve és a finom gyümölcsös íznek (no, meg a sima testének) hála, igen könnyen itatja magát ez a komplex és élvezetes nedű.

Csillogó arany szín,  hatalmas hófehér habbal. Illata csalogató, fehér desszertborba áztatott aszalt sárgabarackhegyek lágy fűszerezettséggel, ez már csak jó lehet! Aszalt gyümölcsös, fehérboros édeskés ízek, majd kis pikáns fűszeresség, és a végén üde, virágos erős komlóíz. Testes, pezsgős, az alkohol íze csak kísérőként van jelen, a lecsengése pedig száraz és gyümölcsös. Valami eszméletlen jó sör, egy marha vagyok, hogy eddig halogattam a megkóstolását!
Anche i nostri cari amici del Belgio hanno tanti modi di fare una buona tripla croce, questo è uno di quei modi che preferisco decisamente, amo questo birrificio...

Bottle. Pours with a murky yellow body (muddy even) with a large, fluffy white head that produces good lace. Aromas of candi sugar, marmalade, candied ginger, tea, orange zest and wheat. Flavors of orange zest, coriander, wheat, candi sugar, curacao, alcohol and freshly baked biscuits. Orange blossom honey. Lively bubbles, medium dry. Very lively on the palate. Tangerine and candied pear on the finish.

By far one of the most enjoyable triples that I have had in a while.

Hazy golden orange with a beautiful pillowy bright white head that lasted forever and left a thick sticky lace. A gorgeous mosaic of aromas featuring lemon and orange peel, grassy hops, Belgian yeast, black pepper, honey, apple and pear, cloves, and vanilla. None of which would be considered dominant - all in a very nice balance. Flavor profile is similar, but not as sweet as the aromas would indicate. Modest bitterness is a perfect offset to the fruit and honey sweetness. Velvety smooth and pillowy soft on the palate, lively carbonation, and a bright clear finish. Happy New Year!

hazy gold, thick dense white head, creamy full body, high carbonation.

aroma: grassy, soapy, bright fruit, minerality, and alcohol.

taste: belgian yeast, pale malt, candy sugar, grassy stale hop bitterness, minerality, butter, and alcohol.

balanced and complex. nice creamy body.
75cl bottle. Pours an amber color with a large white head. Candy sugar sweetness int he fore followed by some floral flavors and malt. Good palate. Very nice
33cl bottle, hazy amber color, medium lasting white head, caramel and yeast aroma, citrus (orange peel) and spices notes, fruity sweet flavor, medium to full body, sweet finish with spices and fruits

Colour is golden, but unclear. I guess the beer is not filtered. Head is decent. Nice smell. Taste is mostly alcoholic and there aroma which made me think fresh cut birch. I must admit I like smell of this beer more than taste. Overall straight forward trippel.

aroma is a rich sweet orange purs with a thick head with a lot of retension, first taste has the sweetness of a tripel, but finishes dry and does not have the overly sweet taste, pretty good beer overall, but feels like its lacking some flavor
Bottle. Pours golden with a big foamy white head. Flavors of candy sugar, lemon, apples, spice. Slightly tart, good tripel.

Pours yellow with a full white head.  Smells of barn yard, acidic lemon, other sweet fruits, and fresh bread.  Very lively mouthfeel.  Lemon, belgian yeast, fresh bread, clove, and a bit tart and dry in the finish.

Poured from a 330ml bottle a rich golden ale with a frothy white head that lasts and adds perfect lacing around the glass. Aroma is subtle with notes of lemon and alcohol. Flavor is very good of lemon peel, malt, and yeast with a subtle alcohol finish. A very light tasting, well balanced,  good triple.
This has a taste that is yeasty, tart, and fruity. Aroma of apples and pears.  Beautiful light golden color with a very foamy head. A very good tripel.

Bottle thx tkrjukoff, cons 2010-11-28 Sätila
AR: parfume, lavendel, belgian yeast
AP: pale yellow, pale yellow coored body, wee yellowish white head
F. belgian yeast, alcohol, dry, ... , dried apricots, overloaded carbonation, green peppery, dryness and caramell in the finish

Pours hazy champagne with lots of bubbles nice white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is sweet perfumatic, caramel, floral ... maybe lavendel ... soapy maybe. Full bodied acidy mouthfeel. Fruity, acidy, alcohol, peppery and spicy flavor. Really good indeed. Peppery tart palate. Finishes very pleasant with a peppery tart bitter aftertaste.

Golden hue pour with quickly disappearing head. Aroma of light honey hint, matches its honey like color. Taste a somewhat bitter start that mellows into a nice malty flavor . Not my favorite Gouden beer but pretty damn tasty.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2012 Cloudy yellow colour with a thick white head. Nose of exotic fruits. Aromas are bananas, lemon and spices. Sweet taste. Lively carbonation. Alcoolic and bitter finish. Good tripel, but not fruity and balanced enough.

Appearance: cloudy orange under a huge white head which leaves an impressive decoration of lace. Swirls with puffs but no more lace.

Nose: doughy and sweet. Tropical fruit skins in the back with sweet rolls up front and in the middle. Pineapple, kiwi, apricot. Cracked pepper, white pepper, and grains of paradise in the back. Tannic bitter fruit skins.

Palate: sweet, ripe, and very bright atop my tongue. Like the sun on a summers day, her palate demands my attention. Grains of paradise baste the top of my tongue while sweet coconut milk dances in the middle with apricot, peaches, mango, and pineapple. A short finish. Lips stick with orange marmalade and mango. Hay, wood, and a general dusty earthiness add refreshment during and after each taste.

Final Thoughts: I havent had a bad beer from Gouden Carolus yet and I have little expectations to ever. A classic triple with a nice balance of doughy yeasty spiciness that is quintessential to Belgians in general along with a subtle dryness offering humble support. Well done. Drink fresh for I think this is when she is best, but just in case Ill find out in a year or two.
Heady aroma of wood-paneled Belgian dudes power-drinking room (metaphorically), taste follows through in nice solid Tripel fashion--a bit on the astringent (rather than estery) side but it works...
profumi di frutta rossa matura calda dolce e poco persistente con un finale dolce
UPDATED: JAN 26, 2011 yellow hazy beer with big smoothy head. aroma: alcohol, citrus hops, candy, sugar. flavour: sharp, bitter sweet, metalica, spicy, light lemon. a nice tripel

Bottle Yummy!! Rich amber cloudy goodness. Pungent dark fruits and sweet malts. the mouth is clean with a medium body and a fair amount of  carbonation. The taste is dried fruits and sugared malts. Not overly complex, but a delight to drink.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2015 Had at the Elfde Gebod in Antwerp.  Very nice tripel not at outstanding as other examples but still quite tasty. Serving: Tap

Bottle 75cl. A cloudy yellow beer with huge white head. Smell is spicy and agrume like. Aroma is dry with malty body, pungent with heavy spicy hops. Long bitter aftertaste, very alcoholic. Not the best triple Ive taste, positive point the lemon aroma is no too huge as for many triple, the body is a bit thin.

Golden pour with a huge white froth. tons of lemony banana, huge clove, spicy hop notes, fruity dough, and bread. The flavor is a delicious blend of wheat malt, dough, clove, banana, and mild booze. A very effervescent and pillowy palate leads to a crisp dry finish.
75 cl botlle, pours golden with a minor head, aroma of spices and yeast, taste is spices and malt, decent finish, enjoyable triple but nothing special.
Incredible.  The lemon notes in this beer are akin to a lemon twist.  Sweet lemon malty yeasty.  Wow what a rich body and delightful flavor.
Pours out orange. A big white head that holds nice. Oranges and citrus, some spices at the smell. Pretty good smell. Lightly sour-sweet taste. Pretty good spiced and balanced I think.
nose of bread and apples, the feel is medium as is the carbonation, the taste is dry malt, a little alcohol and a nutty finish.

Pours a pretty standard light orange body with a medium, white head. Nose is vinous yeasts, grassy hops and hints of pale malts. Taste is rather sweet, with almonds, marcipan and molasses supplying the contrasts to the grapefruity hop bitterness. Decent palate. A good, very staple-tasting triple.

From a bottle. beautiful 2-3 finger wonderful white head as good as Duvel, vanilla, small citrus flavor, this ale is top shelf Belgan, I am in love although I love everything Carolus brews. Mouthfeel is refreshing not overly carbonated - next to Chimay one of my all time Belgium favorites - I mistakenly wrote this for the blond beer which I have never tried - sorry.

head: 3fingers 
colour: blond 
smell: hops, iron, yeast,wheats, alcohol, malts/grains , citric peel , some sour 
taste: alcohol, strong hops, sweets, bubblegum , malts, yeast, mouthfeel is dry end is very dry , aftertaste sour/sweet , hops, grass ...

Bottle.  Pours a murky gold with a large white head.  Burst of malt and fruit aroma.  Taste is classic tripel with residual sweetness masking the alcohol.  Light and very drinkable with a slight hopiness that quickly evaporates.  Terrific beer, will look for again.

Pours murky blonde with a giant foamy off-white head. Handle and pour gently, please. Nose is pretty weak with a little belgian yeast and hops behind the usual abbey tripel sweet malt. Flavor is very well balanced, with a decent burst of bitter hops and spice (coriander?) on the front and a lot of candied sugar sweetness on the backside. Finish is a combination of both and is a lingering bittersweetness. Alcohol is well hidden. A little to the oily side for an abbey tripel but very well balanced and definately a good beer.
pours cloudy golden with a huge white head that quickly subsides, it has banana aroma and yeasty and fruity flavor.  very easy drinking for its strength.

Bottle pour to Trappist glass gives clear dark yellow with small white head. Medium carbonation.  Aroma sweet light fruits.  Taste light fruits, spices, pepper, a bit of tartness and sourness.  Finish clean and mildly tart.  palate rather thin but pleasant.  Alcohol well disguised.

Im surprised by the variety of impressions of this beer..  To me it is almost tastes like  an "American" version of a Tripel.  Never-less this is a good beer and quite drinkable despite the high ABV.
UPDATED: AUG 5, 2010 Unfortunately I had this so long ago I cant really remember its finer points. I do remember that it was excellent and I strongly recommend this beer.

Bottle from Sams.  Pours hazy golden with orange tint and big white head.  Nose of bananas, peaches and apricots.  Some white pepper.  Similar taste but with added honey notes.  A little boozy. Palate is a bit prickly, but settles quickly.  Quite good.

Hazy medium amber with massive beige head. Sweet malty nose with caramel and hazelnuts. Moderately sweet with a bit of tangy sourness and a mild alcohol follow. Good feel, almost chewy, lively carbonation.
decent sour trippel, be careful how you pour huge head persists for minutes-this one is for hazy, yellow, sour beer lovers,would definitely have another one.

Bottle at Cafe Olivier, Utrecht. Pours a clear yellow creating a white head. Very spicy aroma with black pepper being the most outstanding note. There is also a light fruitiness behind the spices. Low sweetness and bitterness.
From what I recall about this beer, the flavor really sticks out on the back end. I really got a big sense of the flavor on the back part of my tongue. It was a little bit fruity and sweet.
Aroma is fruity: prunes and grapefruit. Flavor has raisins, malt, prune. Full-bodied.

33cl bottle to tulip glass. Pour is sparkling straw. Two fingers of beer, four fingers of pillowy white head which stuck around faithfully. Nose is sour grapes, citrus and a hint of dough. Tongue is lightly sour, malty and full of warmth. Mouth is light, sticky, and of average carbonation. Finishes sweet and dry with plenty of malt. A very nice tripel.

Bottle. Pours with a large white dense long lasting foamy head over a clear golden-amber body. Effervescent. Aroma and taste of muscat, coriander and golden syrup. Sweetish throughout, with a spicey alcoholic warmth. Nice.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2010 Pours a hazy gold color with a huge, easily excitable, white head that laces as it falls apart in chunks, and eventually settles half an inch thick with the appearance of a thick liquid. There is also an abundance of bubbles rushing to the top very rapidly. The aroma is quite amazing. Lots of saison characteristics, with funk, old world spices, yeast, and some comforting citrus. The flavor is loaded with yeast, spice, and citrus. The mouthfeel is very soft, frothy, and hovers in the mouth. This was a very impressive. My new go to tripel.

33cl bottle poured into a Rochefort Trappist glass.  Sparkling gold with one finger diminishing white head.  Aroma is yeast, candy sugar, spice, alcohol.  Flavor is sweet and sour with a bit of biscuit, slight grassy hops, some alcohol.  Medium carbonation.  Finish is mostly bitter, slightly sour with some alcohol.  Decent.

Holy shit the aroma waz da bomb.   Perfume and spice with loads of honey .   Pretty typical Triple flavours . I dig this style .  Spicy, peppery and dry ,with floral hops and flowers . Fruit esters in there.   Hell yea.
750 ml bottle a hazy golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts hop fruity citrus and some sweetness taste fruity citrus hop spices and a bitter finish a nice tripel

Bottle, 330ml. Pours a semi-cloudy golden/orange colour with plenty of carbonation and a beautiful, typical Belgian off-white head. Aroma is soft and pleasant, yet complex; lots of sweets citrics and estery notes. Taste is heavy and robust, very sweet, not too bitter, with a slight alcohol finish. Good Belgian beer, always in option here in Mexico because you can find it almost anywhere, unlike all other Belgian beers excluding Het Anker and Duvel.
Golden with nice big head. Aroma from hops, sweet fruit. Taste hops, yeast some light metallic. Body & text medium. Some alcohol. Otherwise quit neutral for a trippel.

A solid tripel. I had heard great things of gouden Carolus, and it delivered. Pour is slightly brown golden colour with huge foamy off white head. Sediments in glass. Aroma of malts, sweet hops, and huge Belgian yeast aroma. Taste is alcohol, sweet malts and yeasts. Overall, exceptional.

A- very good looking triple. Cloudy pale yellow body with thin white head. Leaves behind plenty of lacing in the glass.

S- Powerful astringent smell. Behind this is a good balance of citrus and yeast.

T- Some citrus and wheat upfront with a touch of bitter hops. Finish is very astringent with a big alcohol burn. Bitter hops remain after the alcohol burn is gone. I was unpleasantly surprised by this considering that I love tripels and most hide their alcohol very well.

P- smooth and creamy mouthfeel. What I expect in a triple.

O- I dont know if there was something wrong with the batch or if it was meant to taste like this. It looks like a tripel and has the great mouthfeel of a tripel but the taste makes me never want to have this one again.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 07-02-2007 17:12:33

sample from bottle... pours a nice golden with a huge 3 finger white head... citrus aromas with some yeast... medium carbonated body... smooth with more citrus and some light banana.... big yeast notes on finish with some lemon and light hops.

Bottle 33 cl from Boissons Center in Montagny-sur-Yverdon (CH). Blonde with red highlights, white foam compact and very fine, plentiful crackling. Nose of malt, banana, slightly acid and fruity notes. Sweetness and warmth of alcool, a little prickly with nuances of bitter orange, tangerine and fruity malted. Long aftertaste, bitterness and mellow perfectly fused.
Pours a bright golden yellow color. Aromas of hops, fruit, and a little yeast. Has a light fruit taste, with some yeasty notes, a touch of orange, and a good hop flavor.

Bottle.  Orange-hued body, hazy, sparkling, topped with a big, creamy white head, fluffy, coating the glass with lace, good retention.  Aroma is fruity, orange, grassy, light and spicy with licorice, anise, apple, and allspice.  Palate is medium with plentiful, creamy carbonation that fills the mouth.  Flavor is lightly sweet, orange, apple, licorice, wet grass.  Finish is smooth, lightly hopped, lightly tart, apple skin, licorice, lasting and mild.  Some alcoholic warmth as the beer comes to room temp.  This beer goes down really easy and is very refreshing.  2-3 of these could disappear in short order.

Poured gold with a medium off-white head. Aroma and taste: spices, ripe fruits, malts and some hops. Aftertaste: spices and over-ripe/sour fruit.. Heavy carbonation. Medium body.
I thought this beer had the elements I would expect from a Belgian Abbey Triple but lacked the depth and balance that makes most other Belgian Triples so good. Overall good... but very close to fair.

(33cl bottle, bb: 24.03.07. Well, Gouden Carolus website assured at least three years of tenability so I was willing to take a shot)
Orangish color, nice white head; very odd nose, to say at least, I cant quite put my finger on it: yeah, perfume, maybe, but if it was I myself wouldnt in a million years spray that perfume on me going out at evening, some sweet fruits and vanill sugar - and then my associations led me to a garage full of oil, gas and carwheel smells, but that you can put on my wild imagination, I quess; body was medium, carbonation high; flavor didnt fall much behind the nose in terms of strangeness, but it was fairly enjoyable: sweet fruits and candy sugar with kind of leathery aftertaste. Certainly this was interesting, thats for sure, but was it any good? Barely.

Bottle. Pours an almost clear golden color with a very thick foamy white head that leaves lacing. Aroma is crispy spicy and clean tripel style. Flavor is fruity sweet, very spicy and bitter in the end. Creamy texture and very lively carbonation. Nice.

Sweet aroma.  Golden color.  Sweet, slightly syrupy with a crystal malt finish.

Notes: Beer Advocate Belgian Beer Fest (Boston) 09

Una buona tripel "di classe" come tutti i prodotti Gouden Carolus, molto aggraziata nellabboccato dolce e piacevole, con note di moscato; una certa presenza alcolica si nota soltanto a bocca ormai piena e, se pur rischia di sbilanciare la sensazione gustativa, si assesta in una delicata armonia con il resto del profilo. Non ho ancora trovato una Gouden Carolus non buona.
12 oz bottle.  Pours hazy golden in colour with a decent white head. Sweet and malty in both aroma and taste, with some yeast and spices.

Bright golden color with haze, and fairly good rocky white head that recedes to a thin layer.  Nose has a pleasant mix of bready aromas and tropical fruits.  On the palate theres a striking resemblance to pineapple juice, with plenty of sweet/sour flavors, good carbonation, and maybe some banana as well.  Just a kiss of alcohol warmth on the finish (at cellar temperature serving), but overall is fairly drinkable for the ABV.

Bottle from Elfde Gebod, Antwerp, Belgium, 20-02-10   Pours hazy golden in colour with a nice white head. Sweet and malty in both taste and aroma but in the mouth there is also yeast, spice and with some soft fruits and a very slightly bitter finish, nice warmth from the alcohol.  A6 A4 F7 P3 Ov13  3.3

Aroma: flowery, sweet, a hint of alchohol, like a summers day. A yellow color and a white head, very clear. Taste holds a lot of alchohol, I cant really place the taste. Has a fine carbonation level and a nice, bitter after taste. Not really my favourite style, but a nice beer anyway.
Initial aroma tells you off the bat that it is Belgian.  Light yellow color.  getting some spice notes, maybe clove.  very saison-y to me.

Pours a nice golden orange colour with a medium frothy white head. The aroma is of fruits, citrus and some grassy hops. The taste is sweet and a little malty, but is also bitter towards the finish. It feels fairly smooth on the palate and also creates that warming alcohol feeling in the chest. Overall a good beer but not outstanding.

Pours an orange, gold color with a thick head.  Has a sweet bouquet.  Medium body.  The malt over powers the beer.  Doesnt balance well with the hops.  Generous carbonation level.  leaves a malty residue in the mouth.  It grows on you, but generally not impressed.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2010 23-JAN-2010, botlle with Ulkløbben @Mortens.
Golden, white head.
Yeasty nose with oranges, spicey. Creamy, high carbonaiton. Fine tripel.
06-FEB-2010, bottle @home.
Had it side by side with Nøgne Ø, Tiger Tripel. This won the competition due to being more flavorfull and creamy.
One of the better tripels I have had. The alcohol is well hidden and it has a light finish. Had this one at Olivier in Utrecht.

Bottle. 25.4 oz. Split with Sean. Pours honey orange golden with a thick, lucious, creamy white head. Aroma of grapes, apple, pear, scotch, barley, vanilla, light malts, and slight notes of hops. Nose is quite sour at first, but opens up nicely. Full, yet oddly delicate body with a smarmy, boozy mouthfeel and a tight, crisp, slow finish. Outstanding tripel.

Pours a darker golden orange body that produced a thin head with some lacing.   The taste was surpisingly sweet with a trace of hops.  Medium body that went down smooth.  For being high in alcohol it did not taste as such.  Nice beer.

Its slightly sweet with a touch of candy sugar, a touch of skunkiness, a little hops and a touch of alcohol esters in the nose. Medium bodied, dry and smooth.
Nice dark colour but not much head. Syrupy profile, lots of malts, could be softer. But for nine percent its quite easy to drink.
Very pale, with a thin head.  Tart and tangy, with an unfinished flavor.  Finishes with a fizzy, clean sting.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: 750mL poured into a trappist glass.  Light golden, not very murky, and poured with a pretty thick white head that lasts.  Aroma of light fruit, malt, citrus.  Backs up with a taste of citrus and a little tartness.  Light body with light flavor.  Wish it was a little more full bodied.

Hazy pale golden colour with a large white head. Aroma is of caramell and fruity esters. Flavour is quite sweet with caramell and dried fruit, light estery with a balanced ending. Quite a good tripel even though its on the sweet side.
Bottle -  Cloudy orange with a huge white head.  Spicy aroma. Medium caronation and body.  Fruity and spicy. Alcohol quite dominant .

Pours a hazy golden sunshine colour with a typically belgian head. Lovely aroma of dried apricots and light citrus with an undercurrent of grasses, toast and fairly unintrusive alcohol. The flavour is not terribly complex, though neither is it boring - fairly dry, with a bit of sweetness in the middle giving way to a nice, dry, lightly hoppy finish. It is not particularly weighty on the palate, though it does have a touch of oiliness with medium-fine carbonation. The finish is somewhat short.

A sejtelmesen homályos és mély aranysárga színű sör tetején koronaként pompázik a hatalmas gyönyörű és buborékos hab,ami stabilan tart.Illata fehér borsos,korianderes és citrusos és csiklandozza az orrot.Íze fantasztikusan összetett.Fűszeres,nagyon malátás és aszalt sárgabarackos amin átérezni a komlók fenyőgyantás olajait és kis muskotályos szőlő zamatot is.Ezek az ízek folyamatosan kergetik egymást a szájban,miközben az apró kis buborékok folyamatosan bizsergetik a nyelvet.Testes ital és az alkohol is kellemesen bódít és melegít.Utóíze komlósan száraz és gyümölcsös aminek a legvége hasonlít a mandarinhéjra,hosszan tart.Úgy érzem lett egy új kedvencem a "Csak a jó sör" segítségének köszönhetően.
Poured hazy light golden amber, CO2, malty, bannana, citrus rind, yeasty, little spice.

Bright, but hazy golden color with lot of bubbles and extremely well-formed fluffy white head, that provides a massively cohesive lacing.
The aroma is full of wonderful peppery coriander and aromatic hops. The flavor is also full of citruses and mild hop resin oils. A few atributes that i can say is coriander, honey malts, pine oil, orange peel and a lot of citruses of course. A finish is more on the sweet, malty side.  A lot more easier bodied one than expected. Amazing in its own style, reminiscent Tripel Karmeliet and maybe a bit more flavorful?? I dont know but ill research it.

Bottle. Poured gold with an nice thick white head. Aroma was complex with notes of citrus peels, sweet malts, coriander, brown sugar, cereal and bananas. Flavor was not as complex, sweet with fruit like banana and apples with an undertone of spice and malt.

0,33 l bottle
Nice opalescent golden body with a fantastic stable and foamy white head. Very intensive aroma of the style with tons of malt, coriander, orange peel, fruity esters, liqueric alcohol. Very alluring! And the flavor....Oily texture with a smooth mouthfeel, malt at the start. After a second the flavor-bomb exploses. Coriander, fine fruity sourish-tart taste, orange peel, coriander and hop...Well hidden alcohol numbling my palate and warming me up. Absolutely tripel style, i will search the beer anywhere!

Bottle.  Pours a hazy, golden color with an extremely large, frothy white head.  Lacing is excellent and head has some extreme staying power.  Aromas of bananas, barley, biscuit, and a hint of citrus.  Lively mouthfeel with a nice slick, sticky finish.  Flavors of bananas, bread, flowers, and some citrus.  Wonderful beer!

Bottle conditioned aged 7 yrs. Gold to light brown with white head. The aging has produced a smoother beer than I remember, however there is still a perfumed candy like flavour, almost strawberry in the background. The malt has a honeyed character, but is still light for the ABV and age. Nice and yeasty sweet on the finish. A very nice beer.
0.75l - Gold color with epic head even in a wetted glass.  Yeast on the nose, spicy palate with a mildly sour finish.  Classic Belgium.  Whats not to love?
Light golden color with an long lasting head and good lacing. Sweet and alcoholic aroma with a matching sweet flavor. Flavor mixes citrus and spice components with a somewhat bitter aftertaste.

Pours a cloudy, soupy brown with a large white head.  Aroma has a lot of cream, yeast, very bready with some brown sugar. Flavor has a lot of honey, boozy and sweet. Some grasses/hay toward the end. Spritzy mouthfeel, medium viscosity. Not a very good triple, frankly. Overall, fair.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2009 There is a hint of purfume or something artificial in the smell, it just doesnt sit right. Hazy and consistantly carbonated, light but still nicely particulated. The taste is very similar to the smell but sweet, very nice palate and smooth tasting, a bit of an aftertaste. The tiple effect on the carbonation cannot be ignored, it is quite smooth and bubbly.
Pours hazy yellow with a tall white head, Aroma is very citrus, and yeasty. With notes of wheat. The Flavour is very spicy and yeasty. Very complex and well balanced. Great Triple!

75 cl bottle at Belga Cafe beer dinner, paired with braised pork served with a Gouden Carolus Classic sauce and turnips.  Light golden color, medium white head with a bit of lacing.  Aroma had notes of citrus and light spice.  Light bodied, decent malt in the taste, fairly well balanced with hops late and in the finish.
Very nice amber with a big fluffy head. Aroam of sweet molasses and spices. Very nice sweet flavor of caramel, honey and sweet malt. Finishes very dry considering the sweetness. Good stuff.

large creamy offwhite head. mostly lasting longevity. thick amber hazy flat body. aroma: toasted caramel malt, caramel and lots of orange. if and ff: light sweet and moderate bitter. Long duration. Palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation and metallic finish.aroma malte caramel tostado;dulçor saboroso, sem ser enjoativo, muito bem balanceado pelo amargor metálico(semelhante ao de casca de laranja); toques de laranja no paladar; 190s

Bottle: Golden, small persistent white creamy head, lazy carbonation; solid sweetish-fruity (oranges) nose with a citrousy-hoppy support; robust bitter-sweet flavour, quite full bodied, creamy MF; lingering orangey-hoppy finish with a lot of sweet pale malt. A goody.....

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy golden orange with a big white fluffy head that lasts for ages. Nose is quite sweet and has a strong aroma of honey with lesser aromas of lemon, spice and caramel. Flavour is less sweet than the aroma but has a similar character with honey, citrus, caramel, yeast and mixed spice all standing out. Noticeable hops at the end as well. Quite different from a lot of tripels in that it is less sweet and has a creamier texture but is nonetheless a seriously good beer that could hold its own in any category.
huge foamy head, hazy orange body, aroma is berries, citrus spicy, alc, taste is strong alc, sweet malts, some hoppyness, citus(grapefruit), dry, good palate

bottle cloudy almost orange color good foam with nice retention. nose is spicy with some odd citrus hops i think not sure if its hops or a weird spice. mouth feel is good kinda creamy diff for a triple. flavor is sweeter with some fruit like apple interesting

75 cl bottle in Kjetil´s wedding. Clear golden color, big white head. Aroma is fruity, spices, yeast and sugar sweetness. Flavor is sweet, a bit acidic, fruity, some alcohol, ok bitterness. Almost too sweet, but a very fine beer.

On tap at leons. Cut through my spicey, herby pork chop really nicely. Bright yellow, slightly hazy color. Big white head. Nice spice, clove, all spice and grassy herbal hop flavors. Really good carbonation dances on the palate. Medium bodied malt, wheat flavors.

330 ml Bottle. Deep gold with high carbonation in straight rising lines and a huge rocky head. Estery, spicy aroma with citrus, bananas, and cream. Estery, citrus flavor, with some peppery hops, something like wheat malt (corn can taste like this?), a touch of coriander , and banana. Very bubbly, champagne-like carbonation, yet rich and full, silky, creamy, smooth mouth. Rather strong hop bite at the end. Powerful, flavorful, aromatic tripel with great balance.

330mL bottle thanks to matt7215 at his place. Pours a clearish straw gold with a large white frothy cap. The aroma is very nice, sharp, berries as an ester, peach, apple, candi sugar, very nice smelling. Flavour is qutie sharp, sweet malty aspects with blended esters upfront followed by a peppery finish and a minor boozy presence. Very dry in the aftertaste from the underlying hops. Very solid tripel, though nothing outstanding. Thanks for the share Matt.
Bottle. Golden pour with a nice fluffy white head. Hoppy, fruity aroma. Sweet, fruity, slightly dry. An incredibly addictive Belgian Tripel. Het Anker rocks!

750 ml. bottle. Pours a huge fluffy gradually deflating white head, over a clear, pale yellow (SRM 5) body.....nose is spice, including clove, allspice, bit of banana, bubblegum....taste initially is minimally sweet malts, followed up by allspice, lemon, apple and pineapple, finishes dry with a bit of pepper with attractive lacing.....mouth feel is light to medium, carbonation very high. This is a very typical Triple, a style that I love, with all the usual spice and layers of complex nose and taste.

Bottled 330ml. Appearance: Slightly hazy, surprisingly pale golden with a small (for the style) creamy white head. Some lacework. Aroma: Inviting with plenty of character. Coconut, arabic gum, malt, lemonade, yeast, banana, bubblegum, lemon sherbet, rose, lychee and lavender showing up. Sweet. Flavor and palate: Very nice with quite a lot of bubblegum, raspberries and coconut characteristics appearing. Sweet. The alcohol is very well hidden. Subtle carbonation. Extremely sweet sticky finish. Overall impression: Pale appearance, small head for the style. Reminiscent of lemonade, coconut, bubblegum, lemon and banana throughout. Extremely fruity. A very approachable triple.
I got this beer on tap in a pub named Carolus in Paris near Place de Clichy. I found this beer very good. Great taste, body. Awesome color. This, my friends is an abbey tripel highly recommanded

A terrific, authentic trappist-style tripel.  Aroma and flavor have the perfect amount of hops, wheat, licorice, alcohol and sweetness.  A little rougher around the edges than a Chimay Cinq Cents, but a really nice tasty tripel that I enjoyed a lot.  Not too sweet like a lot of the newer, non-traditional tripels.  You should taste a little alcohol...even though its well hidden, its good to know its there.
A true tripel in appearance and flavor. Nice thick uneven foamy head. Fairly thick palate as well. Bit too hoppy for me.

This one pours an appetizing golden yellow with a very thick, fine-bubbled, persistent head. Aroma is rather strong, fruity, yeasty and malty. Flavor is rich and mouth-filling, fruity and malty with a yeasty undertone. Texture is delightfully fizzy and tingly, smooth underneath. Worth finding.

Bottled. Pours golden And slightly hazy with a medium sized white head. Good lacing. Nose of spices, caramel and fruit. Sweet spicy flavour with malt, wheat, fruit and spices. Medium bodied. An enjoyable brew.

Radegast: trappist: rockin brew! Sloppy pour by the barmaid left way too much head, which I let settle.  The pour is hazy golden yellow, the nose was complex... yeasts, some roasted notes, also some fruits/ sugars.  The taste is very complex... the alcohol is immediately noticeable however the carbonation, roasted malts and sweetness (unexpected) make this very well balanced!
Pours hazy, yellow with HUGE white head.  Great lacing.  Aroma of spice and hops.  Taste of slight floral hops and yeast.  Nice spices in the finish.  Highly carbonated.  Way too easy drinking at 9%.
Cloudy yellow-orange, thin white head. Aroma is very faint, hard to place. Flavor is deep, but with some bitterness. Pretty fizzy mouthfeel. Not my favorite tripel.

Smells of alcohol. Pours with the biggest head EVER seen by me. Seriously, 99% head or so. And I poured on the side of the glass. Crazy. Very carbonated. Very pleasant palate and flavour after the head dies down. Slightly floral? Malty, yeasty, and smooth. Well balanced. Nice.
This was a nice representative of type.  Nice if modest head, cloudy golden sweet but plenty of pear and other fruit flavbrs.  Finishes well also.

This poured a cloudy golden yellow color with a big white head. Aroma was sweet, a big spicey and fruit notes but not much. Flavor was much better than aroma, mainly with hints of citrusy and light fruits. This didnt exactly strike me as close to the style, but as a beer it is very good stuff.

Thanks to unclemike for this one.  Pour is clear golden color with large rocky white head.  Aroma is lighter than expected: light malt, marshmallow, light spice, and faint pepper. Flavor is much lighter than I expected.  Very drinkable with flavors of light malt, floral notes, black pepper, and notes of clove.  This is one of the most drinkable tripels I have ever had.  Alcohol is not detectable.

330ml bottle from a KW group private order. pours clear yellow with a small lingeing white head. aroma of pale malt and alcohol. the flavour is a touch sweet from the pale malt but the alcohol doesnt show in the taste. a really nice triple.

golden colored beer with a white head 
smells fruity in a tutti-frutti-mix way, but some herbal hops are there too and some mango
tasts rather hoppy but malty too, alcohol seems to give perhaps a bit of some harshness, ome fruits are there too 
aftertaste is like fruitpunch again, now, alcohol is warming but not harsh, hops

(750 ml bottle from 1828 Vintage House, cellared for 10 mos. after purchase) Pours hazy gold-amber with two fingers of off-white head. Aroma of light caramel and fruit, perhaps some spice. Mouthfeel is smooth, fairly soft, medium-full and somewhat sticky. Light, droopy, broken rings of lacing. Flavor of light caramel and fruit with some pepper towards finish. Starts out quite sweet but then turns almost sweet and sour as it warms. Slightly hot with a light bitter pinch in finish. Decent tripel but not my favorite Gouden Carolus so far.
A very tasty tripel served in a goblet on tap.  Very fine character and balance.  Flavors were everywhere, banana, honey, vanilla, very unique.  Color was light orange yellow.
good clear blond beer, they told me it was a wonderful beer, but personally it was not my favorite.

bottle, golden-yellow-orange with particles with medium head. sweet fruity flavoured tripel that is very drinkable. a bit too sweet for this summer-ish day. nice triple, not special but better than average.

330 mL bottle from Holiday Wine Cellar (Escondido, CA).  Pours a murky yellow-orange apricot color.  The gigantic frothy white head only slowly dissipates, remaining mostly "solid" on top but making interesting caverns visible through side of glass.  It also leaves some great lacing.  Mellow aroma of yeast, fruit (orange/lemon/peach), musty grain, black pepper.  Flavor is lighty malty and yeasty with some fruit and spice notes.  Less sweet and more noticeably bitter hoppy than some other tripels Ive had.  Cant really taste the alcohol at all.

Poured out a nice amber brew until the junk on the bottom infiltrated my glass....thats ok though. Small bright white crown, thin retention, slippery lacing. I guess its been awhile since Ive had a nice tripel so the aroma here is killer! Apricots, a bit musty, peppery, caramel and bread - put all that stuff in a blender and drink it... how do we get a way with it in a beer? The taste here is great as well - lends to very easy drunkeness.
