Smooth fruitiness (more apricots, white grape juice?? - Ill have to check that one out I think), weak caramel is blended in nicely, a bit of yeast, good pepper quantity on the finish. This is the softest tripel I may have ever had. Im on my 4th since I started this review. Im trashed. So damn good you dont want to waste time typing. Mouthfeel is great! Smooth and soft with a bit of alcohol bit. medium bodied... nice spicy and candy finish. The spice has good legs for the finish. Did I mention that I went old school on the tunes this whole time? W.A.S.P. self titled. Blow me.

OK. I saved the sediment from each of the 4 bottles I just drank and poured them all into one glass and then slammed it back. I tell you, that may be one of the best glasses of beer Ive ever had. Woop Woop! My poor liver...

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2009 Poured a hazy golden color with a large frothy white head that left some lacing. The aroma was malty with some yeast and spices as well. Flavor was yeasty, fruity, spicy, as well as some other flavors that I couldnt identify. This was an excellent Tripel that I would definitely want to buy again.

16.9  fl oz.  Pours a beautiful gold with just the right amount of head.  Nice aroma, though, nothing to rave about.  Wow, the taste is initially sweet and malty, but then theres this explosion metallic taste, like I was sucking on a dirty penny.  Not great.  Not as bad as the Donker I just drain poured, but not good. This must be skunked, or it was stored improperly...  Either way, I dont think I got the best version of this one.

Another follow-up.  Given a few minutes to breathe, the metallic taste went away.  Its still nothing special, bu its no longer disgusting.

THOUGHTS: Hid alcohol incredibly well. One of the nicest tripels I ever had. I always avoided this because I figured it would be boring compared to their other beers, but they seem to do everything well.
TECHNICAL: Bottle Poured a slightly hazy, medium golden with an average to large, foamy, white head that slowly diminished and kept a thick sheet leaving excellent lacing in thick sheets on the side of the glass. The aroma was moderate malt, moderate yeast along with fruit, spices and flowers. The initial flavor was sweet and acidic; while the flavor was bitter and slightly sour with a long duration. There was candy sugar, yeast, fruit, flowers, spices and a lot more that I couldnt even begin to describe. The medium to full body was dry with very fizzy carbonation and a dry and light astringent finish.

This beer looks kewl, it has a massive mountain of white foam and a very cloudy yellowy brown body. The smell is sweet with yeast and lemon being the biggest aspects of the smell; I could also pick caramel and banana, as beer got warmer. The beer feels thick and smooth in my mouth with not too much carbonation. Full, full flavour doesnt taste watered down one bit. Theres kind of an orangey wood flavour to this brew and I like it. Yeast is an other flavour that quit prevalent, I also got creamy caramel at the back of my throat. The beer has lots of creamy citrus juice flavours hidden in the taste, this is a very complex beer. Its a simply amazing beer very easy drinking and you cant taste the high alc. content at all."

Bottle. Fruits, wheat and malt in aroma. Slightly unclear golden yellow colour with white head. Fruity and malty flavour with some caramel and discrete hops bitterness. Soft mouthfeel despite moderate carbonation.

Bottle, barley wheat and some spice notes on the nose. Hazy golden body with white head and some lace. Has a citric acid, spice and yeasty bread in the lavor and some zesty soapy thing going on. Alright little dry on palate decent brew.
Very nice blonde beer with fine fruit taste. A little bit worse than the classic one but really ok. One of the best blonde belgians and really worth a try.

bottle, pours light yellow, tall white head.  Aroma is floral hop and corriander.  Light malt, slightly sweet mixed with corriander and a nice bitter hop finish.  Moderately carbonated with a light mouthfeel.  This is a great tripel!

Bottle. A quite strong aroma of yeast, some champagne and bread, very little sweetness. The head is very large, foamy and white with a long duration. The body is orange. The taste is very sour, a malty aftertaste. the finish is medium long and mild. The body is creamy and lively with a lot of carbonation and a medium strong body.
Bottle. Light golden colour, creamy light-coloured head. Spicesy, taste of lemon and orange. Drinks easily, good long and tasty finish.
Sublime,exquisita,Amazing,altough i not familiarized with this style it taste like like a piece of full-boided,rich,malty,cloudy-yellow and quite alcohol-heavy, heaven,foamy plenty head.Gotta love it

Bottle. Nice soft banana bread, apple, and clove nose. Hazy light gold body with a thick attractive foamy head. Soft mouthfeel with a touch of alcohol and CO2. Notes of brown sugar, alcohol, floral notes, cinnamon, watered down whisky, warming going down, cotton, and a big herbal/phenol presence I cant put my finger on. Very enjoyable, one of the better Triples that I have had

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2010 Bottle, Hopduvel. Appears light golden with a creamy white head. Very balanced malts and hops usage. Aromas also evident of pear and banana esters. Spicy and alcohol warming with a smooth palate. Decent bitterness, but slightly metallic. True to the tripel style.

dont know where I got this from. If in a trade thank you. poured orange yellow with a white head. aroma , lemon, pineapple, alcohol, yeast, some banana and yeast. flavor the alcohol comes out 1st than got the lemon and pineapple, honey

750ml. Huge, frothy, white, lasting head with a hazy golden, orange body. Pleasant aroma of flowers, herbs, toasted grain, pineapple, alcohol, lemon, coriander along with a slight mustiness. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It fnishes lightly to moderately sweet and moderately bitter. Dry, peppery, alcoholic. Medium to full body with a smooth, velvety texture. Lively carbonation. A little alcoholic and Its tastes are slightly disjointed, but overall a very nice tripel.

Pours slightly hazy golden with thick white long lasting head with nice lacing. Yeasty spiciness in nose with green fruits and a faint vineous note. Flavor is spicy with some phenolics. Slightly sour maltiness. Finish is dry with a rather creamy palate.

75cl bottle, bbf 20-05-2011 L 0840, bought in superbest, allerød.
the cork was almost self-ejecting, it went off as if it was champaigne. no beer spilled out. clear ever so slightly cloudy yellow, huge white head that soon becomes fluffy and collapses partly.
very nice aroma balanced between citrus, spicy, and the sweetness of exotic fruits.
flavor is quite sweet, banana, spices, aftertaste is liqueurish, to-the-point flavor, but also perhaps a bit too conventional. alc. reasonably well hidden. flavor is well balanced and rounded and does not, as some tripels have any sharp edges to it. this is a plus. honey. somehow almost reminds me of mead. beer is better than my rating, but then - i cant give it 8 for flavor or aroma - that would need a wow! effect that i didnt find. if you like belgian this one is a must to have sampled.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2010 Golden orange pour, medium soapish creamy head.
Strong floral hop aroma with yeast, fruits, banana, some sweet orange/mandarin, citrus and herbs with a hint of pepper. Awesome. 
Flavour is yeasty and alcoholic when opened, but leave it breathing a bit and it becomes more subtle with sweet and sour fruits, herbs and spices. Leave it a bit longer and it becomes awesome, very wide range of fruity sweetness with a full yet subtle hop bitterness.
Long lingering hop bitterness, fruity sweetness, hint of sourness.
Awesome triple.

Bottle. Pour was light with a frothy white head.  Aroma of pepper, yeast, light malt, and alcohol.  Flavor was quite acidic but pretty well blended.  Light body with a nice, fresh, spice character.  Good brew.

Poured into a Gouden Carolus glass. Cloudy fainted yellow colour, an abslolutely enormous head that lasts for all its life in the glass. Fresh floral aroma, wet earth, clove, coriander and citrus.Harsh in the palate, with orange, cookies, dust, acidic finish. A very good one.

75cl bottle. Hazy yellow, tight pale head. Solid pilsner malty aroma, soft yeastiness, limefruit and wheat, clear witbier notes. Alcoholic flavor, yeastiness, mellow malts, peppery spicy finish. Some lime, overall a bit too boozy.  Silky strong carbonation, very pleasant to sip. Alright tripel, nothing that interesting.
Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is vineous with sherry, some exotic fruit and spicy yeast. Spicy and fruity flavour, rather dry with a slightly hoppy finish.

Draught at Brasserie Beck.   Golden with a lasting white head.   Spicy, dusty, and fruity aroma with pear and spiced apple skin.   Some pale malt sweetness going into a dry and spicy finish.   Light pear fruitiness and other yeast flavors add to the flavor, but its really simple and elegant.   Medium bodied with medium carbonation.   This handily routed Westmalle in a head to head.   The alcohol is well integrated and masked, but adds to the dry and peppery finish that makes this welcome sip after sip.

Smooth and creamy, very sweet, subtle yeasty sourness, but not extremely spicy.  A thin white head.  Golden color, but very cloudy.  Served a bit too cold at the Yard House in Pasadena - gulp - I was told by the waitress that shes never had anyone order this, so I guess I could be tasting a bit of a stale beer here...

bottle. huge white creamy/fizzy head into semi-sparkling murky orange body.  aromas of ripe fruit, bubble gum, touch of floral notes with some citrus.  flavor is initially lightly sweet and finishes much the same way with a touch of bitterness.  decently long fiinish duration.  slighly sticky mouthfeel.  damn fine tripel

Bottle @ Zolder, Bruges. Yellow to orange and almost clear beer. The head is huge, white in colour and rocky. The aroma is floral, citrusy, sweet and spiced (coriander, orange peel). The flavor is fruity, medium sweet and bitterish. Dryish finish with herbal hoppy notes. The palate is silky, low carbonated and medium bodied. Supremely easy and pleasant to drink.

33cl bottle from BevMo.  Dark "gouden" color with a small off-white head.  Nose of yeast, funk, and banana.  Flavor is yeasty and slightly sour with green apple, lemon, and alcohol.  Smooth palate.  Not the greatest tripel, but an interesting one.

Very dark for a tripel, this is definitely an old bottle.  Ruddy red-brown with a thin off white head.  Notes of oxidation, fortified wine, and alcohol in the aroma.  Taste is thin, more cardboard and oxidation, some spice, a light yeasty fruitiness.

Banana and straw in the nose.  Pours golden with a large foamy white head.  Bottle overflowed with foam upon opening.  Flavor is very nice, very easy to drink despite the 9 percent abv.  Yeasty, straw, and fruity on the palate.  Great beer.
Gouden is a pleasant surprise.  A yellowish color and long everlasting head.  The taste is very appealing and palate equally too much.
pours a cloudy straw with thin white head.  arom is sweet and pungunt.  flavor is nice and balanced with a citrus finish.  probably myhighest rated triple.
The nice fruit aromas, gold color and White head makes it already special before drinking it. This brewers really know what they do.

Bottle. Clear golden body with a huge white head. Aroma is fruity and alcohol.
Flavor is also fruity, some citrus and yeasty. An alcoholic finish.

1/5/09:  on tap, Wurstkuche in LA.  Gold color with a fluffy head.  Aroma of wheat, lemon, fruit and a little pepper.  Flavor is yeasty, balanced, of lemonade and biscuit.  Excellent tasty, crisp flavor.  Palate is smooth, and finish is refreshing.  Top notch Triple.

Bottle opened with a loud pop and foam poured out of the neck of the bottle until half of the brew was gone.  Disappointing to say the least.  What was left was a light straw colored beer with a thick cloud-like head.  Aroma is of biscuit, orange peel, and a bit of spice...flavor quite similar.  Medium to light in body...wish I had more in my belly.

330 mL into tulip. Pours a translucent light blonde with quite possibly the most enormous head I have ever seen on a beer- huge! Great sticky lacing. Aromas of bitter orange, lemon zest, pineapple, apricot- amazing. Taste is very nice: dried fruits, sugar, orange juice, spicy hops, and Belgian yeast. Slight acidic finish. At 9% this is truly a world class malt and hops balancing act. Very good.
A clear beer with a nice light gold color and a well formed white head that goes fast. Lightly bitter, good drinkable, nice taste, not too yeasty.
Pours pale gold, with a light moussy head. Good lacing. Beautiful aroma - floral and citrus, with some fruit aromas. Compex, and very enjoyable.

Bottled. a Cloudy orange color with anice white head, buit goes fast and keep a nice enlace around the glass. Aroma is amazing, floral, honey, orange, apricot. what smell!!! Flavor is citrus and honey, some very nice balanced with a medium carboanation. Mouthfeel is citrus and take a long time to go...

Yay I finally reached 100 ratings.  This one was a good choice for it.  Has a light gold color with a nice thick white head.  Smells of malts with hints of fruits and hops.  Has a nice flavor full of yeast particles.  A little bit of a bitter aftertaste but that is to be expected from a higher alcohol content.  Overall a this one was a pleasant experience.

I paid $4.55 at the Northcoast Coop in Eureka.  This poured a clear golden color with a nice fat white head and copious lacing.  Nose of citrus and fruit, with some clove spice.  Somewhat fizzy mouthfeel, but not unpleasant.  Flavor is yeasty with lots of fruits.  Very nice to drink.

bottled, clear golden pour with a lot of carbonation and full white head, sweet malt aroma with mild spice notes, sweet fruity flavor with lingering sweet alcohol notes, almost no hops noted, nice yeasty palate, enjoyable.

Bottle at Brouwers. Pours a light gold with a huge head. Highly carbonated, almost to the point of champagne. Mild citrus notes, with a bubble-gum sweetness and a good amount of hops showing through, too. Also a bit of yeast. It has a slightly harsh palate - there is not a lot of substance to counter the high carbonation - but the flavor is great.

On tap at The Front Door Boise, Pours out a straw topped with a tall white head. Aroma of spice and all sorts of tasty fruit. Tast of spice clove, sweetness, yeast, and more of the fruit. A very complex one. Tasty would love to try again.

Pours a glden orange out of the bottle with a massive bubbly white head. Aromas of soft fruits (banana, pear, papaya), floral notes, and bready yeast. Mouth feel is great! light airy bubbles fill your mouth and surround your tongue. Flavors are fairly similar to the nose, soft fruits, floral notes, some citrus (lemon), and a bready yeast. Nice slightly bitter finnish from the hops. Very good beer.

750ml Bottle:  Aroma of yeast, pears, nectar, light cloves, slight lemon, slight caramel, and slight pepper.  Poured gold/yellow/light orange in color with a large, fluffy, creamy, white head that lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of tiny particles throughout.  Good lacing.  Flavor is light to medium sweet, lightly bitter, and very floral.  Tastes of pollen, fruit, yeast, nectar, slight lemon, sugar, slight pepper, and slight tropical fruit.  Medium body.  Slightly sticky, slightly chalky texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Sweet, floral, pollen finish is lightly dry.
(Bottle 75cl) Pale yellow with tall fluffy head. Aroma of wheat and tropical fruits. Nice fruity flavours. Smooth and light body.

Pale yellow color with a fluffy white head.  Aromas of wheat, citrus, and bananas.  Strong flavor - mostly lemon and banana.  Smooth on the palate, well-hidden alcohol, nice finish.  Definitely an above average tripel.

Bottle 33cl.
Pours a murky golden colour with a big head and almost no carbonation.
Very clear and fruity sweet smell.
Oranges, apple and raisins there, also some others smells I can’t exactly define.
Taste is very fruity and welcoming, great flavour and goes down with a slight bit of warmth.
Great Abbey Tripel!
Pours a dark golden color. Not overly cloudy. Lacing on the glass as you drink. Aroma of banna and bubble gum. Well balanced flavor, the hops are subdued and the taste is spicy and a bit sweet.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy golden body with a white 2 finger head.   Floral with nice belgian fruits, lemon, bananas, and berries.  Bubble gum and lightly spiced.   Good beer.

330ml  bottle (Cracked Kettle, Amsterdam)
Opened with a pop, small foam snake appeared soon afterwards. Needed 2 glasses it was so full of head. Hazy straw colour, when the glass-sized head had settled - there was no chance to minimise the yeast that came over. Sweet fruity aroma - apples and peaches - at first. Pleasant pale malts come over next, then a touch of flowery perfume. Very light and crisp. Unbelievably soft palate, the carbonation that created the head doesnt fizz in the mouth at all. Loads of retronasal esters, almost bubble-gummy in places. Taste is full, sweet, and soft light malts. Hops are very restrained, quite clear but not imposing, altogether pretty well balanced. Finish is pale malts and slightly grassy noble hops. Covers the alcohol very well, theres no hint of any kick to this at all. Stunning beer.

Found a bottle of this recently for cheap.  Poured a very hazy orange color, almost like unfiltered apple juice.  Aroma is very strong of raw banana and some sweet hops.  Flavor is very complex.  Starts off very sweet of pear and moves into a slightly spicy clove flavor.  Ends with a very smooth hops bitterness and leaves an almost Hallertauer hops flavor at the end.  Very fine carbonation and not a lot of alcohol taste for a 9% beer.  One weird aspect of this beer is that it makes your taste buds feel as if baby orajel was rubbed on them.  Tongue is not numb, only your taste buds.  But this feel eventually subsides. Another aspect of this beer is the fact that the banana and clove flavor don’t determine its flavor.  Very well rounded, smooth and surprisingly heavy beer.  Great beer!

11.2 ounce bottle in Duvel glass.  Hazy orange with flat white head and some lace.  Yeasty spicy orange tobacco aroma.  Sweet honey orange spicy with mild tobacco bitterness and lingering orangy spiciness.  Medium body and carbo.  Nice mouthfeel.  Very good.  I know this is a great beer, having had it many times.  But, once again, tryng to get  fresh beer around here in Long Island is very difficult.
Pours hazy dark gold with thick head.  Floral hop aroma with a touch of yeast.  Light fruit and malt flavor with a clean hop finish.
Cloudy pale gold color, thick foamed head with heavy lacing, flowery hop bouquet, fruited smooth malt head and body with a clean tactful hop finish, complex flavor profile, highly sessionable

[Eyes] Great pale yellow with a big foamy white head.

[Nouse] Citrus, floral and bannana, in deep alcohol is present.

[Mouth] smooth body is spice, floral, alcoholic taste in deep and hops and hops and hops! a bitter long afthertaste.

small bottle. Pours a cloudy orange/gold with a very tall and well formed white head. I’m surpsised at the sheer amount of pepper in the aroma. I’ve noticed other similar beers suggest pepper, but this one is excedingly rich in vegetal aromas. I also get lemon, banana, and soft spices. The palate is delightfully creamy while the flavor leans more towards fruits and dry spices than in the vegetal direction. This is a very smooth and complete package. It has just a tinge of wildness and a solid fruity sweet foundation.  It’s delicate, yet robust. Very well done tripel.
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2008 Standard tripel pour, decent head.  Aroma is fruity and sweet.  Taste is strawberry, banana, lovely clear hop flavour, not too dry with a pleasant sweet finish.  Excellent beer.

Taster at The Mondial de la biere 08 in Montreal. The color is a hazy blonde with a white head. The aroma is pleasant. The taste is of malt and grapes and citrus fruits, with just a bit of hops. This is a very very good example of a tripel sbbey.

Bottle from Dranken Geers.  Gold, thick rocky head.  Perfumed aroma.  It’s rather a good tripel, nice strongish hop on the finish.  Slight peach on aroma.  Settles down into an alright tripel.  I quite liked it.  Decent hop on finish.  Bit of hot alcohol.
Gold pour with a slight haze Flavour is fruity and malty. Medium bodied. Sweet finish.

Pours a pale hazy yellow with a two finger creamy white head. The nose was sweet, yeasty, grapes, spicy, some white pepper, cardamom, orange peel and lemongrass show as it warms. The flavor was sweet, nice spicy/yeasty character, curacao, hoppyness shows as it warms, peppery. I’d have to say this is one of my favorite tripels, very nice and very gratifying as it warms.

Wait a minute, Ethan just turned 21? I have been contributing to his delinquency for over a year now!   Gold pour with a slight haze.  Fluff white head a typical Gouden lace.  Complex aroma, very fruity.  Flavor is loads of fruit, malts and yeast.  Well balanced and complex!

Bottle shared by aubreya at Milltown in honor of Ethan’s 21st bday.  Congrats, bro!  I didn’t take any notes on this one, but it was very nice indeed.  Solid tripel with alcohol well hidden.  I kind of wish I would have taken notes. Very enjoyable.

My store recently received this beer not too long ago.  I was told by the employee that this was his favorite of the brand that they currently had in stock, so I went ahead and bought a four-pack.  This is some amazing beer.  The appearance is wonderful.  I had a taste of it very cold, and it was great, but I think when it warmed up a little bit, it hit the spot just right.  Overall, this is probably one of the best beers I have been able to try in my location.

RateBeer Rating, Style and Glass: 95, Abbey Tripel, Trappist, tulip
ABV, Volume & Calories: 9% in 11.2 fl oz. estimated at 200 C
Purchased at: Canals Lawrenceville, NJ for $3.50 ($13.99 Belgian sampler)

Aroma: inviting, banana, fruit, sweet. 9 out of 10.

Visuals: gusher, hazy, golden, beautiful, sunrise, thin, white head, nice lacing. 5 out of 5.

Taste: banana, some bitterness, dark, chemical. 8 out of 10.

Palate: biting, drying, sandy, woody, long finish. 4 out of 5.

Overall: Unique. Seems commercial for a Belgian offering, but not bad. Its good, but I wouldnt travel for it.  okay craft. 17 out of 20.

Golden straw. Voluminous white head smatters intricate lacework all over the glass. Lovely aromas of pineapple, pear, honeydew, lime peels, airy phenols, peppery hops, and candy sugar intermingle with hints of licorice, bubblegum, and sweet vanilla-cake maltiness. Quite vibrant and complex. Firm effervescence tickles the palate. Succulent yet dry with an explosion of fresh oranges and pineapple combined with a savory tandem of herbal and floral hops. Malts are clean and pillowy, and the combination of puttylike yeast and tropical fruit esters adds to the soft feel and uplifting nature despite the high alcohol. Hops continue to contribute their zesty sparkle while evoking thoughts of aniseed and lime peels as they tease the tongue with a pleasantly tight and refined bitterness. Rich wafery malts bolster the bodys core with a well-textured softness which echoes the faint candy sugar remnants. Zingy alcohol complements the peppery hops and neutralizes some of the sweetness before warming the gullet. Bright tangerine is sandwiched between the  zippy dryness and sugary malts at the finish, before a seamless transition to  feisty lingering snippets of coriander, snappy phenols,  and herbal hops. This has always been a solid beer, but I especially like this  particular bottling with all its cohesiveness and interesting yeast- and high-fermentation-derived  nuance.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: On tap. Hazy golden colour, thick creamy white head. Aroma of sour fruits, malts, yeast, sugar. Flavour is dense, sweet, malty, some yeast, very fruity. Sweet-sour finish with a hint of alcohol bitterness. Very nice.
Golden colour, huge white head. Aroma has citrus and some spices. Flavour is fruity and malty. Medium bodied. Sweet finish.

On tap at Sharp Edge.  Pours a hazy honey orange color with a thick frothy head that left some really nice lacing.  The aroma was yeasty with some peaches, citrus, and a lot of overall fruitiness.  The flavor was very fruity too.  Some cooking bread alcohol flavors with mangoes, ginger, and candy.  A very sweet tripel.  Not much bitterness or hop character at all.  A medium body with a kind of milky texture.  Decent, but not my favorite tripel.

750 ml bottle, lightly chilled served in a chalice glass.

Snow white, rocky and thick head that had plenty of ability to cling to the class. Clear, light golden hue with high carbonation - lots of tiny bubbles. Aroma reminds me of spicy, clovey, sweet and earthy tones, light hoppiness.

Smooth but sharpness on the cheeks from the high carbo - warming and light, mildly bitter finish. Not my favorite but a very nice beer

11.2 oz bottle.  A surprise mini-gusher right out of the fridge.  Lost a bit before hitting the glass.  Clearish bronze straw with a huge, whipped white head that leaves copious speckles and swirls.  Nose is yeast, dough, lemon-pepper and roses.  Medium light, oily, with soft carb.  Taste is lemon peel, honey, green olive and ginger with a dry, bready finish.

Bomber. Poured light golden with a massive white head that left plenty of lacing. Aroma of apples and oranges with a clove spice punch. Tasted was spicier than expected, with a spot of bitterness quickly masked in the sweet finish. Not at the top of my list of Tripples, but definitely a beer that grew on me with the second pour.

Really nice hazy orange pour with a really thick and sticky head.  Nice citrusy scent.  A definately tripple, and a good one.  Spicy citrusy and warm.  I found it a bit overcarbonated but it’s a minor complaint.
(Dégusté avec frecnh tickler) Biere de couleur or brumeux. Odeur de mou de vin, oranges, sucre, peches et une minuscule odeur d’alcohol. Gout d’alcohol et de jus de peches.

Bottle 75 cl. Creamy white lasting head with good lacing. Hazy yellow/orange body.Good spicy aroma of coriander and oranges? Medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter. Crispy! Well balanced flavor and a fresh finish.

Pours a hazy yellow color with a healthy white head.  It foamed out of the bottle when I opened it, just like papajohn.  It smells of apples, whiskey, caramel, spice, and apples, with a floral hint.  The taste is very good with heavy caramel apple flavor and an alcohol presence that hints of whiskey.  Good tripel.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2008 330 ml bottle from Holiday Wine Cellar:  Started foaming out of the bottle when I popped the cap. Hazy pale peach color with a small fading white head. Aroma is honey and over ripe tropical fruit. Flavor starts tropical fruit sweet followed by spice, caramel and a medium dry orangy finish. Medium body is creamy with lively carbonation.
330 ml botlle. yellow golden colour. white head. not really my kind of taste, but tripels aren’t anyway...
33cl, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex, hazy, good head, very good brew, but not a topper

I wasn’t extremely impressed by this beer, especially after having Het Anker’s other excellent beers. This one was just pure yeastiness. It was like a honey drenched yeast bomb. I had high expectations, but I guess abbey tripel isn’t a style of mine, as I have had bad experiences in the past.

750ml bottle: Shimmering yellow pour with a three-finger whipped head that settles into a firm cap on top.  The aroma is all yeast and honey - lots of ripe banana, pear, sweet apple - wrapped in an ethery blanket.  Big, chewy mouthfeel.  Hot alcohol vapor fills the mouth with each sip.  Dirty, but sweet, malts offer honey and sugary toffee while the fruit esthers continue to bombard the tongue.  Cool down the fusels in this and it would be more enjoyable.  As is, still darn good.

Hazy golden color with a medium slightly fluffy white head.  Aroma is yeasty, grassy, lightly sweet, slightly spiced - bits of orange and cloves.  Flavor is surprisingly dry for a big Belgian tripel.  Spicy notes in great depth, assumedly at least in part from the yeast.  Very nice complex beer that, though fairly dry, has nice fruity and never bitter qualities.
Bottle. Pours a a light amber with a large creamy white head. Sweet fruit aroma, no alcohol. Flavor is sweet as well, very prominent malt. Sweet dry quick finish.

Pours cloudy amber-gold with bubbly white head. Scents of bananas, pepper, yeast, and a dusty background. Dust reflected in flavor and coupled with sweeter malts. A sticky triple, which contrasts the dry character. An interesting tripel, but not one of my favorites.

A hazy golden ale with a thick creamy white head. A pleasant aroma of juniper, candy sugar and warming alcohol. In mouth, a spicy savoury ale with coriander, cream, warming alcohol and almost coconut like notes. Very interesting. Bieropholie import, tasted around May 2007.

Bottled. Pours deep orange with some small light sediment pieces floating around and a white head. Aroma is banana, clove, slight hint of barbasol shaving cream, belgian yeast, and spices. Flavor is sweet belgian yeast, banana, and well spiced. Good solid body with a slight hint of barbasol throughout the experience.
11.2oz.  Hazy golden pour with a white head.  Spice and malt in the aroma.  Hoppy and hugely fruity - apples, pear nectar, tangerine.  Matching flavor - sticky and sweet.  Decent finish.  Nice beer.
Light fruit malt aroma. Cloudy golden color with a large white head. Light beginning with a tangy and sweet middle. The sweetness fades in the finish leaving a strong tangy aftertaste.

341ml Bottle

App.: 
Cloudy golden poor, thin off-white head


Aromas: 
White wine mulch, coriander, orange, caramel, peaches and bananas


Palate:
Alcohol right off the bat, light sweetness that is perfectly balanced with the bitterness, medium/full body

Flavors: 
Coriander, peaches, caramel

Notes: Typical Carolus classic!
Aroma is fresh bananas.  Flavor has a hop bite with a sweet body. Like an evil ex :) Bitter finish with sweet notes. Definite Bazooka Bubblegum notes in this one.

Draft - Brasserie Beck.  Hazed yellow, thin foamy white head.  Initial aromas of cotton candy perfume warm to notes of anise and coriander.  Room temp bring out notes of sweet bready citrus.  Honeyed fuzzy fruit and waxy spice flavors ride touches of floral grassiness.  Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, fruity finish.  A good sipper on this warm summer afternoon...

750 ml bottle. A cloudy golden beer with a generous and persistent white head. Nice aroma, quite powerful and hoppy, with notes of flowers, grass, citric fruits, spices and some alcohol. The flavour is quite sweet, not totally but enough balanced, and with spicy and fruity notes. Medium to full body, lively carbonation, long finish with medium bitterness and some alcohol. Very good tripel, quite drinkable for its size.

Yes fathers day (and my son has made it even better with some fine beer) and Chicagobears and I are in a sample mood. This is a wonderful Belgium tasting of citrus even pronounced even more at the finish. I will agree the alcohol is well masked.

One of a string of beer that Dad and I will be sampling for Fathers day.  From one of my favorite brewers.  A clear looking golden triple pours into Westmalle chalice.  Fine fruit esters and spices.  Taste is yeasty and zesty.   A smooth triple that has a creamy finish.  All these fine Belgians seem to mask the alcohol too well.
Carolus scores again.  Yum.  Seriously delcious.  Bingo.  This beer is a winner.

Bottle 75cl. Creamy white excellent mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Powerfull moderate malty and heavy hopy aroma. Full of esters and citrus notes. Really great. Heavy bitter flavor. Long powerfull nice finish loaded with fruity esters. Fantascic creamy palate. I love this beer.

Corked bottle from Party Source.  Poured hazy orange color with a huge frothy white head that lasted with excellent lacing. Complex spicy fruit and yeasty aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture and lively carbonation. Medium to heavy fruity sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate to long duration with a small alcohol bite. This is a good sweet beer.

75cl bottle from Beer World Largo (Florida). Pours a cloudy honey amber (golden orange) with a thick white head that provides ample lacing on the glass. Aroma is spicy with notes of citrus, bread, yeast, lemon zest, and fresh spice. Medium to full bodied with noteworthy carbonation. Flavor is sweet honey, spice, and fresh flowers with a slightly bitter finish.

Cask at the Rake with Reakt, 9th April 2008. This is a cracking tripel - it doesnt do anything unexpected, it simply does the style very well. Cloudy orange colour, honey aroma and a perfect balance of honey, wheat and hops in the taste, accentuated by some fruit hints. The palate is perfect, the beer feeling soft on the tongue and the taste lingering for you to enjoy.

bouquet is floral but not the best of the upper echelon triples from Belgium.  Slightly foamy when it hits your tongue but you are rewarded with a refreshing hoppy, sour chewiness of a Triple.  Its a 9% beer with smooth character but I would not pay $4.50 again for an 11.2 ouncer, I prefer some of the American Microbrew triples to this Belgian.

Great triple.  Has a bright golden body with giant white, fluffy head.  Leaves a wonderful lacing in the glass.  Spicy and mildy fruity aroma and taste.  Well attenuated.  Goes down a little too well if you know what I mean.

Pale golden, lightly hazy with a very thick creamy/fluffy white head.  Truly beautiful-looking beer.  Aroma is quite fresh, light malt, crisp bright spiciness.  Light clove, apricot and lovely yeasty spiciness.  A bit of mint and soft yeastiness.  The flavour is just so well-balanced.  A light wheaty/bready malt base, but it is still deliciously dry.  Flavour is spicy and lightly fruity.  Very delicate with a lingering mint/herb hoppiness on the back.  Finishes very crisp and dry.  Awesome.

Bottle at some Beer Hall in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Hazy lively golden pour with a huge & frothy white head. Nicely aromatic with Belgian yeast esters. Some herbal notes, mild bubblegum (without being sweet), honey, dates and very subtle lemon peel. Nice aroma. The body has a dense and creamy carbonation, thats actually a bit too lively at first, then it settles down nicely. The flavor has a solid Belgian malt base, making it a bit honeyish overall, along with mild lemon peel, smooth peppery alcohol and an herbal Belgian hop bitter finish. Not the most complex, but definitely solid.

100th rating! [Bottle] Poured hazy gold with a large whiteish head. Aroma is spicy and sweet, with lots of bready yeast. Flavor is very nice. Typical belgian yeastiness. Perfect amount of spices and carbonation. Very light mouthfeel, and pretty much no alcohol detected.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2008 330 ml. Cloudy, orange-amber with a large meringue head that leaves sheets of lacing. Aroma is rich fruitcake (with icing).  Flavor is similar: dense brandy-rum cake with raisins, lemon, apples, and dates. Nice balance from subtle earthy notes of sourish leather and woody herbs. Well-blended balance of big flavors; the richness pitted against the dryness of the yeast, hops, and alcohol. Medium body is mostly smooth and dry.

[Bottle] Pours dark golden with a big white head. Aroma is really lemony with a hint of banana. Taste is yeasty, with a good deal of malt, and a bit of coriander. Medium-thick mouthfeel with a long finish that is slightly dry. The dominance of the lemon in the aroma didnt really work for me, otherwise a fairly good beer.

Hazy, dirty blonde.  Herbal, dry floral aroma.  Lively, meadow spices of coriander and green pepper, with zesty citrus flashes of lemon and orange.  Banana eases it back a little with some conventional sweetness.  Flavor is a slightly sterile warmth at first of honey and fruit liqueur, wholly bland and very dry.  Peppery alcohol and overripe fruits with a type of stale citrus vodka intimiation that suggests the brittleness and obesity of age.  Very weighty palate; mostly absent carbonation in this bittersweet syrup.  Smacks of cotton candy and unsweetened vanilla coffee syrup.  Chases hot.  A slow gathering of dust on this probably once lovely triple, even in a short amount of time.

Corked bottle.  Foggy, light golden pour with a thick bubbly head.  Slightly spicy aroma, with hints of coriander and yeast.  Flavor is malty and yeasty with notes of coriander and citrus.  Medium body with plenty o carbonation.
Clear golden pour with a huge, bubbly champagne-like white head. Sweet, fruity, yeasty aroma. Flavor is much the same with a big alcohol presence. Spicy and good. A nice triple.

330ml bottle 
9.0% ABV 
I tried this beer on April 25, 2008 at "Smokeless Joes" in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a solid orangy-gold colour with a very thin white head.  The aroma was that of sweet malt and some yeast. The mouthfeel was medium-bodied, and highly carbonated.  The flavour was candied malt, some hoppy grapefruity hints, and a little more yeast.  A very good beer.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2008 Pours hazy golden orange with sediment floaters. Huge, fluffy off white head. Nose and flavor is sweet and spicy, as is the flavor, with citrus and fruit sweetness. Very lively on the palate, and a finish that is smooth, and somehow just dissappears.

Bottle. Hazy golden colour in the galss with a huge pearly ehite head. Heavy spicy aroma of coriander, citrus and tropical fruits. In mouth a pearly texture with large carbonation. Taste of spices, fresh fruit, and alcohol.

33cl bottle. Pours a hazy gold with highlights of tan and dirty yellow. The head pours up white in color and medium in size. Small spots of lace are left on the glass but not much. The aroma is richly perfumey with resiny, oily, spicy aromatics and some notes of sweet fruit and cakey malts. The fruity aromas are hard to place - tropical, perhaps some citrus, fruity liqueur (thanks to the hint of ethanol in the aroma), and made more interesting with a touch of exotic spice. The flavor is complex, just like the nose. There is a strong fruitiness at the tip of the tongue - melons, papaya, mango, pineapple, and citrus.As the beer travels slightly back - squarely between tip of tongue and mid-palate - spices emerge along with tartness and a touch of sharp alcohol flavors. At mid-palate, there is an earthy bitterness combined with bitterness from the alcohol which balance sweet malts, tropical fruit esters, and a light peppery spice. A bready malt flavor also becomes apparent, including a strong taste of wheat. The finish is crisp and long, fairly dry, and alcoholic. The mouthfeel is crisp and rich - both well carbonated and oily and somewhat thick. As the beer warms the flavor of ethanol strengthens, giving the finish a boozy character. Overall, a wonderfully complex Belgian Tripel.
Pours gold with a white head.  Smells of bubblegum, oranges, dry malt, light spice, perfume.  Tastes of citrus with a semi dry finish and some residual spice.  Decent.

This was wonderful.  Belgian appearance; rich golden body, huge head.  Nose of a tripel ... bread and yeast.  Taste of a tripel, bread, yeast, with a longer and more bitter finish than I expected.  Wonderfully creamy palate.
33cl brown bottle. Pours a deep gold color with a lasting head and white lace. Medium body, big pale malt flavor and slight alcohol/spiciness.
On tap at Brasserie Beck in Washington DC.  Nice golden color with a big fluffy head.  Slightly hoppy, clean finish and easy to drink.  A touch harsh on the back end though. Good beer

Poured from bottle 4/2008.  Lemon cake aroma - nice.  Big head, cloudy gold color.  Great combo of flavors - bread, citrus, spice , pepper, banana.  Hop and wood in the aftertaste.  Great finish.  Terrific.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Bottle 0,33ltr: Orange coloured great Tripel with an complex array of ingredients, with an great citric taste.

Orange pour very neat colour, head thin back to mild froth cover,very ample carbonation.Aroma,stonefruit,malt,citrus,clove,van sweetness throughout,a lovely mellow tasting triple,the 9% al vol is hidden by good flavours.Hints of coriander at the finish,bit of clove and ginger,like this range of ales.

Pours a clear light gold with big fluffy, soapy white head.  Strong belgian grassy hop nose along with peachy sweet fruits.  Very well carbonated, perhaps too much, on the palate, starting with honey golden malts before a sharp, catty, vegetable-like hop bitterness takes over into the long, mildly dry finish.  An interesting tripel, but not too easy-going.
Bottle in Antwerp ... yellow lots fo small bubbles and a bubbly head ... yeasty hop nose ... over fizzy ... lots fo light fruit and belgian hops.

(Bottle, Akkurat, Stockholm, 4 April 2008) Golden colour with huge, frothy, lasting, white head. Fruity nose with citrus, orange, spicy hints of clove and coriander. Quite lovely aroma actually. Fruity, slightly citric taste with citrus (orange, lemon) and a nice, spicy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, balanced sweetness. Brilliant balance. Very nice beer.

Poured a cloudy gold with a fluffy white head.  Aromas of yeast and malt with a bit of citrus.  Spicy taste of citrus, banana with a dry bite.  Alcohol is noticable and I enjoyed the medium level of carbonation.  A solid example of the style.

Bottle; poured a classic gold color with a large, nice looking head.  Aroma was yeasty, spicy, with dough and fruit/apples.  Pretty unimpressed with the flavor, based on the high average that this beer has.  Not bad tasting, but was a missing something that would have brought the flavors together.  Moderately sweet.  Pronounced yeasty and doughy flavors; some fruit.  Alcohol was noticable, but nothing too pronounced.

Poured from the bottle into a trappist glass.  A cloudy orange-straw color with a very big, foamy white head with long retention.  A rich aroma with a blend of citrus hops, other fruits, some malt, and a touch of yeast.  Sweet, fruity flavor with a touch of sour and bitterness at the finish.  Wet, thinner body, with a lot of carbonation and tingle, and a presence of alcohol; best to be sipped.  A solid Belgian ale, but not one that stands out in my opinion.

Bottle- Deep hazy yellow topped with active bleached white froth. Nice lace. Spicy, floral nose with lots of soft fruit and bready yeasty nuances. The flavour is quite nice. Huge fruit component with lots of spices and floral edges, yeasty with sweet sugars. Bready with super sharp hop profile and freah leafy greens towards the finish. Quite assertive and full bodied. A hop forward, very full triple that I like.

33 cl bottle. Very clear beer for a triple. 
Complex beer with a taste of banana and honey.

From caged and corked bottle.  I opened the cage and the cork went flying.  Pours clear gold with a huge head of tiny bubbles. Aroma is uninspired with some malt and bread like yeast. Mouth feel is lively with lots and lots of carbonation.  Flavor is better than the aroma with some nice fruit (mostly banana) and bread.  A good amount of alcohol is also present.  Not enough to distract, just enough to enhance what is there.

33cl. bottle: Lightly hazy light amber with an orange core. Nice creamy off-white head that starts out above average but dies down to a film rather quickly. Powerful aromas of bready malt and grain. Banana bread and some toasted marshmallow come just behind the malt.  Definite toffee and caramel continue the sweetness while the alcohol sneaks in behind then surprises you. Flavors are quite deep and complex (especially compared against all the ho hum tripels that have flooded the market). Malt, dark brown sugar start up front and roll back on your tongue while fading through and dark, almost burnt, caramel. Further back some apple and a bit of "green" harshness that can be best described as green tree bark. Toasted marshmallow shows up in the flavor as well. Perhaps just a slight cardboard in the back but it doesnt distract you. If anything it adds a certain level of depth. There is some grilled fruits in the back, or perhaps fruit marmalade cooked in a pan. Nicely balanced tripel and the alcohol is well hidden.
11.2 ounce bottle purchased al Case & Keg Boca Raton, FL for $4.00 Very good

Hazy pale orange colour with huge white head. Clove and spicey mouthfeel which hides the alcohol.
Very pleasant.

Pours a golden yellow color with big off white head. Aromas of  bananas, yeast, malt. Flavor is fruity with hints of yeast and spice. Medium body with a creamy texture and lively carbonation. This is one of my favorite tripels. Excellent!

Big bottle pours hazed pale oak veneer color with a proud head that takes time to die off leaving very little lace.  The aroma has strong malts, yeast, citrus/banana fruits, and floral.  The flavor is fruity, yeasty, spicy, malty, kind of dry, and some faint bitterness.  The palate consists of refreshing and cleansing carbonation infused in a medium bodied feel.  The finish is rather quick and dry.  This is one of the better Triples Ive had in some time.  Post script - as usual with my ratings of Belgians, the yeast pour and temperature make things much more interesting!  Oh, and I broke out some Tillamook cheddar to accompany and it works well!

A beautiful dark golden colored beer, with a very large white thick foamy head. A lot of aromas, a combination of caramel, fruits, like raisins. Also light spicy. A rich taste of banana, pine, honey and malt. Its complex and balanced. A beer to enjoy on a nice summer day.
alla spina chiara schiuma non abbondante abbastanza persistente sentori fruttari frutta sciroppata ananas buccia daracia mara miele dacacia coriandolo
Bottle, pours a golden yellow haze with a huge head.  Appearance is very nice, aroma is sweet.  Clean taste and very nice aftertaste.  Pretty good Tripel
Wow, crisp abbey tripel! Pours hazy yeloow color with barley any head. Smells of fruits and tastes of fruit, malts, and alcohol. Funky good beer!

Sampled in Nancy, France: Came from the tap golden and with a very slight haze, and a white head, that laced nicely on the glass.  Aroma was of spice, some banana esters, and alcohol.  Flavor was the same, estery, with some spice and a hint of alcohol.  medium and bubbley on the mouth feel.  Excellent triple.

Bottle again from Belgian Belly. This looks amazing, a shining, clear gold with a snow white head and thin stream of bubbles. Like a dream advert for beer, clearly in top nick. Medium bodied and slightly fizzy in the mouth. Big fruity wafts of mango, passion fruit, banana and orange which are all present in the taste along with pineapple, fresh bread and sprucey hops. Good dry, hoppy finish with the alcohol well concealed. This is some good beer!

Slightly clouded amber hue with decent white creamy head.  Orange and yeast nose which is also present in the flavour with malt amd other fruity hints.  Not a great deal of after taste, fairly short in the finish.

Bottle, split with after4ever. Pours a cloudy dark gold with a lacy white head. Aroma of fruit with sweet citrus hints. Creamy medium body, light carbonation. Sweet caramel apple and candy taste that dries out in time for the finish.
I guess i got a bad one. Mine had a strong taste of sour milk, and was very yeasty. I hope to rerate again soon.
wow, bubble gum aroma surrounded by yeast. pale gold. chewy hubba bubba initial flavor, pineapple and melon. farmhouse finish

375, capped. No foil. Pours a beautiful cloudy medium ambr with a puffy, pillowing, billowing platinum blonde head. Highly sweet and floral perfumy nose with lots of green apple. Medium body with some fizz. Beautifully considered nut and toast notes envelop those floral green apple bits to comprise the mid-palate. Long apple and walnut finish. Tastes like Christmas candy. Not anywhere near the cleanest or crispest tripel I have had, but a pleasure to drink and definitely beautifully done. I guess this just falls on the sugary end of the tripel spectrum.
Feb. 2007 - Pour golden yellow with nice head and lacing. Delicious fruity aroma. Flavor was fruits, spices and a touch of caramel...even a touch of hops. Tons of action in this one. Scrumptious!

Pours hazy bubbly golden with thick, dense white head with lots of lace. Floral and lightly citrus hops in the nose along with doughy grain aroma. Flavor is fruity, lightly sweet, orange and lemon, some deeper fruity esters  apple, peach - hints of herbal hops along with crisp resiny bitterness, lingering bitter and very light alcohol burn in the aftertaste. Mouthfeel is very lively, bubbly, rich and textured. I likey.

Hazy golden color with a hug white head.  Smells of fruit and champagne.  Almost tastes more like a bittered champagne.  Reminds me of eating green apples with the skin on.  Long slightly bitter finish.  I prefer the classic over this.

Bottle, Cambrinus, Brugge. Slightly cloudy blonde, thin white head. Nose is sherberty, medicinal, some sweet funkiness. Weird warmness. Mouth is long, sweet, slightly metallic, sweet fruit. Some maltiness. Odd for a tripel. Not a fan though.

(bottle from AZ): Pours a very pale golden yellow color. Somewhat cloudy. Big foamy white head, big bubbles, mostly lasting. Floral sweet aroma, light. Light grapes, sugary. Some alcohol,a little hops. Soft floral taste, some rubbing alcohol. Warming up...less alcoholy, a little warming. Very light flavor.
750 ml btl from fourwinds...wow..a little darker than most triples..this is deffently one you should tryout..one of my favs..can taste the alc though

Hazy dull yellow with a medium white head, dense. I left the last half-inch in the bottle as there were huge floculent particles in the sediment. Aroma of boiled pasta, bread dough, and alcohol. Malty creamy palate, predominantly bready flavour with floral notes and maybe a bit of lemon in the finish with alcohol steadily apparent. BBD of 2009, but something seems wrong with that. Disappointing to say the least.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: UPDATED: AUG 29, 2010 cloudy goldblond coloured sparkling  body with a  huches white head a spicy fruity  hoppy aroma a spicy yeasty sweet fruity  bitter taste and a bitter alcoholic finish

Hazy, "cerise de terre" colored, good head but poor retention, yet the bubbling is small and compact. Aroma of butter, ripe lemon, pear and pepper. The aroma is not bright, in terms of intensity and 3d. Flavor is moderately sweet and taken over by an ethylic bitterness, perhaps somewhat reminiscent of wood. The texture is buttery, oily and smooth, even sensual! Very enjoyable, but could be more precisely defined as for the aroma and flavor.

75 cl. bottle pours a light amber fluid with a decent two finger white head. Smells peppery, lemongrass.Medium bodied with a bubbley, lively mouthfeel. Superb lemongrass, black pepper, leather, and woody oak wine barrel taste. Finishes with a slight hop - alcohol tang. Another great Belgium triple.2003
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Golden with medium head. Sweet yeasty and fruity aroma. Flavor is sweet with orange, yeast and spicy notes.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2010 Rating January 2008: Just one of the finest belgium beers. A cloudy yellow coloured beer, fulle palate, spicy bitter taste.
Rating August 2010: Clear blond coloured beer with large white head and lots of carbonation. Hoppy spicy aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is spicy hopyy ending bitter dry. This beers belongs to the top in Belgium.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2009 Just looking through some rates and I seem to disagree with most. This seems fairly heavy and I can taste the aclohol. Liqourice possibly, I dont like that.All that said, Im enjoying it. Sharp flavours that if I knew more about beer I could tell you. Try one, very nice. Re-rate hmmm much better now. Love it.

Pours a cloudy golden color into the tulip glass.  An inch of fluffy white head stuck around for a while.  Scents of bananas, malt and spices.  Beautiful fruity tastes with malt and yeast in the finish.  Excelleny tripel.
Very nice fruit aroma.  Great flavor with nice spice character and a good yeast flavor.  Alcohol is very noticiblen but it has a nice full body that makes it a very nice treat.

ONE OF MY FAVORITES, AN ABSOLUTE PARTY IN THE MOUTH, POURS A CLOUDY GOLDEN COLOR, AROMA IS SWEET, LIKE FRUITS OR ALMOST CANDY, FLAVOR IS THE SAME, HINTS OF HONEY AND FRUIT WITH THAT VERY PRESENT 9% ALC, FULL MOUTH, NOT A VERY LINGERING AFTERTASTE BUT GOES DOWN SMOOTH, AND LEAVES YOU IN A SMOOTH STATE, VERY GOOD

Pous a lightly cloudy gold color, with a medium frothy white head.  smells of Belgian candy sugar, sticky sweet fruits, and some yeast.  Nice sharp smell.  The flavor was much the same, with all the standard flavors of a tripel.  Not overly sweet, with a definite good dosage of alcohol which was noticeable throughout.  The fruits seem to keep the sweetness at bay for the most part.  Not my favorite style, but this is well crafted.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2008 Pours a cloudy golden color with thick, foamy white head.  Nice fuity aroma of apple, pear and grape.  Very pleasantly crisp with hints of lighter fruits such as apple, pear and grape with a nice alcohol balance rendering it not too sweet.  I enjoyed this beer very much.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy golden yellow with some sediment.  Nose was sweet and fruity.  Head was big and frothy, left nice lacing.  On the palet it was very creamy.  Again very fruity and sweet.  A great triple!

UPDATED: APR 24, 2010 Slightly hazy yellow-tan.  No head.  The aroma is lemony with some limey notes - kind of sugary like a soda, too.  The palate is lemony and fresh, with a mellow malt backing and just enough hop dryness to pull it all together.  OK brew, better than last time I had it.
Mild banana and spice aroma, beautiful head, golden and delicious.  Floral notes and some caramel, plenty of yeast flavor throughout.  A great beer.

bottle 11.2 oz. Hazy amber gold with large white head that shimmers and seems viscous & sticky. Aroma is spicey, mildly sweet malt, roasted caramelized sugars, Belgian yeast and some perfume, mild herbs with a floral trace of Benedictine. Flavor is medium body, silky smooth, creamy malt with the characteristics described in the aroma. This is a refined quality triple. Nice complexity. Alcohol is warming and noticable but not distracting.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with large creamy white mostly lasting head. Fruity aroma. Sweet fruity flavor with notes of  yeast and alcohol.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2007 Yellow with a dense head. Aroma of metallic orange peals, yeast, sugar and camomille. A sweet and spicy beer with a hint of bitterness.
This beer was a huge delight to drink, it had a golden/yellow body and its aroma and flavor had an incredibly strong taste of lemons.
Rich flavors. Deep color. A really nice beer that deserves higher ratings here. Pours a nice malty body. Not too sweet. But nice and "brown."

Bootle (50 cl ) from Barley Wine, Copenhagem, Denmark. Cloudy yellow with a medium creamy white head. Fruity aroma with clear notes of marzipan, yeast, and spices. Alcohol well hidden. Medium bodied and smooth with soft but lively carbonation. Starts off sweet but ends up dry with a long bitter finish.
Golden color with thick white head.  Very light stone fruit in the nose and flavor.  Some alcohol and a little bitterness as well.

27/10 0.33 l bottle at Hopdevil. Pours murky golden body with nice big head. Wonderful aroma of fruits with specific yeast. Flavor nice, quite sweet, not too complex though, but very full bodied. Alcohol is not really felt. May not be typical as it lacks that triple bitterness, but its still fantastic. Creamy texture on palate. Finish is very nice, sweet, pleasant and quite long. Another fantastic brew from this fantastic brewery.
On tap. Nice golden/copper color with dense white foam. Aroma of ripe peaches. Excellent lacing. A very enjoyable tripel that finishes slightly tart with peppery notes. Worthy of 2 glasses!
Golden colour with white fluffy head.Sweet and heavy aroma of Orange peel and sugar,spicey and warming mouth feels with sweet finish.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2010 Very cloudy, verging on murky. Big white head. Aroma of spiced stewed banana, some soap. Slight sour too. Palate is sticky, chewy, and tacky. Flavors are pretty nice, there is some spice to balance the sweetness. Gloriously average tripel!Bottle...pours almost clear, lots of bubbles rising, the head is moderately stable. Is quite unattractive really with a bland golden color and lifeless head. The aroma is sweet, candi sugar, but has attendant fruit complexity with some simple plum and nectarine aromas. Palate is fizzy, prickly, way too gassy. Flavors are alright, fruity-spicy with a thankfully dry finish.

On tap, from old notes.  Pours a hazy deep gold with fluffy white foam, decent retention and lacing.  Aroma is fairly heavy on banana like yeast notes with some candy-ish sugar notes and hints of coriander and Saaz hops.  Flavor is fairly sweet, good bit of banana, lots of coriander, very nice hoppiness in the finish.  A very complex, if not a little too sweet, Tripel
Pours cloudy, tan, with a fine, white, moderate head. Aroma is spicy with citrus and banana. Full mouth feel. Very peppery, spicy, with citrus and banana qualities. Pleasantly, and lightly, complex.

33 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a white lasting head. Small sediments floating around in the beer. Caramel malty aroma with a slight yeasty spice note beneath, minor orange peel aroma too. Spiced caramel malty flavour, somewhat astringent and far from as mellow as other triples. Finish has a rather warming alcohol finish.

750 Ml Bottle-Poured a hazy, golden/orange color w/a moderate foamy head. Classic Belgian aroma, sweet flavors of cane sugar, orange peel, colander, & bread dough. Very smooth & flavorful, easy drinking brew. Alcohol is well hidden. Long spicy finish. This one was a keeper, would age well, but its good now.
Bottled @ Belgian Beer Cafe, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. A hazy orange beer with a creamy white head. Aroma is fruity and spicy. Taste is sweet, spicy and malty.
On draft at the brewery tap, March 2007. Gold coloured with a large white head. Aroma of sweet malt, coriander and citrus. The flavour had more spice, honey and a dry finish. Very enjoyable.

330ml brown bottle. Gold in colour, huge white head. Aroma is sweet with caramel and orange notes, also some spice. Sweet malt flavour with orange, lemon and honey. Spicy yeast and citrus come out in the dry finish. Medium body, crisp tingly carbonation. Het Ankers beers continue to impress me.
not too spicey, but a little peppery; some honey sweetness; lemon notes; pleasent yeastiness; some mango and orange fruitiness; dry finish; yum.

Bottle: Poured a golden to hazy yellow, with a thick white head. The aroma is very citrus and spice. Taste is similar very citrus not sour but tangy to the taste buds. Not something I would drink normally, but a nice change of pace beer.

excellent..hazy amber pour with buff white head..aroma of honey, lemon, spice, yeast, and indistinct tropical notes..flavor is slightly musty and sour, with hints of white grape, lemon, yeast, and heavy spice...

Bottled.
This one must have been off. Hazy blond, a blit vinous/sourish, but it shows sure signs of being either infected or stored improperly.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur dorée et semi-voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes, bananes, léger de poires et de pommes, notes de pêches), malté de sucre bonbon, léger de caramel, de pain et de gomme balloune, moyen dépices (clou de girofle, léger de coriandre et de poivre) et léger dalcool et de houblon floral. Moyenne-ronde en bouche avec un pétillement plutôt élevé et une texture crémeuse et aux petites notes sirupeuses. Goût de levures fruitées (oranges sucrées, poires, moyen de bananes et de pommes, léger de pêches sucrées, notes de figues) avec un goût épicé (clou de girofle, léger de coriandre, notes de cannelle) et des notes de gomme balloune ainsi que des petites traces boisées lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté de sucre bonbon et léger de caramel avec des notes de pain et de miel parallèlement à un moyen goût dalcool réchauffant (faibles notes métalliques) puis en finale lon retrouve un goût asséchant et moyennement amer de houblon floral (notes herbeuses) ainsi quun goût de levures épicées (poivre). Post-goût long et plutôt sec, moyennement amer de levures, de houblon floral et dalcool moyen ainsi quun goût fruité (zest dagrumes, pelures de pommes, notes de pelures de bananes).

750ml bottle.  Hazy yellow color, with a thick white head.  The flavor is of bananas, and a sweetness I cant pin down.  The flavor is a mix of sweetness with bitterness thrown in.  A little spice, honey, and hops, with a finish of some yeast.  Nice warming sensation and the alcohol isnt too obvious.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2009 
Name: Gouden Carolus Triple
Date: July 01, 2002
Mode: Bottle
Source: Norms, DC
Appearance: Hazy yellow, big frothy white head
Aroma: big banana aroma
Flavor: rapid succession of flavors: sweet, tart, and bitter; banana character makes a late appearance to turn it into a slightly sweet banana laced tripple
Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20
Rating: 3.4/5.0Score: **4

The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.
33cl bottle from Aarschott.  Poured a golden color with white, creamy head.  Very nice tripel with large floral notes.

Medium white head. Golden body. Full, deep, soft golden fruity sweetish aroma of milky honey, malts, toffee, spice, and hops. Incredible harmony and balance; almost perfect. Sharp, spicy milky honey taste with notes of tobacco and fruit. Dry, musty malty tobacco aftertaste. (0.33l bottle from Dorstvlegel, Antwerp. Probably not a perfect bottle. Want to rerate. And rerate. And rerate.)

Bottle. Malt aromas of caramel, hop notes of herbs, and beef broth for the yeast. In the background there was a smell that was somewhere between grape and raisin, with a strong note of ripe pear, and alcohol. The head was fizzy and quickly diminished. The color was a slightly hazy amber. Flavor started lightly sweet and finished the same sweetness and moderately acidic. Palate was light to medium, watery, with a fizzy carbonation. It finished lightly astringent. There was a stronger malt aroma than I expected, and so many more fruity notes were present after it warmed. The taste was just a little disappointing, but all in all this is a fine drinking triple.
Bottle.  Golden/orangey looking beer with a strong head.  The aroma is quite spiced and mulled, the flavour is vinous, warming, and sweetly spiced.  Overall a very reasonable beer.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2008 Very carbinated. Golden amber color,  thick white head with tiny bubbles. Great aroma of light fruits and candy yeast. After initial carbination, taste loaded with fruits and  malt.
Hazy body. White bubbly head. this comes fully loaded with fruits and sweet malt in both aroma and taste. The palate is very good! I must try this again!

Pours a rich gold with a thick, bubbly head.  Aroma of yeast and sweet maltiness.  The initial flavor is creamy and slightly bitter, followed by a robust, malty aftertaste.  The lacing is good, and the beer is quite refreshing, yet also full bodied.

Poured into an authentic Gouden Carolus goblet, this is light and cloudy in appearance, with moderate head and fizziness. The primary flavor is peach, and in a big way. It is quite refreshing and somewhat light, despite the 9% alcohol. So far I like the two Gouden Carolus varieties Ive tried!

On tap at Three Floyds Brewpub, and served in a Gouden Carolus trappist glass.  This tripel poured a bright, hazy  orange color with a long lasting beige head.  The aroma was made up of orange, apple, candy sugar, and some mild yeast esthers.  The flavor was the same, but with some excellent spice notes showing up.  Also, some lightly warming alcohol made its presence known.  The mouthfeel was full-bodied  and champagne-like.  A truly exceptional beer.

750ml.
$7.99
Sams Downers Grove

Corked in 05

Gouden Carolus Triple poured a slightly hazy peach that glows when held to the light. A loose airy 1+ finger white head formed on the pour but receded to a ring around the glass within seconds. Leaves no lacing. 

This is one fruity and spicy tripel. Big aromas of pear and granny smith apple greet you as soon as you stick your nose in the glass. Candi sugar and spicy alcohol follow close behind adding a nice depth. 

Candi sugar sweetness and big juicy peach start things off with a bang. A pear grittiness and mild green apple show up mid palate along with a doughy malt base. Spicy alcohol, mild clove and a yeasty fruitness come along on the finish that make this one great tasting tripel.

Body is on the lighter side of medium with a velvety feel when hitting the tongue. The seeming lack of carbonation is in the mouthfeel but in small doses. Just enough to make the body velvety smooth.

This is a danderously drinkable tripel considering the high abv. My glass is disappearing far to quickly.

One of the better tripels so far expierenced in my drinking days. Good popping fruitiness with an exceptionally spicy and deep alcohol and yeast quality. Wonderful beer.

7/22/07

Big bottle. Pours a very nice deep golden colour with a huge very lively well lasting creamy white head leaving a very nice thick lacing all around the glass. Fresh fruity aroma with yeast, citrus, malt and some alcohol. Great well filling champagne mouthfeel. The flavour is sweet with a nice soft fruitiness, yeast, citrus, some spices, good hops and a well hidden touch of alcohol. Good long lasting fruity and bit spiced finish. GREAT!

After the great cider purge of 2007, this one comes in at rating no. 1250.  Bottle, corked and caged.  Sweet aroma, yeasty with sugar and a touch of apple juice.  Hazy golden with a beautiful white head, rocky and full.  Taste is smooth and lightly crisp, yeast and light citrus blended well with light flowers and lighter apple juice.  Spicy and a bit pushy, lots of heft from the alcohol without being overbearing.  Ending acidity does wonders to balance out the sweetness.  A really pleasant surprise - I wasnt expecting this kind of monster!

Bottle, 75cl, from LIVA Domhusgade, Kolding. Slightly hazy golden yellow with a big bubbly, white head. Aroma has a youghurt feel, lots of oranges, bananas, yeast og a floral edge. Nicely carbonated. Flavour is mild, slightly fruity - a little tarty at the end. There is no apparent alcohol, but there is a warming sensation when I swallow. A very nice brew - one of the best tripels Ive had :o)

Hazy straw color with a large, lasting foamy, white head.  Excellent aroma.  Spicy, hops, banana, citrus (oranges, grapefruit), floral, and some yeast.  Flavor is spicy, yeast, alcohol (which was hiding in the aroma), citrus hops, cinnamon, and dark fruits.  Creamy, spicy body.  Very suprised by this beer that I have passed over again and again.  Excellent.
Flaske. En rigtig god triple, med alt hvad den skal have. Lækker duft af triple gær og den diskrete efterduft af hvede. Ligger godt i munden.
From my fall 2006 notebook.  Hazy yellow gold body with ample head.  Spicy nose with plenty of hops.  Dry hoppy body that pairs exceedingly well with buffalo.

Beautiful golden body with a full white head.  Strong aroma of a hay field plus tons of sweet sugary stuff plus fruit and spices.  The mouthfeel is amazing.  Maybe one of the creamiest beers Ive had.  Very buttery  tasting with an after taste that might be a bit too sweet.

Pours hazy golden with a medium off-white or tan head.  Nose is spicy yeast, dates, cinnamon.  Flavor of figs and dates, cinnamon and basil and allspice.  Quite sweet and malty, honeyed towards the middle, with a strongly alcoholic finish.  Lingering spicy and honeyed aftertaste almost like bakleva.  Oily mouthfeel.  Good

Good beer, very fruity, Very fruity and floral aroma.  Taste is of figs, citrus and caramel a little sweet for my taste which cost it only slightly in the ratings.  Mouthfeel is good and finish is pleseant.

Exquisite! Lots of esters, fine carbonation, fine tang on the tongue. Definite warming effect. Lightly tarnished brass color. Bananas and ripe exotic fruit in the now. Fine lace. Slightly dry in the finsih. Good burps.  Had this one at Bodega Brew Pub, downtown La Crosse, Wis. USA

Bottle, IBS, Perth, WA
Nice spicy, and dry aroma, with a hint of noble hops. Dry and crisp flavours, with a weighty mouthfeel. A very good triple
Aroma of yeast, fruit very fresh. The flavor is yeaty, malty and has some fruit. Similar to a witbier, but it has a lot more to offer!

0.33 l bottle. Copper color with thick head. Sweetish and fruity aroma with orange, pineapple and some phenols. Sweetish and orangey flavor with herbal hops and honeyish malt. Alcohol is soft and  warming, not at all sharp. Very balanced and well made!

Different not your average tripel.  The cork hit the ceiling without hardly touching it.  Poured a golden color with good head and good lacing.  Lots of honey in the aroma and light fruits.  Flavor had a lot of grapes in it and honey/floral to it as well. Very smooth beer. Eagle said like a mead i would have to agree.
UPDATED: OCT 9, 2008 Lightly buttery yeast aroma.  Flavor has a nice citrus aspect, like lemon peel with the pith.  Dried herbal hop finish.

On tap @ Chez Moeder Lambic. Pours translucent dark gold with lacy white head. Aroma is faint, but I think honey, oranges and yeasty notes are there. Initial honey-caramel-burnt sugar sweetness is short-lived, then comes the star of the show: an awesome balance of that sweetness, a mildly hoppy bitterness, and the alcohol. The bitterness combines with dryness in the finish to coat the tongue. An excellent example of the style, which is too often poorly executed.

Pours a hazy amber golden type color, nice frothy head, decent retention, good lacing. The cork pop was loud, and shot across the room almost hitting my wife (yikes!). The aroma was honey, must, candied grapes. The flavor was candied apples and grapes, firm honey presence (almost mead like w/ some floral aspects), wheat notes. No hop presence in the finish for a triple, and the yeast was also noticeably absent. Mouthfeel was smooth, honey/mead-like. A nice twist to the style, very interesting, not an orthodox tripel.

[309-20070510] Bottle (w/ jerc). Smells like sweet nail polish, alcoholic banana and some pine wood. Hazy, golden yellow orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Sweet alcoholic flavour, slightly woody, some banana notes. Medium-full body. Blending fine but very boozy.
Cloudy golden yellow with fluffy white head.  Sweet honey and nectar aroma.  Taste of honey and nectar with a good citrus backbone.  Semi-dry alcohoic finish.

Golden blond pour with a fluffy milky white head. wheat, hoppy spice on the nose with an orange yeasty zest.  Malty on the palate with a subtle hint of a figgy toffe quality.  A flowery, lightly spiced hoppy kick towards the end.  Echoes of cloves and pepper.  The alcohol flavor is definately present but not overwhelming, and has a warming effect too.
Bottle. Hazy amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruits, malt, caramel and alcohol.

Clear, pale yellow with a small white head. Sweet and fruity notes (prunes?).
Taste is sweet with some fruit. Full bodied with a nice, bittersweet finish.

Strong carbonation... seconds after removing the cage, the cork shot to the ceiling unexpectedly and nearly took my head off. Pours a cloudy honey color with a thick, fluffy long lasting head. The nose is a wheaty, slightly sour fruit, with a hint of alcohol. The taste is a bit of sour apple, spices, pepper... It has a nice balanced blend of sweet and tart. Very good.
330 ml bottle.  Very sweet aroma.  Medium carbonation.  Nice golden color.  Caramel taste.  Very nice.

Sampled from 750ml bottle.  Hazy and golden hued.  White head.  Floral and caramel nose.  Sticky and honeyish.  Touch bready.  Lively effervescence.  Medium to full bodied.  Dry palate.  Floral yeasty flavors.  Good bitter finish.

Pours into the chalice a hazy golden-orange color. Produces a beautiful thick, dense pillow-like head with superb retention. An intricate lacing pattern of foam adheres to the sides of the glass. The nose is a bit muted, but with pleasant fruity notes of pineapple, banana, vanilla wafer cookies and honey in the forefront. A faint touch of yeast, light malts, spice and perfume linger in the background. Mouthfeel is perfectly balanced between the velvety smooth and creamy texture of a big beer and the expected tingle of CO2 from a Belgian Ale. Flavor profile a bit more assertive than the aroma. Starts out with a fruity, malty sweetness; very much like the nose. Then gradually moves into a slight peppery, spicy alcohol presentation and finally finishes with a somewhat surprising, but slightly astringent moderately bitter hoppy finish. All in all a solid Triple save for the slightly distracting finish. Id definitely go back for more.

Bottle (expired 17-12-2005) at home - Thanks jeppe.
Unclear amber - white head.
Aroma: Sweetness, fruity, yeasty, light honey, flowery.
Taste: Sweetness, flowery, dusty, honey, ryebread, elderflowers,
light fruity, light light alcholic mouthburn.
Nice.

11,2 oz bottle.  Served in a Delirium Tremens tulip glass.  Aroma of pale malts and saaz hops.   Bright golden beer with a thick creamy white head and sheets of lacing.  Flavor is sweet pale malts and booze to start, fading to a hoppy presence with a mildly bitter finish.  I love triples.  Smooth, sweet, alcoholic and hoppy.   Fruity and peppery, and a strong yeastiness.   This one looks good and tastes good.   A world class beer from a brewery that deserves its high reputation.

Brown bottle, 33 cl, best before 28.08.09, savoured on June 7 2007; eye: golden, lightly hazy, voluminous white head that falls but remains throughout the tasting, good lacing, slight effervescence; nose: apple, yeast, fruity, banana, alcohol, lime; mouth: in that order, quite carbonated, creamy, lightly fruity, pepper from the alcohol, light vanilla, hops, malt, long finale where the pepper of the alcohol becomes quite present, a bit dry, mildly sweet, lightly bitter, medium body, a bit thin, creamy and alcoholic texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 33 cl, meilleure avant 28.08.09, savourée le 7 juin 2007; il : dorée, légèrement voilée, mousse blanche abondante qui tombe mais demeure, bonne dentelle, très légère effervescence; nez : pomme, levure, fruitée, banane, alcool, lime; bouche : dans cet ordre, pas mal carbonatée, crémeuse, léger fruité, poivre de lalcool, légère vanille, houblon, malt, longue finale où le poivre de lalcool devient très présent, un peu sèche, moyennement sucrée, légèrement amère, corps moyen, un peu mince, texture crémeuse et alcoolique; en résumé : bien
Hazy straw colour with white head. Apricot, peach nose with some hints of yeast. Fruity flavour, with belgian yeast. Some hints of vanilla. Slight spicy finish with a dry note.

On tap at the Yardhouse in San Diego. Nice deep golden appearance with a light vanilla head on it. Very fruity aroma, thick with Belgian yeast and lots of banana, pear and strong alcohol in the aroma. Flavor reminds me somewhat of Gulden Draak, although lighter and fluffier. Sweet malty flavor with peppery spice and a good hops finish. Palate is quite carbonated, yet smoothed by the dry alcohol finish.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2007 75cl bottle. Freebie at Hotel Carolus, My favourite brewery does not disappoint! Loads of vanilla, coriander, grains and orange in aroma and taste. Its full of flavour, but quite subtle. Lacking the harshness of other tripels. The best Ive had to date.

Dark golden body, somewhat hazy, with a very persistent dense head and good lacing. Bready, floral and sweet aroma with vanilla, honey, coriander, white pepper, some alcohol and a strong grainyness. Good malt-profile in the taste, quite heavy on the sweetness, with some light spicy (Saaz) hoppiness to balance it out. Pleasant tartness from the yeast. Long, bready finish. Quite lively on the palate, but not overly so. A very solid tripel.
Part of a bottle. Golden. A bit fruity and bitter. The version on tap is better.

750 mL bottle via Lubiere, served cool in a tulip glass. MA19/07
App.:  Cloudy deep golden, fair off-white head, generous lacing.
  
Aroma:  Very sweet, candi sugar, some dried fruits, peaches and apricots, some molasses and brown sugar; a little honey and alcohol.  Yummy.
  
Palate:  Syrupy, medium bodied, mildly effervescent carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Salty-sweet, honey, floral, peaches and other fruits; more brown sugar and candied fruits, some yeastiness; restrained bitterness, a little warming alcohol, definitely mouth-coating.  I get some cardboard toocan it be??  And brown (oxidized) apples.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2011 Another winner from this brewery, albeit one thats not quite at the level of the Grand Cru (or possibly even of the underrated Ambrio). Its got all the qualities I look for in a tripel - rich flavor of sweet malt and tart fruit, slight heat - but is simply a bit too thin on the mouthfeel. That aside, its more than solid and Ill return to it again.

Bottle. Hazy golden body with a big billowy white head. Sweet boozy aroma is yeasty with light sweet lemon notes that are intriguing. Ephemeral notes of banana. Flavour of sweet pale malt, dry alcohol, fruity esters and light sweet lemon. (7+) Average to medium palate. Interesting but it is not my favourite triple ever.

750 from Town and Country Liquors.  The first aroma is spicy cinnamon, pepper alcohol and fruit.  The strong alcohol flavor comes out as it warms.  The finish is sweet and citrusy.  Ive only had 2 from this brewery... they have both been great.

Spice: anise, black pepper, citrus peel, and... curry?
Alcohol rounds off the beer, ending with a let off in the flavor the department, but works well with the dominate spicy tastes.

Bottle:  Big yeasty aroma wiht moderate banana, apple, spice, pepper, and a hint of alcohol.  It pours a transparent golden-orange with a big creamy white head with great retention and a thick coating of lacing.  The flavor starts with mdoerate apple, bubblegum, and light banana.  The finish has very light flowery bitterness, light orange peel, and a hint of pepper.  There is a very mild tartness in the background.

Golden, hazy with an incredibly nice and lasting head. The aroma is sweetish with notes of fruit and malt. The flavour is sweet with notes of candy sugar, fruit - especially lime. The alcohol is a bit too dominating, but its a really nice trippel.
Pours golden with a thin white bubblie head. Aroma is fruity, malty and honey.Taste is crrip, sweet. buuteerscotch. Nicly carbinated.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2007 Almost clear blonde body topped by a long-lasting medium white head.  Thick body with lots of crisp malts.  Alcohol is apparent.
